1.tool_name: Placeholder text API for your application
1.tool_description: Placeholder text API for your application is a tool that can generate placeholder text. This tool has one built-in function: 1. Generate placeholder text is to generate placeholder text of varying sizes (small, medium, or large) based on the specified 'length' parameter.

Generate placeholder text.name: Generate placeholder text
Generate placeholder text.description: Generates placeholder text of varying sizes (small, medium, or large) based on the specified 'length' parameter. Returns the text as a response or an appropriate error message if the API call fails.

required_parameters.name: length
required_parameters.description:
Specifies what size placeholder text you want in the response.
The \"length\" param must be one of the following:
- small
- medium
- large

example.User Query: I'm working on a presentation and need a medium-sized block of placeholder text for a slide, can you provide that?

2.tool_description: html5tomp4 is a tool that can convert HTML5 animations to MP4 videos for social media posts. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. getResult is to retrieve the result of a rendering job based on the provided job ID. 2. renderClip is to convert an HTML5 page to a .mp4 video.

getResult.name: getResult
getResult.description: Retrieve the result of a rendering job based on the provided job ID. The response 'jobId not found' may indicate an invalid or non-existent job ID, or occur during job processing or due to errors. It is crucial to verify the job ID's correctness before assuming a problem with the job.

required_parameters.name: job_id
required_parameters.description: The numbers of items to return

example.User Query: Could you please check the status of job ID 67890 and provide me with the result once it's ready?

renderClip.name: renderClip
renderClip.description: Convert an HTML5 page to a .mp4 video using the renderClip function, with a focus on troubleshooting potential import errors.

example.User Query: Investigate the recent error encountered during video conversion and ensure the renderClip function is fully operational.

3.tool_description: qrcode-generator-base64 is a tool that can generate QR codes for various types of data, including text, URLs, phone numbers, SMS messages, and email addresses. This tool has one built-in function: 1. qrcode is to generate QR codes in base64 image format, requiring a specified name parameter.

qrcode.name: qrcode
qrcode.description: A tool for generating QR codes in base64 image format, requiring a specified name parameter.

example.User Query: Design a QR code with a custom logo and personalized text for a wedding invitation

Parameters.name: WeddingInvitationQR
Parameters.text: Save the Date

4.tool_description: UptoSite Link Shortener is a tool that can shorten long URLs and retrieve the original long URL from a shortened URL. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. Get Long URL is to retrieve the original long URL associated with a shortened URL by providing the slug parameter. 2. Short URL is to shorten long URLs, but it is currently facing technical issues that hinder successful shortening.

Get Long URL.name: Get Long URL
Get Long URL.description: Retrieve the original long URL associated with a shortened URL by providing the slug parameter. An error message is returned if the provided slug does not match any shortened URL in the system. The API response includes the full original URL when a valid slug is provided.

example.User Query: I want to know the full original URL for the shortened link 'special-slug-456'.

Short URL.name: Short URL
Short URL.description: This tool is intended to shorten long URLs, but it is currently facing technical issues that hinder successful shortening. Users may encounter errors during the shortening process due to functionality issues. It is recommended to address the existing limitations and improve the tool's performance for a smoother user experience.

example.User Query: I encountered an issue while trying to use a URL shortening tool. Can you provide insights into the common causes of errors and potential solutions to improve the tool's performance?

5.tool_description: Pattern Monster is a tool that can create customizable SVG patterns for your projects. This tool has one built-in function: 1. Get SVG Pattern is to generate intricate SVG patterns with customizable parameters such as scale, angle, colors, stroke join, spacing, and stroke.

Get SVG Pattern.name: Get SVG Pattern
Get SVG Pattern.description: Generate intricate SVG patterns with customizable parameters such as scale, angle, colors, stroke join, spacing, and stroke.

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description:
Name of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
(Default: Random name if not specified)

optional_parameters.name: scale
optional_parameters.description:
0.5 to Max Scale of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
(Default: Random scale if not specified)

optional_parameters.name: moveLeft
optional_parameters.description: 0 - 100 ( Default: 0 )

optional_parameters.name: angle
optional_parameters.description: 0 - 360 (Default: Random angle if not specified)

optional_parameters.name: strokeJoin
optional_parameters.description:
round or square 
(Default: round)
Valid only for patterns with Stroke Join as specified at https://pattern.monster/api

optional_parameters.name: moveTop
optional_parameters.description: 0 - 100 ( Default: 0 )

optional_parameters.name: colors
optional_parameters.description:
2 to Max Colors of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
Format: Color1|Color2|Color3|Color4|Color5
At least, two colors are required if specified
(Default: Random colors if not specified)
Accepted color values: 
CSS colors ( eg. aqua, red )
RGB or RGBA colors ( eg. rgb(59,130,246), rgba(234,179,8,0.7) )
HSL or HSLA colors ( eg. hsl(300, 76%, 72%), hsla(147,50%,47%,0.5) )
HEX colors without the hash symbol ( eg. E11D48, 2563eb )

optional_parameters.name: spacing
optional_parameters.description:
Horizontal Spacing | Vertical Spacing
(Default: 0|0)
Max Spacing of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
Valid only for patterns with Max Spacing other than 0|0

optional_parameters.name: stroke
optional_parameters.description:
0.5 to Max Stroke of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
(Default: Random stroke if not specified)
Valid only for patterns with Mode as Stroke

example.User Query: I'd like to create an SVG pattern with a scale of 2.5, an angle of 90 degrees, stroke join as square, colors in blue and green, and a stroke of 1.5.

This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. Pascal Versions is to provide insights into the features associated with different versions of the Pascal programming language. 2. Pascal Code Compiler is to compile Pascal code files and manage error handling.

Pascal Versions.name: Pascal Versions
Pascal Versions.description: Provides insights into the features associated with different versions of the Pascal programming language, offering a list of Pascal versions like 'fpc 3.0.0', 'fpc-3.0.2', 'fpc-3.0.4', and 'fpc-3.2.2'. Users can understand the specific capabilities and enhancements introduced in each version.

Pascal Code Compiler.name: Pascal Code Compiler
Pascal Code Compiler.description: Pascal Code Compiler tool for compiling Pascal code files, with a focus on importing the 'pascal_code_compiler' function and managing error handling.

example.User Query: How does the Pascal Code Compiler tool manage error handling for Pascal code files?

7.tool_description: Cars image background removal is a tool that can remove the background from images of cars. This tool has three multiple built-in functions: 1. Get version is to return the current version of the service. 2. Get list of available modes is to provide options for background removal results. 3. Remove background from photo of a car and return results is to remove the background from an image of a car and offer various output modes such as foreground mask, foreground image with shadow, and more.

Get version.name: Get version
Get version.description: Returns the current version of the service in the format `vX.Y.Z`, where X represents the major version, Y represents the minor version, and Z represents the patch version of the API. Note: The response may not match the queried version directly.

example.User Query: Can you provide details on the compatibility requirements for version v2.1.0 of the service?

Get list of available modes.name: Get list of available modes
Get list of available modes.description: The service offers five options for background removal results: Image with foreground object, Image with foreground object and shadow, Image with foreground object hidden clipping path, Image with foreground object and shadow along with hidden clipping path, and Mask of foreground.

example.User Query: Is it possible to adjust the transparency level of the foreground object in the background removal result?

Remove background from photo of a car an.name: Remove background from photo of a car and return results
Remove background from photo of a car an.description: This API removes the background from an image of a car and offers various output modes such as foreground mask, foreground image with shadow, and more. The input image must be a regular JPEG or PNG file with a file size less than 16Mb.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description:
Note: Use this form data field if you want to pass image as a link to a public web resource. If you want to pass image as a binary file, please, use another field named `image`.

Image must be a regular JPEG or PNG image (with or without transparency). Usually such images have extensions: `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.png`. The service checks input file by MIME type and accepts the following types:
* `image/jpeg`
* `image/png`

The size of image file must be less than `16Mb`.

optional_parameters.name: image
optional_parameters.description:
Note: Use this form data field if you want to pass image as a binary file. If you want to pass image as a link to a public web resource, please, use another field named `url`.

Image must be a regular JPEG or PNG image (with or without transparency). Usually such images have extensions: `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.png`. The service checks input file by MIME type and accepts the following types:
* `image/jpeg`
* `image/png`

The size of image file must be less than `16Mb`.

optional_parameters.name: image-bg
optional_parameters.description:
Optional background image.

If the background image is passed then it's content will be blended below foreground object (aligned by the center). The final output image will have the same size as the main input image (not background image!). Meaningless if the mode is `fg-mask`.

Note: Use this optional form data field if you want to pass background image as a binary file. If you want to pass background image as a link to a public web resource, please, use another field named `url-bg`.

Image must be a regular JPEG or PNG image (with or without transparency). Usually such images have extensions: `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.png`. The service checks input file by MIME type and accepts the following types:
* `image/jpeg`
* `image/png`

The size of image file must be less than `16Mb`.

optional_parameters.name: url-bg
optional_parameters.description:
Optional background image.

If the background image is passed then it's content will be blended below foreground object (aligned by the center). The final output image will have the same size as the main input image (not background image!). Meaningless if the mode is `fg-mask`.

Note: Use this form data field if you want to pass image as a link to a public web resource. If you want to pass image as a binary file, please, use another field named `image-bg`.

Image must be a regular JPEG or PNG image (with or without transparency). Usually such images have extensions: `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.png`. The service checks input file by MIME type and accepts the following types:
* `image/jpeg`
* `image/png`

The size of image file must be less than `16Mb`.

optional_parameters.name: mode
optional_parameters.description:
Query parameter `mode` is optional and may be used to choose the format of the output image: foreground mask or foreground image. Also the foreground image could be returned with shadow under the object and hidden car license plate (if detected).
By default the service uses `fg-image`.

Available modes and expected content of the resulting image:
* `fg-image` (default) – the image with the foreground object (car). Here the result is a 4-channel (`RGBA`) PNG image where background is transparent. 
    * Areas recognized as car will have the same color values at output image as the original input image.
    * Areas recognized as background will be transparent at output image.
    * Pixels of output image near the car borders may be semi transparent.
* `fg-mask` – the mask of foreground object (car). In this case the result is a single-channel grayscale PNG image.
    * Areas recognized as foreground (car) will have white color.
    * Areas recognized as background will be black at output image.
    * Pixels of output image near to car borders may have gray values: the closer
     to black, the more likely the pixel is the background.
* `fg-image-shadow` – the image with the foreground object (car) and realistic shadow under the car. Image format is as in case of just the foreground object.
* `fg-image-hideclp` – the image with the foreground object (car) with hidden license plate. Image format is as in case of just the foreground object.
* `fg-image-shadow-hideclp` – the image with the foreground object (car) with realistic shadow and hidden license plate. Image format is as in case of just the foreground object.

example.User Query: I need to extract the foreground object (car) from an image and receive the output with a realistic shadow under the car. Can you provide the result with the realistic shadow effect?

Get Subdomains.description: Provide a domain name to fetch a list of associated subdomains in JSON format. The tool may return an empty list if no subdomains match the specified criteria.

9.tool_description: ProxyPage is a tool that can provide high-quality proxies for free with customizable filters. This tool has three built-in functions: 1. Random proxy is to get a random proxy with the ability to choose proxy type (HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5, CONNECT:25) and optionally select a country. 2. Tier2 is to request proxies based on specific parameters such as type, SSL support, limit, latency, anonymity, and country, with each requested proxy costing 1 credit. 3. Tier1 is to list tier 1 proxies with filters based on proxy type, limit, SSL support, anonymity, and country selection.

Random proxy.name: Random proxy
Random proxy.description: Get a random proxy with the ability to choose proxy type (HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5, CONNECT:25) and optionally select a country. Ensure proper error handling for any encountered issues.

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description: You can specify a country for a proxy that you want to be returened

example.User Query: I need a random proxy of type CONNECT:25 from the United Kingdom. Can you provide me with that?

Tier2.name: Tier2
Tier2.description: Tier 2 proxies API enables users to request proxies based on specific parameters such as type, SSL support, limit, latency, anonymity, and country. Each requested proxy costs 1 credit.

example.User Query: I need 40 SOCKS4 proxies from Japan with SSL support and latency less than 200ms.

Tier1.name: Tier1
Tier1.description: List tier 1 proxies with filters based on proxy type, limit, SSL support, anonymity, and country selection. Specify the proxy type (HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5, CONNECT:25), set the limit for the number of proxies returned, and filter by SSL support, anonymity, and country.

optional_parameters.name: latency
optional_parameters.description: ms latency for a proxy, everything that is below that value is returned

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description: You can specify a country for a proxy that you want to be returened

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the number of proxies returned, helps you control how many credits can be used

example.User Query: Provide me with tier 1 CONNECT:25 proxies with SSL support and anonymity from Australia with a limit of 50 proxies.

18.tool_description: Transportistas de Argentina is a tool that can provide information on offices, locations, and shipping prices for Andreani, Oca, and Correo Argentino in Argentina. This tool has 13 multiple built-in functions: 1. /tracking/correo_argentino/result_task/:task_id is to retrieve the delivery status result for a specific Task ID. 2. /cities/states/:stateIsoCode is to retrieve a list of cities associated with a specific state identified by its ISO code. 3. /cities/postcode/:stateIsoCode/:postCode is to retrieve a list of cities based on a specified postcode. 4. /cities/search/:stateIsoCode/:keyword is to search for cities in a specific state based on a keyword. 5. /cities/states is to retrieve a list of states in Argentina along with their corresponding ISO codes. 6. /quotes/city/correo_argentino/:weight/:stateIsoCodeSrc/:normalizeCityNameSrc/:stateIsoCodeDst/:normalizeCityNameDst is to retrieve shipping quotes from Correo Argentino based on weight, source state, source city, destination state, and destination city. 7. /quotes/postcode/oca/:cuit/:operativa/:cost/:weight/:volume/:postCodeSrc/:postCodeDst is to calculate the shipping quote for a package using OCA e-Pack service based on the specified weight, volume, and postcodes for source and destination. 8. /quotes/postcode/correo_argentino/:weight/:postCodeSrc/:postCodeDst is to retrieve shipping cost estimates for sending packages using Correo Argentino services between specified source and destination postcodes. 9. /tracking/correo_argentino/create_task/:service/:tracking_code is to create a task to retrieve tracking history for a given service and tracking code. 10. /offices/postcode/:service/:postCode is to retrieve a list of offices for a specific postal code and service provider. 11. /offices/search/:service/:stateIsoCode/:keyword is to retrieve a list of offices based on a keyword search within a specific state for a given postal service. 12. /bins/calculate is to calculate the ideal box size for shipping fragile items with varying dimensions and fragility levels. 13. /quotes/postcode/andreani/:clientNumber/:contractNumber/:officeIsoSrc/:postCodeDst is to retrieve a shipping quote for a specific destination postcode via Andreani using client and contract numbers along with the source office ISO code.

/tracking/correo_argentino/result_task/:.name: /tracking/correo_argentino/result_task/:task_id
/tracking/correo_argentino/result_task/:.description: Retrieve the delivery status result for a specific Task ID, which corresponds to the tracking number of a package. If the Task ID is not found, a 404 status code will be returned with a corresponding message.

example.User Query: I want to know the current location of my shipment with Task ID GHI789.

/cities/states/:stateIsoCode.name: /cities/states/:stateIsoCode
/cities/states/:stateIsoCode.description: Retrieve a list of cities associated with a specific state identified by its ISO code.

/cities/postcode/:stateIsoCode/:postCode.name: /cities/postcode/:stateIsoCode/:postCode
/cities/postcode/:stateIsoCode/:postCode.description: Retrieve a list of cities based on a specified postcode.

/cities/search/:stateIsoCode/:keyword.name: /cities/search/:stateIsoCode/:keyword
/cities/search/:stateIsoCode/:keyword.description: Search for cities in a specific state based on a keyword. Find cities within a state that match a specific keyword.

/cities/states.description: Retrieve a list of states in Argentina along with their corresponding ISO codes in JSON format. This API function provides essential geographical data for Argentina.

/quotes/city/correo_argentino/:weight/:s.name: /quotes/city/correo_argentino/:weight/:stateIsoCodeSrc/:normalizeCityNameSrc/:stateIsoCodeDst/:normalizeCityNameDst

/quotes/postcode/correo_argentino/:weigh.name: /quotes/postcode/correo_argentino/:weight/:postCodeSrc/:postCodeDst
/quotes/postcode/correo_argentino/:weigh.description: Retrieve shipping cost estimates for sending packages using Correo Argentino services between specified source and destination postcodes. Provide the source postcode, destination postcode, and package weight in kilograms to get accurate shipping quotes.

/tracking/correo_argentino/create_task/:.name: /tracking/correo_argentino/create_task/:service/:tracking_code
/tracking/correo_argentino/create_task/:.description: Create a task to retrieve tracking history for a given service and tracking code. Access the trace result by calling the endpoint /tracking/correo_argentino/result_task/:task_id after 20-60 seconds. Note the result is stored for about 1 hour. Be mindful of rate limits and the requirement for plan upgrades if quotas are exceeded.

/offices/postcode/:service/:postCode.name: /offices/postcode/:service/:postCode
/offices/postcode/:service/:postCode.description: Retrieve a list of offices for a specific postal code and service provider.

example.User Query: Find offices for the service provider 'andreani' in postcode 67890.

/offices/search/:service/:stateIsoCode/:.name: /offices/search/:service/:stateIsoCode/:keyword

27.tool_description: Geolocation Simulation For Mobile Apps is a tool that can simulate geolocation scenarios for mobile apps. This tool has 36 multiple built-in functions: 1. Forgot Password is to reset passwords for devices when forgotten. 2. Create Application is to facilitate the creation of device-specific applications. 3. Add Simulation By Address is to add simulation for a device by specifying a designated IP address with optional settings. 4. Add Simulation By Circle is to add circular movement simulations on a device. 5. Test Simulation By Circle is to simulate a test circle to evaluate a device's geolocation accuracy. 6. Add Simulation By Polygon is to add a simulation by defining a polygon area for geolocation testing. 7. Test Simulation By Polygon is to test geolocation simulation on mobile devices within irregularly shaped polygons. 8. Add Simulation By Random Polyline is to create simulations by generating random polylines with varying heights. 9. Test Simulation By Random Polyline is to simulate a test scenario by generating a random polyline route for geolocation testing. 10. Update Simulation By Random Polyline is to update geolocation simulation by generating a new random polyline. 11. Add Simulation By Sequential Polyline is to add a simulation through a sequential polyline for geolocation services. 12. Test Simulation By Sequential Polyline is to provide test simulations using sequential polylines for geolocation purposes. 13. Update Simulation By Sequential Polyline is to update simulation based on a specific sequential polyline. 14. List All Layers is to retrieve a list of available layers supported by a specific device. 15. Upload address CSV file is to upload a CSV file containing addresses for a specified project. 16. List All Simulations is to provide a list of available simulations. 17. Add Simulation By Layers is to simulate the addition of various layers to a device. 18. Test Simulation By Layers is to provide geolocation simulation capabilities with real-world environmental conditions. 19. Test Simulation By Address is to simulate a test based on a specific address. 20. Login is to facilitate the login process for devices with secure authentication methods. 21. Upload Icon is to upload icon images for applications. 22. List Applications is to retrieve a list of applications associated with an account. 23. Delete Layer is to facilitate the deletion of a specific layer. 24. List All Simulations Of A Group is to retrieve a list of simulations associated with a specific group. 25. Update Layer is to update the layer with the specified layerID. 26. Add Layer is to add a layer of addresses to mapping software. 27. Test Group is to retrieve detailed information about devices within the specified 'Test Group' category. 28. Delete Simulation is to delete a simulation based on the provided simulation ID. 29. Update Simulation By Layers is to update simulation layers by modifying the simulation layers in the route. 30. View Application is to access application information by providing the applicationID. 31. View Simulation is to view details of a simulation by entering a specific simulation ID. 32. Update Simulation By Address is to update a simulation by address using the specified simulationID. 33. Update Simulation By Circle is to update a simulation by specifying the simulation ID. 34. List All Groups is to retrieve a list of all groups related to devices. 35. Simulations By Application Id is to retrieve simulations based on a specific application ID. 36. Update Simulation By Polygon is to update a simulation within a designated polygon area by specifying the simulation ID. 37. View Layer is to view a specific layer by providing the layerID. 38. View User's Profile is to view user profiles by entering the user-id. 39. Update Profile is to update user profiles with custom geolocation settings. 40. Signup is to facilitate the creation of user accounts on the platform.

30.tool_description: Ephemeral Proxies is a tool that can provide datacenter and residential proxies. This tool has six multiple built-in functions: 1. Check residential proxies service status is to provide the current service status, including the total number of residential proxies available and their distribution by country. 2. Obtain a new residential proxy is to provide a residential proxy with options to specify a whitelist IP and select proxy locations by country codes. 3. Check datacenter proxies service status is to report the current service status of datacenter proxies, including their distribution by country. 4. Obtain a new datacenter proxy is to provide a datacenter proxy with options to specify countries for proxy location and whitelist additional IPs. 5. Get user's traffic balance is to retrieve the user's traffic balance information for the current monthly subscription. 6. Extend expiration time of a datacenter proxy is to extend the expiration time of an allocated proxy by 30 minutes per call, up to a maximum of 24 hours.

Check residential proxies service status.name: Check residential proxies service status
Check residential proxies service status.description: It provides the current service status, including the total number of residential proxies available and their distribution by country, showing the country ISO codes and the corresponding proxy counts. Users can check the availability of residential proxies by country, obtaining detailed information on the number of proxies available in each country.

example.User Query: Can you show me the current availability of residential proxies in Asia, segmented by country?

Obtain a new residential proxy.name: Obtain a new residential proxy
Obtain a new residential proxy.description: The tool provides a residential proxy that allows connections from the source IP making the API call. Users can specify a whitelist IP for additional security and select proxy locations by country codes. The response indicates if there are issues with the whitelist IP provided. The connection proxy details are `proxy.host` and `proxy.port` from the response fields. Make use of the `whitelist_ip` parameter to allow an additional IP. Select specific countries for proxy locations using the `countries` parameter; otherwise, countries are randomly selected. The proxy is available for 30 minutes. Ensure the whitelist IP provided is valid to avoid errors.

optional_parameters.name: whitelist_ip
optional_parameters.description:
The proxy that this endpoint returns will allow connections from the source ip that is making this API call.
Additionally, you can allow an extra ip to connect to the proxy by setting this parameter to the ip that you would like to whitelist.
The list of ips that the proxy has whitelisted is returned in the API response.

optional_parameters.name: countries
optional_parameters.description:
List of countries, separate it by comma, that you would like the proxies to be located.
Example: GB,US,PL,RU

example.User Query: I need a residential proxy with a whitelist IP of 10.10.10.10 for added security. I want the proxy location to be in the United Kingdom.

Check datacenter proxies service status.name: Check datacenter proxies service status

example.User Query: What is the current distribution of datacenter proxies by continent and their availability status?

Obtain a new datacenter proxy.name: Obtain a new datacenter proxy
Obtain a new datacenter proxy.description: The tool provides a datacenter proxy service that allows users to specify countries for proxy location and whitelist additional IPs. The API response includes a 'success' field indicating the status of the proxy request. Users can utilize the 'whitelist_ip' parameter to allow an extra IP to connect to the proxy.

optional_parameters.name: whitelist_ip
optional_parameters.description:
The proxy that this endpoint returns will allow connections from the source ip that is making this API call.
Additionally, you can allow an extra ip to connect to the proxy by setting this parameter to the ip that you would like to whitelist.
The list of ips that the proxy has whitelisted is returned in the API response.

optional_parameters.name: countries
optional_parameters.description:
List of countries, separate it by comma, that you would like the proxies to be located.
Example: GB,US,PL,RU

example.User Query: Could you help me obtain a datacenter proxy in Spain and Italy, with an additional IP whitelisted for 222.111.333.444?

Get user's traffic balance.name: Get user's traffic balance
Get user's traffic balance.description: Retrieves the user's traffic balance information for the current monthly subscription, including details on consumed and limit megabytes. The tool may encounter connection issues, so it's important to handle potential timeout errors.

example.User Query: Can you provide a summary of my traffic usage trends for the past three months?

Extend expiration time of a datacenter p.name: Extend expiration time of a datacenter proxy
Extend expiration time of a datacenter p.description: This API function extends the expiration time of an allocated proxy by 30 minutes per call, up to a maximum of 24 hours. The 'id' parameter is essential for specifying the proxy to extend its expiration time and should be passed correctly in the API call.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: The proxy identifier to extend the expiration time. This identifier can be obtained from the response of /v2/datacenter/proxy, field proxy.id.

example.User Query: I want to extend the expiration time of the proxy allocated with ID 'lmn987'. How do I proceed with extending its validity period?

34.tool_description: YouTube MP3 is a tool that can convert YouTube videos to MP3 format. This tool has one built-in function: 1. Get MP3 is to convert audio files to MP3 format with the option to cut specific segments.

Get MP3.name: Get MP3
Get MP3.description: Convert audio files to MP3 format with the option to cut specific segments. Quota cost is determined by the file length. The 'id' parameter specifies the audio file for conversion, while 'cut', 'sStart', and 'sEnd' parameters allow for segment cutting.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
Quota cost will apply according to the length of the mp3 file.
Quota is calculated as follows:
if length <= 30 then 1
if 30 < length <= 60 then 2
if 60 < length <= 90 then 3
if 90 < length <= 120 then 4
if 120 < length <= 150 then 5
if 150 < length <= 180 then 6

optional_parameters.name: cut
optional_parameters.description:
Cut the mp3 according to the provided sStart and sEnd parameters
The value must be provided as 1
The quota Cost is +1.

optional_parameters.name: sStart
optional_parameters.description:
Starting point for cutting the mp3.
Format must be HH:MM:SS

optional_parameters.name: sEnd
optional_parameters.description:
End point for cutting the mp3.
Format must be HH:MM:SS

example.User Query: I have a 4-minute audio file that I need to convert to MP3. Could you help me cut it from 00:02:00 to 00:03:00?

Get Statuses is to retrieve statuses for various services. 6. Create a Batched Submission is to create multiple submissions at once. 7. Create a Submission is to create a new submission with the ability to specify desired attributes and receive the result immediately in synchronous mode.

It also indicates the availability of features like wait result, submission deletion, and per-process/thread time and memory limits.

Create a Batched Submission.name: Create a Batched Submission
Create a Batched Submission.description: Create multiple submissions at once. Ensure to set `base64_encoded` to `true` when submitting data with non-printable characters. The API handles errors, including import errors, to ensure a comprehensive submission process.

optional_parameters.name: base64_encoded
optional_parameters.description:
**We recommend that you always set** `base64_encoded` **to** `true` **and send [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) encoded data to Judge0.**

If submission’s `source_code`, `stdin`, or `expected_output` contains non-printable characters or characters which cannot be sent with JSON, then set the `base64_encoded` parameter to `true` and send these attributes Base64 encoded. Your responsibility is to encode each of the mentioned attributes (`source_code`, `stdin`, and `expected_output`) even if just one of them contains non-printable characters. By default, this parameter is set to `false` and Judge0 assumes you are sending plain text data.

example.User Query: I am looking to submit a batch of code submissions with different expected outputs. How can I ensure the data is handled correctly for each submission?

Create a Submission.name: Create a Submission
Create a Submission.description: Creates a new submission with the ability to specify desired attributes and receive the result immediately in synchronous mode. It is recommended to send Base64 encoded data for source code, stdin, and expected output. The submission token is returned upon successful creation for checking submission status.

optional_parameters.name: fields
optional_parameters.description:
Return only the desired submission attributes. The default value for the `fields` parameter is `stdout,time,memory,stderr,token,compile_output,message,status`.

Use `*` to receive all available attributes.

optional_parameters.name: wait
optional_parameters.description:
Set to `true` to turn on **synchronous** mode to get the submission result immediately as a response. 

Please note that synchronous execution might be slightly slower than asynchronous.

optional_parameters.name: base64_encoded
optional_parameters.description:
**We recommend that you always set** `base64_encoded` **to** `true` **and send [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) encoded data to Judge0.**

If submission’s `source_code`, `stdin`, or `expected_output` contains non-printable characters or characters which cannot be sent with JSON, then set the `base64_encoded` parameter to `true` and send these attributes Base64 encoded. Your responsibility is to encode each of the mentioned attributes (`source_code`, `stdin`, and `expected_output`) even if just one of them contains non-printable characters. By default, this parameter is set to `false` and Judge0 assumes you are sending plain text data.

example.User Query: I want to submit a code snippet for evaluation and receive the result immediately. Please include all available attributes in the response.

Create a Submission is to create a new submission that can be processed synchronously or asynchronously.

About.name: About
About.description: Retrieve general information about the tool, including its functionalities and error handling mechanisms related to data security and privacy.

Get a Language.name: Get a Language

Get Statuses.name: Get Statuses
Get Statuses.description: Retrieve statuses of various systems, including network-related systems in specific regions. The tool may experience occasional errors, so please ensure proper handling of potential issues.

example.User Query: What are the current statuses of network-related systems in the Eastern region?

Create a Batched Submission.name: Create a Batched Submission
Create a Batched Submission.description: Create multiple submissions at once. Set `base64_encoded` to `true` for proper handling of non-printable characters in source code, stdin, and expected output.

optional_parameters.name: base64_encoded
optional_parameters.description:
**We recommend that you always set** `base64_encoded` **to** `true` **and send [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) encoded data to Judge0.**

If submission’s `source_code`, `stdin`, or `expected_output` contains non-printable characters or characters which cannot be sent with JSON, then set the `base64_encoded` parameter to `true` and send these attributes Base64 encoded. Your responsibility is to encode each of the mentioned attributes (`source_code`, `stdin`, and `expected_output`) even if just one of them contains non-printable characters. By default, this parameter is set to `false` and Judge0 assumes you are sending plain text data.

example.User Query: I'm interested in learning how the API manages batched submissions with a combination of different programming languages. Can you provide details on how the API handles submissions with varied source code languages and the impact on the submission process?

Create a Submission.name: Create a Submission
Create a Submission.description: Creates a new submission that can be processed synchronously or asynchronously, providing a submission token for status tracking. Includes options for setting base64 encoding, specifying desired attributes, and choosing synchronous processing.

optional_parameters.name: fields
optional_parameters.description:
Return only the desired submission attributes. The default value for the `fields` parameter is `stdout,time,memory,stderr,token,compile_output,message,status`.

Use `*` to receive all available attributes.

optional_parameters.name: base64_encoded
optional_parameters.description:
**We recommend that you always set** `base64_encoded` **to** `true` **and send [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) encoded data to Judge0.**

If submission’s `source_code`, `stdin`, or `expected_output` contains non-printable characters or characters which cannot be sent with JSON, then set the `base64_encoded` parameter to `true` and send these attributes Base64 encoded. Your responsibility is to encode each of the mentioned attributes (`source_code`, `stdin`, and `expected_output`) even if just one of them contains non-printable characters. By default, this parameter is set to `false` and Judge0 assumes you are sending plain text data.

optional_parameters.name: wait
optional_parameters.description:
Set to `true` to turn on **synchronous** mode to get the submission result immediately as a response. 

Please note that synchronous execution might be slightly slower than asynchronous.

example.User Query: I want to compare the processing times of submissions with base64 encoding set to true and false.

82.tool_description: Helper Function is a tool that can assist with various utility functions. This tool has multiple built-in functions: 1. Random is to generate random strings of specified lengths. 2. MD5 Encode is to encode a given string using MD5 encryption. 3. Undot is to convert a single-dimensional array in dot notation into a multi-dimensional array. 4. HTML TO Array/Object is to convert HTML content into a structured array or object in JSON format. 5. Dot is to flatten a multi-dimensional array into a single level array using dot notation. 6. Pluck is to retrieve all values associated with a specified key from an array. 7. Cross Join is to return a Cartesian product of given arrays. 8. Shuffle is to randomize the order of elements within an array or object. 9. Headline is to convert strings into a space-delimited string with each word's first letter capitalized. 10. Markdown is to convert GitHub flavored Markdown into HTML. 11. Ascii is to convert a string into ASCII values. 12. Escape is to escape HTML characters in a given text. 13. Word Count is to count the number of words in a text input. 14. Slug is to convert text or titles into a URL-friendly slug format. 15. Generate UUID is to generate UUID v4 with or without dashes. 16. SHA Encode is to encode a string to adhere to the SHA Data Encodings specification. 17. Aragon2 Encode is to encode a string to adhere to the Aragon2 Data Encodings specification. 18. Bcrypt Encode is to securely encode a string to adhere to the Bcrypt Data Encodings specification. 19. Base64 Decode is to decode a Base64 encoded string to its original format. 20. Base64 Encode is to encode a given string to comply with the Base64 Data Encodings standard.

Random.name: Random
Random.description: Generate random strings of specified lengths (BASIC: 20, PRO: 30, ULTRA: 70, MEGA: 150) by specifying the length parameter. The tool can include special characters in the generated string.

example.User Query: Generate a random string with a length of 150 characters and include special characters.

MD5 Encode.name: MD5 Encode
MD5 Encode.description: This tool encodes a given string using MD5 encryption.

HTML TO Array/Object.name: HTML TO Array/Object
HTML TO Array/Object.description: Convert HTML content, including forms with input fields, buttons, and dropdown menus, into a structured array or object in JSON format for easy manipulation and parsing.

Dot.name: Dot
Dot.description: Flattens a multi-dimensional array into a single level array using 'dot' notation to indicate depth. Users may encounter import errors when executing the function. Guidance on handling or troubleshooting import errors is recommended.

Pluck.name: Pluck

Shuffle.description: Shuffle elements within an array or object, with potential limitations in functionality that may require debugging or adjustments.

Headline.name: Headline
Headline.description: Convert strings delimited by casing, hyphens, or underscores into a space-delimited string with each word's first letter capitalized. Resolve the 'headline' function import issue for proper functionality.

Markdown.name: Markdown
Markdown.description: Converts GitHub flavored Markdown into HTML. Provides troubleshooting steps for resolving import errors related to the 'markdown' function.

example.User Query: I need to understand the specific dependencies and environment setup required for the markdown function. Can you provide details on this?

Ascii.description: Converts a string into ASCII values with support for various encodings and error handling.

Word Count.name: Word Count
Word Count.description: A tool that accurately counts the number of words in a text input, including complex terminology and jargon. It provides a word count for various types of documents, ensuring precise results even with specialized language.

Slug.description: Converts text or titles into a URL-friendly slug format.

Generate UUID.name: Generate UUID
Generate UUID.description: Generate UUID v4 with or without dashes. This tool allows you to generate UUIDs with the option to include or exclude dashes. Note: Rate limit errors may occur. Default settings remove dashes. Optional parameters include 'timestamp_first' to include timestamp at the beginning, 'remove_dash' to exclude dashes, and 'count' to specify the number of UUIDs to generate. It is important to note that rate limit errors may occur when generating a large number of UUIDs in a single request.

83.tool_description: Premium-Anime-Mobile-Wallpapers-Illustrations is a tool that can fetch high-quality anime mobile wallpapers and illustrations from a collection of over 100k images. This tool has multiple built-in functions: 1. Random Wallpapers is to request random anime wallpapers with options for image quality and themes. 2. Anime Wallpapers by pagination is to retrieve anime wallpapers based on page, sensitivity level, and quality preference. 3. Anime wallpapers related to the valentine by pagination is to retrieve Valentine-themed anime wallpapers with options for page number, sensitivity level, and image quality. 4. Anime wallpapers related to the wedding by pagination is to retrieve wedding-themed anime wallpapers with options for sensitivity and image quality. 5. Anime wallpapers related to the couple by pagination is to retrieve couple-themed anime wallpapers with options for page, sensitivity, and quality. 6. Anime wallpapers related to the christmas with pagination is to retrieve Christmas-themed anime wallpapers with options for quality selection. 7. Anime Illustrations by pagination is to retrieve anime illustrations with options for page number, sensitivity level, and image quality. 8. Recent Wallpapers by pagination is to retrieve recent anime wallpapers with options for quality selection and sensitivity filtering. 9. Search by animename, art_id is to search for wallpapers by anime name or art ID with options to filter by sensitivity, page number, and exact match. 10. Anime boy wallpapers by pagination is to retrieve anime boy wallpapers based on page, sensitivity, and quality parameters. 11. Anime wallpapers related to the family by pagination is to retrieve family-themed anime wallpapers with options for page number, sensitivity level, and image quality. 12. Anime wallpapers related to the halloween by pagination is to retrieve Halloween-themed anime wallpapers with options for high-quality images and sensitivity filtering. 13. Premium anime wallpapers by pagination is to fetch premium anime wallpapers based on sensitivity, page number, and image quality.

Random Wallpapers.name: Random Wallpapers
Random Wallpapers.description: This API function allows users to request random anime wallpapers with the option to specify image quality and themes, such as serene natural landscapes. The wallpapers provided may include anime-related images, game-related wallpapers, or illustrations. Subscription-based features include sensitivity, art ID, and premium status. If no wallpaper is found, the response will indicate this with a specific message.

example.User Query: Can you provide me with a random anime wallpaper featuring a serene natural landscape?

Anime Wallpapers by pagination.name: Anime Wallpapers by pagination
Anime Wallpapers by pagination.description: Retrieve anime wallpapers based on specified page, sensitivity level, and quality preference. The API returns anime name, art URL, sensitivity level, art ID, premium status, and includes the premium category of the artwork. An empty response is returned if no wallpapers are found. The sensitivity parameter filters out 18+ or ecchi-related images, with 0 being no filter and higher values indicating more restrictive filters. The quality parameter allows users to choose between compressed lower size wallpapers (quality: 0) or higher quality, larger size wallpapers (quality: 1).

example.User Query: Get anime wallpapers on page 6 with medium sensitivity and premium status included.

Anime wallpapers related to the valentin.name: Anime wallpapers related to the valentine by pagination
Anime wallpapers related to the valentin.description: Retrieve anime wallpapers related to Valentine with options to specify page number, sensitivity level, and image quality. The API filters out 18+ or ecchi-related images based on the sensitivity level provided. The quality parameter allows selection between compressed lower size or best quality high-size wallpapers. If no wallpapers are found, the response will be {'status': 'empty'}.

example.User Query: Can you display anime wallpapers related to Valentine with a moderate sensitivity level and excellent image quality on page 4?

Anime wallpapers related to the wedding.name: Anime wallpapers related to the wedding by pagination
Anime wallpapers related to the wedding.description: Retrieve anime wallpapers related to weddings with options for sensitivity and image quality. Pagination starts from page 1, with 10 wallpapers per page. Sensitivity parameter filters out 18+ or ecchi-related images. Quality parameter allows selection between compressed lower size or high-quality, high-size images. Response includes animename, arturl, sensitivity, art_id, and premium fields. If no wallpapers are found, the response will be {'status': 'empty'}. Default sensitivity is 1, default page is 1.

example.User Query: Please display anime wallpapers related to marriage ceremonies with a sensitivity filter of 2 and high-quality images on the second page.

Anime wallpapers related to the couple b.name: Anime wallpapers related to the couple by pagination
Anime wallpapers related to the couple b.description: Retrieve anime wallpapers of couples with options to specify page, sensitivity, and quality. The API response includes details such as anime name, image URL, sensitivity status, unique ID, and premium category. The response may indicate 'empty' if no wallpapers are found.

example.User Query: I want to discover anime wallpapers showcasing couples with a sensitivity level of 1 on the seventh page in high quality.

Anime wallpapers related to the christma.name: Anime wallpapers related to the christmas with pagination
Anime wallpapers related to the christma.description: Retrieve anime wallpapers related to Christmas with options for quality selection. Required parameters include page number and sensitivity level. Optional parameter for quality selection. The API provides wallpaper images in compressed lower size or best quality. Response includes anime name, artwork URL, sensitivity level, unique artwork ID, and premium category indication. If no wallpapers are found, the response will indicate an empty status. Note: Users should verify API availability and consider troubleshooting steps in case of errors.

example.User Query: I'm searching for anime wallpapers that combine Christmas themes with magical elements. Can you display a variety of images on a specific page with different sensitivity levels?

Anime Illustrations by pagination.name: Anime Illustrations by pagination
Anime Illustrations by pagination.description: Retrieve anime illustrations with options to specify page number, sensitivity level, and image quality. The API provides details such as anime name, image URL, sensitivity status, unique ID, and premium category indication. The response may vary depending on the input parameters provided, and if no wallpapers are found, the response will be {'status': 'empty'}.

example.User Query: Fetch anime illustrations on page 6 with low sensitivity and standard quality.

Recent Wallpapers by pagination.name: Recent Wallpapers by pagination
Recent Wallpapers by pagination.description: Retrieve recent anime wallpapers with options for quality selection, sensitivity filtering. The API provides functionality to fetch wallpapers based on specified parameters and offers different quality options. It also handles cases where no wallpapers are found.

example.User Query: Can you display the recent anime wallpapers with sensitivity filtering turned off and at the default quality level?

Search by animename, art_id.name: Search by animename, art_id
Search by animename, art_id.description: Search for wallpapers by anime name or art ID with options to filter by sensitivity, page number, and exact match. Retrieve details such as anime name, art URL, sensitivity status, art ID, and premium category. Supports different qualities of wallpaper images. Ensure searchText parameter is at least 3 characters long for anime name search.

example.User Query: Show me wallpapers for the anime 'My Hero Academia' with a sensitivity filter set to 3 on the third page.

Anime boy wallpapers by pagination.name: Anime boy wallpapers by pagination
Anime boy wallpapers by pagination.description: Retrieve anime boy wallpapers based on specified page, sensitivity, and quality parameters. The response includes anime name, wallpaper URL, sensitivity status, art ID, and premium category. An 'empty' status is returned if no wallpapers are found.

example.User Query: Get anime boy wallpapers on page 6 with low sensitivity.

Anime wallpapers related to the family b.name: Anime wallpapers related to the family by pagination
Anime wallpapers related to the family b.description: Retrieve anime wallpapers related to the family with options to specify page number, sensitivity level, and image quality. The response includes details such as anime name, image URL, sensitivity level, unique ID, and premium status. The API allows customization of sensitivity, page number, and image quality for tailored results. Error message 'empty' is returned if no wallpapers are found.

example.User Query: Display anime wallpapers related to family with medium sensitivity and premium status on page 6.

Anime wallpapers related to the hallowee.name: Anime wallpapers related to the halloween by pagination
Anime wallpapers related to the hallowee.description: Retrieve anime wallpapers related to Halloween with options for high-quality images and sensitivity filtering based on specified page numbers. The API offers the ability to request specific pages of wallpapers with varying quality levels and sensitivity filters. The API does not exist for the specified query parameters, and the response format for non-existent APIs includes an error message.

example.User Query: Can you display anime wallpapers related to Halloween on page 6 with sensitivity level 3 and high quality images?

Premium anime wallpapers by pagination.name: Premium anime wallpapers by pagination
Premium anime wallpapers by pagination.description: This API fetches premium anime wallpapers based on specified parameters such as sensitivity, page number, and image quality. It provides options to filter sensitive content and choose between compressed or high-quality images.

example.User Query: Retrieve anime wallpapers with high sensitivity and compressed images on page 5

84.tool_description: Waktu Solat is a tool that provides information on prayer times in Malaysia. This tool has two built-in functions: 1. /solat/time is to retrieve prayer times for a specific zone based on the zone code provided. 2. /solat/list is to provide a list of zones in each state along with their zone codes and geographical coordinates.

/solat/time.description: Retrieve prayer times for a specific zone based on the zone code provided. Ensure the zone code is obtained from the API /solat/list. The output should include prayer timings in JSON format. Please note that the tool may require the zone code as a parameter to function properly.

example.User Query: I would like to know the prayer schedule for zone SWK02, can you provide me with that information?

/solat/list.name: /solat/list
/solat/list.description: Provides a list of zones in each state along with their zone codes and geographical coordinates in JSON format. Useful for retrieving specific zone coordinates within a state.

example.User Query: Retrieve the geographical coordinates for a specific zone in a state.

86.tool_description: MoviesDatabase is a tool that can provide comprehensive and updated data for over 9 million titles (movies, series, and episodes) and 11 million actors/crew and cast members. This tool has multiple built-in functions: 1. /titles/utils/genres is to provide a list of movie genres available. 2. /titles/utils/lists is to provide a comprehensive collection of movie and series lists. 3. /titles/search/akas/{aka} is to provide information about movies and TV episodes based on the provided title and year. 4. /titles/search/keyword/{keyword} is to search for movies based on a keyword. 5. /titles/search/title/{title} is to search by title with optional parameters for sorting and filtering. 6. /actors/random is to provide a list of random actors. 7. /actors/{id} is to retrieve detailed information about a specific actor by providing their IMDb ID. 8. /titles/utils/titleTypes is to retrieve a list of different types of movie titles available. 9. /actors is to provide a list of actors associated with movies. 10. /titles/series/{seriesId} is to fetch details about a particular series based on the IMDb ID provided. 11. /titles/x/upcoming is to retrieve upcoming movies filtered by genre, year, and optionally by start and end years. 12. /titles/{id}/ratings is to retrieve ratings for a movie based on the IMDb ID provided. 13. /titles/{id}/crew is to retrieve crew information for a movie using the IMDb ID of the title. 14. /titles/series/{seriesId}/{season} is to retrieve information about a specific season of a series based on the provided series IMDb ID. 15. /titles/episode/{id} is to retrieve information about a specific episode using the IMDb episode ID. 16. /titles/{id}/main_actors is to retrieve the main actors of a movie based on the provided IMDb ID. 17. /titles/x/titles-by-ids is to retrieve titles based on IMDb IDs list. 18. /titles/{id}/aka is to retrieve alternative titles associated with a movie based on the IMDb ID provided. 19. /titles/random is to provide random movie or series recommendations based on specified filters. 20. /titles/{id} is to retrieve movie information based on IMDb ID. 21. /titles is to retrieve movie titles with options for filtering by genre, year, title type, and sorting. 22. /titles/seasons/{seriesId} is to retrieve information about the seasons of a TV series using the IMDb ID of the series.

/titles/utils/genres.name: /titles/utils/genres
/titles/utils/genres.description: This API provides a list of movie genres available, including traditional and non-traditional genres, allowing users to explore a diverse range of genres beyond typical movie categories.

example.User Query: Can you provide a breakdown of the number of movies in each genre available in the database?

/titles/utils/lists.name: /titles/utils/lists
/titles/utils/lists.description: The tool provides a comprehensive collection of movie and series lists, encompassing popular titles, top box office movies, top-rated films, and more. Users can explore trending content, top box office movies, top-rated movies, and various other categories to discover entertainment options tailored to their preferences.

The response includes details such as title type, release date, and primary image. Required parameters are 'aka' for the title and 'year' for the release year. Optional parameters include 'startYear', 'info', 'page', 'sort', 'endYear', 'limit', and 'titleType'.

/titles/utils/titleTypes.description: This API retrieves a list of different types of movie titles available. It can be used to query movie title types associated with specific genres or actors, providing insights into categorization based on genres or actors.

87.tool_description: Advanced Movie Search is a tool that can search for movies via advanced queries like genre, name, etc., and get all their details. This tool has four multiple built-in functions: 1. Genre List is to retrieve a comprehensive list of movie genres commonly associated with strong female leads. 2. Search by Genre is to discover popular movies by genre, allowing for multiple genres per movie. 3. Search by Name is to search for movies related to giant creatures by providing a query string specifically related to giant creatures. 4. Get Detailed Response is to retrieve detailed information about a movie based on its ID.

Genre List.name: Genre List
Genre List.description: Retrieve a comprehensive list of movie genres commonly associated with strong female leads, with examples provided under the 'genres' key.

example.User Query: I'm looking to explore movie genres that often feature strong female leads. Can you provide me with examples of such genres?

Search by Genre.name: Search by Genre
Search by Genre.description: Discover popular movies by genre, allowing for multiple genres per movie. Retrieve movies based on specified genre(s).

Search by Name.name: Search by Name
Search by Name.description: Search for movies related to giant creatures by providing a query string specifically related to giant creatures to retrieve relevant movie information.

Get Detailed Response.name: Get Detailed Response
Get Detailed Response.description: Retrieve detailed information about a movie based on its ID, including details such as title, genres, release date, budget, revenue, production companies, spoken languages, homepage, overview, popularity, production countries, runtime, status, tagline, video availability, vote average, and vote count.

89.tool_description: 3D Services is a tool that can generate thumbnails for 3D files and script Blender directly in the cloud. This tool has three multiple built-in functions: 1. thumbnail is to generate a thumbnail for a 3D model file provided as a '.glb' URL. 2. version is to retrieve version information for a specific software application. 3. blender-project is to convert a Blender project to a zip file for sharing.

thumbnail.name: thumbnail

required_parameters.description: A string containing an url of a '.glb' file

example.User Query: I'm working on a project that involves a 3D model of a modern skyscraper. Can you assist me in generating a thumbnail image for this model?

version.name: version
version.description: This tool retrieves version information for a specific software application. It may experience intermittent API connectivity issues, potentially leading to retrieval errors, including timeouts.

blender-project.name: blender-project
blender-project.description: This API converts a Blender project to a zip file for sharing. Ensure correct 'mode' and 'url' parameters to avoid errors. The zip mode output is a large file (~20MB) requiring main.blend and script.py files. Contact the API provider if issues arise.

required_parameters.name: mode
required_parameters.description: output mode of the query (zip or img)

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: A string containing an url of a '.zip' file of the project

example.User Query: Could you help me convert my Blender project to a zip file for sharing using the 'img' mode instead of the default 'zip' mode?

92.tool_description: Website Screenshot or Thumbnail is a tool that can take pixel-perfect screenshots or thumbnails of any website. This tool has one built-in function: 1. /capture is to capture a screenshot from any URL or Raw HTML.

/capture.name: /capture
/capture.description: Capture screenshot from any URL or Raw HTML. Access token is required for API usage. Obtain an access token at https://restpack.io/console and append it to the querystring as ?access_token=TOK.

optional_parameters.name: html
optional_parameters.description:
Raw HTML string of a page that you want to capture. Example:

Test

optional_parameters.name: json
optional_parameters.description: Return a JSON response with the resulting image's URL instead of the image itself. Default: false

optional_parameters.name: mode
optional_parameters.description: Capturing mode. Please see below for details. Default: fullpage Pattern: fullpage | viewport | element

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Preferred image output format. If you need a raw html string you can pass html as format Default: png Pattern: jpg | png | pdf | html

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Preferred viewport width in pixels. Default: 1280 Min: 320 Max: 2000

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Preferred viewport height in pixels. Default: 1024 Min: 160

optional_parameters.name: thumbnail_width
optional_parameters.description: In case you want a thumbnail image, provide a preferred width. Min: 10 Max: 3000

optional_parameters.name: thumbnail_height
optional_parameters.description: Preferred thumbnail height, requires thumbnail_width to be set, unbounded if omitted. Min: 10 Max: 3000

optional_parameters.name: css
optional_parameters.description: Additional CSS string to be injected into the page before render.

optional_parameters.name: js
optional_parameters.description: Additional JS string to be injected into the page before render.

optional_parameters.name: prescroll
optional_parameters.description: Force scrolling the webpage before capture. Might help with dynamic loading assets.

optional_parameters.name: delay
optional_parameters.description: Time in milliseconds to delay capture after page load. Default: 2000 Max: 10000

optional_parameters.name: ttl
optional_parameters.description: Time in milliseconds for the resulting image to be cached for further requests. Default: 1 day Max: 1 week

optional_parameters.name: fresh
optional_parameters.description: Force rendering a new screenshot disregarding the cache status. Default: false

optional_parameters.name: user_agent
optional_parameters.description: Custom user-agent header string for the web request. Default: Chrome Compatible User Agent

optional_parameters.name: accept_language
optional_parameters.description: Custom accept-language header string for the web request.

optional_parameters.name: element_selector
optional_parameters.description: A CSS selector to be used with element rendering mode.

optional_parameters.name: headers
optional_parameters.description: Additional headers seperated with newline Example: X-Test: header\nAccept-Type: html

optional_parameters.name: retina
optional_parameters.description: Generate retina sized screen capture (2x device pixel ratio). Default: false

optional_parameters.name: base64
optional_parameters.description: Serialize response file to base64

optional_parameters.name: access_token
optional_parameters.description: You can provide your token via querystring instead of header.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: The URL of web page, including the protocol that you want to capture.

example.User Query: Capture a screenshot of the viewport of a webpage with the URL 'http://example.com' in JPG format with a custom user-agent header set to 'Mozilla/5.0'.
