96.tool_description: QRickit QR Code QReator is a tool that can dynamically generate QR Codes for various data types (URL, Calendar Events, Contact, Text, Email, etc.) for integration in websites, applications, and other business or personal usage. This tool has one built-in function: 1. Generate a QR Code image is to create QR Code images with custom header text, specific error correction levels, and background colors, supporting PNG, JPG, and GIF formats.

Generate a QR Code image.name: Generate a QR Code image
Generate a QR Code image.description: An API that generates QR Code images with custom header text, specific error correction levels, and background colors. Supports PNG, JPG, and GIF image formats. Requires properly formatted input data (URL, text, vCard data, iCal data, etc.) for optimal results.

required_parameters.name: d
required_parameters.description: Data for QR Code (e.g. URL, text, vCard data, iCal data, etc.) See documentation at https://qrickit.com/qrickit_apps/qrickit_api.php for instructions.

optional_parameters.name: logotext
optional_parameters.description: Header Text: logotext=Any text about 15 to 35 characters maximum depending on the size of your QR Code. Color of header text is the same as QR Code color (fgdcolor). In cases where data is very large, text will not fit and should not be used. Text can be urlencoded to avoid problems with special characters.

optional_parameters.name: t
optional_parameters.description: Type of generated image. p = png (default). j = jpg. g = gif.

optional_parameters.name: fgdcolor
optional_parameters.description: QR Code Color: fgdcolor=The color of your QR Code expressed in HTML Hex# (i.e. FFFFFF for white, 000000 for black, etc.). If nothing is specified, the default is black (000000).

optional_parameters.name: qrsize
optional_parameters.description: Size of image in pixels. Default = 150 (i.e. 150 pixel square) . Min = 80. Max = 1480.

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description: Set to "jp" if your optional footer text (addtext) uses Japanese characters. Otherwise leave blank.

optional_parameters.name: e
optional_parameters.description: Error Correction: e=The level of error correction capability. The choices are L (Low) 7%, M (Medium) 15%, Q (Quartile) 25%, and H (High) 30% represented as l, m, q, and h respectively. If nothing is specified, the default error correction level is M (Medium). The higher the error correction means more of the QR Code can still be read if it is damaged (or covered/hidden). However, the higher the error correction, the less data the QR Code can hold.  Usually you don't have to specify anything here unless you have a lot of data to fit in the QR Code. Then you can choose e=L (Low).

optional_parameters.name: addtext
optional_parameters.description: Footer Text: addtext=Any text about 15 to 60 characters maximum depending on the size of your QR Code. In cases where data is very large, text will not fit an d should not be used. Text can be urlencoded to avoid problems with special characters. If using Japanese characters please set "lang" parameter to "jp" (i.e. lang=jp). Otherwise leave "lang" blank.

optional_parameters.name: txtcolor
optional_parameters.description: Footer Text Color: txtcolor=The color of your optional footer text expressed in HTML Hex# (i.e. FFFFFF for white, 000000 for black, etc.). If nothing is specified, the default is black (000000).

optional_parameters.name: bgdcolor
optional_parameters.description: Background Color: bgdcolor=The color of the background expressed in HTML Hex# (i.e. FFFFFF for white, 000000 for black, etc.). If nothing is specified, the default is white (FFFFFF).

example.User Query: Generate a QR Code image with a custom header text, a specific error correction level, and a background color for a given calendar event data

97.tool_description: Streaming Availability is a tool that can search for shows available on streaming services across 60 countries. This tool has 10 multiple built-in functions: 1. Search Ultra is to search through the catalog of the given services in the specified country with detailed filters and retrieve comprehensive show information. 2. Search Basic (FREE) is to search through the catalog of specified services in a given country with basic filters and retrieve detailed show information. 3. Services (FREE) is to retrieve comprehensive details about popular streaming services. 4. Get Basic (FREE) is to retrieve details of a movie or show using IMDb or TMDb ID, including streaming availability information for the specified country. 5. Search Pro is to search through the catalog of the given services in the specified country with advanced filters and retrieve detailed show information. 6. Get Ultra is to retrieve movie details using IMDb or TMDb IDs, including global streaming availability information. 7. Search By Title (FREE) is to search movies and series by title across all platforms and countries. 8. Genres (FREE) is to retrieve the id to name mapping of supported movie genres in JSON format.

Search Ultra.name: Search Ultra
Search Ultra.description: Search through the catalog of the given services in the specified country. Utilize filters such as show language, genre, IMDb rating, release year, and streaming services. Retrieve detailed information about shows, including title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, IMDb rating, streaming service links, cast, runtime, and posters. The output also includes data on show availability in other services for the selected country.

required_parameters.name: services
required_parameters.description:
A comma separated list of up to 16 services to search in. See `/v2/services` endpoint to get the supported services and their ids/names.

Syntax of the values supplied in the list can be as the followings:

`<sevice_id>`: Searches in the entire catalog of that service, including (if applicable) rentable, buyable shows or shows available through addons i.e. `netflix`, `prime`, `apple`

`<sevice_id>.<offer_type>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given offer type. Valid offer type values are `subscription`, `free`, `rent`, `buy` and `addon`  i.e. `peacock.free` only returns the shows on Peacock that are free to watch, `prime.subscription` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are available to watch with a Prime subscription. `hulu.addon` only returns the shows on Hulu that are available via an addon,  `prime.rent` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are rentable.

`<sevice_id>.addon.<addon_id>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given addon. Check `/v2/services` endpoint to fetch the available addons for a service. Some sample values are: `hulu.addon.hbo`,  `prime.addon.hbomaxus`.

If a service supports both `free` and `subscription`, then results included under `subscription` will always include the `free` shows as well.

When multiple values are passed as a comma separated list, any show that satisfies at least one of the values will be included in the result.

Some sample list values:

`prime.rent,prime.buy,apple.rent,apple.buy`: Returns all the buyable/rentable shows on Amazon Prime Video and Apple TV.

`prime.addon,prime.subscription`: Returns all the shows on Amazon Prime Video that are available through either a Prime Video subscription or a Prime Video Channel subscription.

required_parameters.name: country
required_parameters.description: 2 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the country to search in. See the about page to check the supported countries.

optional_parameters.name: order_by
optional_parameters.description:
Determines the ordering of the results.

Possible values are `original_title`, `imdb_vote_count`, `imdb_rating` and `year`. Default value is `original_title`

optional_parameters.name: max_imdb_rating
optional_parameters.description: Out of 100

optional_parameters.name: min_imdb_rating
optional_parameters.description: Out of 100

optional_parameters.name: desc
optional_parameters.description:
Use descending order?

Possible values are `true` and `false`. Default value is `false`.

optional_parameters.name: keyword
optional_parameters.description: A keyword to only search within the shows have that keyword in their overview or title.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
Cursor is used for pagination. After each request, the response includes a `hasMore` boolean field to tell if there are more results that did not fit the returned list size. If it is set as true, to get the rest of the result set, send a new request (with the same parameters for other fields such as show_type, services etc.), and set the cursor parameter as the `nextCursor` value of the previous request response. Do not forget to escape the cursor value before putting it into the query as it might contain characters such as `?`, `&`.

The first request naturally does not require a `cursor` parameter.

optional_parameters.name: year_max
optional_parameters.description: Maximum release/air year of the show.

optional_parameters.name: year_min
optional_parameters.description: Minimum release/air year of the show.

optional_parameters.name: show_original_language
optional_parameters.description: A 2 letter ISO 639-1 language code to only search within the shows whose original language matches with the provided language.

optional_parameters.name: genres_relation
optional_parameters.description:
When more than one genre is supplied in `genres` parameter, `genres_relation` chooses the matching style against

When `or`, the endpoint returns any show that has at least one of the given genres.
When `and`, it only returns the shows that have all of the given genres.

Default value is `and`.

optional_parameters.name: genres
optional_parameters.description:
Comma separated list of genre ids to only search within the shows in those genres. See `/v2/genres` endpoint to see available genres and ids.

When more than one genre supplied, set `genres_relation` parameter to specify between returning shows that have at least one of the given genres or returning shows that have all of the given genres

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: 2 letter iso code of the output language. Default is `en`. See the about page to see the list of languages supported.

optional_parameters.name: show_type
optional_parameters.description: Type of shows to search in. Accepted values are `movie`, `series` or `all`. The default value is `all`.

example.User Query: Find movies in the US on Netflix, Hulu, and Prime Video with a minimum IMDb rating of 60, released between 2010 and 2020, in the Spanish language.

Search Basic (FREE).name: Search Basic (FREE)
Search Basic (FREE).description: Search through the catalog of the specified services in a given country, allowing filters by show language, genre, and keyword. The output includes detailed show information like title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, IMDb rating, streaming service links, cast, runtime, and posters. Supports pagination with a default of 8 items per page, and provides data on show availability in other services for the selected country.

required_parameters.name: services
required_parameters.description:
A comma separated list of up to 4 services to search in. See `/v2/services` endpoint to get the supported services and their ids/names.

Syntax of the values supplied in the list can be as the followings:

`<sevice_id>`: Searches in the entire catalog of that service, including (if applicable) rentable, buyable shows or shows available through addons i.e. `netflix`, `prime`, `apple`

`<sevice_id>.<offer_type>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given offer type. Valid offer type values are `subscription`, `free`, `rent`, `buy` and `addon`  i.e. `peacock.free` only returns the shows on Peacock that are free to watch, `prime.subscription` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are available to watch with a Prime subscription. `hulu.addon` only returns the shows on Hulu that are available via an addon,  `prime.rent` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are rentable.

`<sevice_id>.addon.<addon_id>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given addon. Check `/v2/services` endpoint to fetch the available addons for a service. Some sample values are: `hulu.addon.hbo`,  `prime.addon.hbomaxus`.

If a service supports both `free` and `subscription`, then results included under `subscription` will always include the `free` shows as well.

When multiple values are passed as a comma separated list, any show that satisfies at least one of the values will be included in the result.

Some sample list values:

`prime.rent,prime.buy,apple.rent,apple.buy`: Returns all the buyable/rentable shows on Amazon Prime Video and Apple TV.

`prime.addon,prime.subscription`: Returns all the shows on Amazon Prime Video that are available through either a Prime Video subscription or a Prime Video Channel subscription.

required_parameters.name: country
required_parameters.description: 2 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the country to search in. See the about page to check the supported countries.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
Cursor is used for pagination. After each request, the response includes a `hasMore` boolean field to tell if there are more results that did not fit the returned list size. If it is set as true, to get the rest of the result set, send a new request (with the same parameters for other fields such as show_type, services etc.), and set the cursor parameter as the `nextCursor` value of the previous request response. Do not forget to escape the cursor value before putting it into the query as it might contain characters such as `?`, `&`.

The first request naturally does not require a `cursor` parameter.

optional_parameters.name: show_original_language
optional_parameters.description: A 2 letter ISO 639-1 language code to only search within the shows whose original language matches with the provided language.

optional_parameters.name: genre
optional_parameters.description: A genre id to only search within the shows in that genre. See `/v2/genres` endpoint to see available genres and ids.

optional_parameters.name: keyword
optional_parameters.description: A keyword to only search within the shows have that keyword in their overview or title.

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: 2 letter iso code of the output language. Default is `en`. See the about page to see the list of languages supported.

optional_parameters.name: show_type
optional_parameters.description: Type of shows to search in. Accepted values are `movie`, `series` or `all`. The default value is `all`.

example.User Query: Find movies in the US with the genre 'drama' and available on Netflix, Hulu, and Prime Video.

Services (FREE).name: Services (FREE)
Services (FREE).description: Retrieve comprehensive details about popular streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime Video, including subscription tiers, available content, and compatible streaming devices.

example.User Query: What are the available subscription tiers, content offerings, and compatible devices for streaming on Hulu?

Get Basic (FREE).name: Get Basic (FREE)
Get Basic (FREE).description: Retrieve details of a movie or show using IMDb or TMDb ID, including streaming availability information for the specified country. Default country is 'us' and default output language is 'en'. Results may vary based on available data and the need for valid IDs.

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: 2 letter iso code of the output language. Default is `en`. See the about page to see the list of languages supported.

example.User Query: Could you provide information about a movie's details and streaming availability in Germany?

Search Pro.name: Search Pro
Search Pro.description: Search through the catalog of the given services in the specified country. Provides detailed show information including title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, IMDb rating, streaming service links, cast, runtime, and more. Ability to filter by show language, genre, and keyword. Default items per page is 10. Response may include show availability in other services for the specified country. Verify the availability of the 'Search Pro' endpoint before usage.

required_parameters.name: country
required_parameters.description: 2 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the country to search in. See the about page to check the supported countries.

required_parameters.name: services
required_parameters.description:
A comma separated list of up to 8 services to search in. See `/v2/services` endpoint to get the supported services and their ids/names.

Syntax of the values supplied in the list can be as the followings:

`<sevice_id>`: Searches in the entire catalog of that service, including (if applicable) rentable, buyable shows or shows available through addons i.e. `netflix`, `prime`, `apple`

`<sevice_id>.<offer_type>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given offer type. Valid offer type values are `subscription`, `free`, `rent`, `buy` and `addon`  i.e. `peacock.free` only returns the shows on Peacock that are free to watch, `prime.subscription` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are available to watch with a Prime subscription. `hulu.addon` only returns the shows on Hulu that are available via an addon,  `prime.rent` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are rentable.

`<sevice_id>.addon.<addon_id>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given addon. Check `/v2/services` endpoint to fetch the available addons for a service. Some sample values are: `hulu.addon.hbo`,  `prime.addon.hbomaxus`.

If a service supports both `free` and `subscription`, then results included under `subscription` will always include the `free` shows as well.

When multiple values are passed as a comma separated list, any show that satisfies at least one of the values will be included in the result.

Some sample list values:

`prime.rent,prime.buy,apple.rent,apple.buy`: Returns all the buyable/rentable shows on Amazon Prime Video and Apple TV.

`prime.addon,prime.subscription`: Returns all the shows on Amazon Prime Video that are available through either a Prime Video subscription or a Prime Video Channel subscription.

optional_parameters.name: year_max
optional_parameters.description: Maximum release/air year of the show.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
Cursor is used for pagination. After each request, the response includes a `hasMore` boolean field to tell if there are more results that did not fit the returned list size. If it is set as true, to get the rest of the result set, send a new request (with the same parameters for other fields such as show_type, services etc.), and set the cursor parameter as the `nextCursor` value of the previous request response. Do not forget to escape the cursor value before putting it into the query as it might contain characters such as `?`, `&`.

The first request naturally does not require a `cursor` parameter.

optional_parameters.name: desc
optional_parameters.description:
Use descending order?

Possible values are `true` and `false`. Default value is `false`.

optional_parameters.name: genres_relation
optional_parameters.description:
When more than one genre is supplied in `genres` parameter, `genres_relation` chooses the matching style against

When `or`, the endpoint returns any show that has at least one of the given genres.
When `and`, it only returns the shows that have all of the given genres.

Default value is `and`.

optional_parameters.name: year_min
optional_parameters.description: Minimum release/air year of the show.

optional_parameters.name: show_original_language
optional_parameters.description: A 2 letter ISO 639-1 language code to only search within the shows whose original language matches with the provided language.

optional_parameters.name: genres
optional_parameters.description:
Comma separated list of genre ids to only search within the shows in those genres. See `/v2/genres` endpoint to see available genres and ids.

When more than one genre supplied, set `genres_relation` parameter to specify between returning shows that have at least one of the given genres or returning shows that have all of the given genres

optional_parameters.name: show_type
optional_parameters.description: Type of shows to search in. Accepted values are `movie`, `series` or `all`. The default value is `all`.

optional_parameters.name: order_by
optional_parameters.description:
Determines the ordering of the results.

Possible values are `original_title` and `year`. Default value is `original_title`

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: 2 letter iso code of the output language. Default is `en`. See the about page to see the list of languages supported.

optional_parameters.name: keyword
optional_parameters.description: A keyword to only search within the shows have that keyword in their overview or title.

example.User Query: Find movies in the UK on Netflix and Prime Video with genres 'Action' and 'Adventure' released between 2015 and 2021.

Get Ultra.description: Retrieve movie details using IMDb or TMDb IDs, including global streaming availability information. Optional parameters allow for specifying the output language and IMDb ID of the movie.

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: 2 letter iso code of the output language. Default is `en`. See the about page to see the list of languages supported.

Search By Title (FREE).name: Search By Title (FREE)
Search By Title (FREE).description: Search movies and series by title across all platforms and countries. Returns a maximum of 20 items with a 100% match to the title. Streaming information may not be available for all titles. No pagination is supported.

required_parameters.description: Regardless of this value, the given title is searched across all the platforms and all the countries. This parameter determines according to which country the streamingInfo field will be populated. Thus even if a show is not available in this country, It will be included in the results if it resembles with the given title, but the streaming information will not be available.

Genres (FREE).name: Genres (FREE)
Genres (FREE).description: Retrieve the id to name mapping of supported movie genres in JSON format.

Create Transaction is to generate a unique identifier for a new logistics transaction. 2. Transactions is to retrieve a specific transaction by its unique Orderful Transaction ID and fetch detailed information about it.

Create Transaction.description: This API function is intended to generate a unique identifier for a new logistics transaction.

Generate Captcha is to generate a captcha image in PNG format along with a unique identifier (UUID) for security purposes, allowing customization of the captcha length for increased security measures. 2. Verify the captcha is to verify the captcha by providing the captcha text and UUID to validate the captcha, receiving messages indicating the verification status, such as success or failure reasons.

Generate Captcha.name: Generate Captcha
Generate Captcha.description: Generates a captcha image in PNG format along with a unique identifier (UUID) for security purposes, allowing customization of the captcha length for increased security measures.

example.User Query: Can you help me create a unique security feature for my online form by generating a complex captcha image with a specific length UUID?

Verify the captcha.name: Verify the captcha
Verify the captcha.description: Verify the captcha by providing the captcha text and UUID to validate the captcha. Receive messages indicating the verification status, such as success or failure reasons.

example.User Query: I'm having trouble with a captcha when trying to log in to my account. The captcha text reads 'LMN789' and the UUID is '741852963'. Can you assist me in verifying the captcha for my login?

100.tool_description: Variable Size QR Code API is a tool that can generate QR Code images of specified sizes for given URLs. This tool has one built-in function: 1. QR Code Image is to generate a QR Code image of a specified size for a given URL.

QR Code Image.name: QR Code Image
QR Code Image.description: This API endpoint generates a QR Code image of a specified size for a given URL. The default size is 5. If the user is not subscribed, an error message will be returned indicating the subscription status. It requires a 'GET' request with parameters 'size' (integer) and 'url' (string).

Get TV Series By Year is to retrieve TV series based on the specified year. 2. Get TV Schedule By Country is to retrieve TV series information for a specified country. 3. GET TV Series Episodes by Series ID, Season Number is to retrieve TV series episodes by series ID and season number. 4. Get Airing today TV Shows is to retrieve TV series airing today. 5. Get Trending TV Shows is to retrieve trending TV shows based on genre. 6. Get TV ON the Air is to retrieve TV series currently on air. 7. Get Popular TV Shows By Year is to retrieve popular TV shows based on the specified year. 8. Get Recently Added TV Series By Release Date is to retrieve recently added TV series by release date. 9. Get TV Series Aliases by ID is to fetch TV series aliases by series ID. 10. Get TV Series Images by ID is to retrieve poster and fanart images for a TV series by series ID. 11. Get TV Series by Title is to search for TV series by title. 12. Get by TV Series by ID is to retrieve details of a TV series by series ID. 13. Get Movies by Year is to retrieve movies based on the specified year. 14. Get Similar Movies is to retrieve similar movies based on a given movie ID. 15. Get Box-Office Movies is to retrieve box-office movies based on specified parameters. 16. Get Trending Movies is to retrieve trending movies. 17. Get Now Playing Movies is to retrieve currently playing movies. 18. Get Popular Movies by Year is to retrieve popular movies for a specific year. 19. Get Movie Aliases by ID is to retrieve movie aliases by movie ID. 20. Get Movie Images by ID is to retrieve movie images by movie ID. 21. Get Movies By Title is to retrieve movies by their title. 22. Get Movie by ID is to fetch movie details by movie ID. 23. Get Upcoming Movies is to retrieve upcoming movie details based on specified genre. 24. Get TV Series Seasons By ID is to retrieve TV series seasons information by series ID. 25. Get Similar TV Shows is to retrieve similar TV shows by series ID. 26. Get Recently Added Movies by Release Date is to retrieve recently added movies by release date.

Get TV Series By Year.name: Get TV Series By Year
Get TV Series By Year.description: Retrieve TV series with title, year, and ID based on the specified year. The 'year' parameter indicates the year for which TV series are requested. Use the 'page' parameter for pagination.

Get TV Schedule By Country.name: Get TV Schedule By Country
Get TV Schedule By Country.description: This API retrieves TV series information such as Name, Season Number, Episode Number, Episode Name, Air Date, Air Time, Runtime, Network, and Series ID for a specified country. It includes error handling for unexpected keyword arguments.

GET TV Series Episodes by Series ID, Sea.name: GET TV Series Episodes by Series ID, Season Number
GET TV Series Episodes by Series ID, Sea.description: Retrieve TV series episodes by providing a valid series ID and season number. The output includes episode number, name, air date, vote average, and vote count for the specified season. Ensure the parameter names in the documentation match the actual function parameters to avoid unexpected errors. The 'Type' parameter should not be included in the API call as it is not a valid parameter for this function.

Get Airing today TV Shows.name: Get Airing today TV Shows
Get Airing today TV Shows.description: Retrieve TV series airing today with their title, id, and year. Ensure correct usage of the 'page' parameter.

Get TV ON the Air.name: Get TV ON the Air

Get Popular TV Shows By Year.name: Get Popular TV Shows By Year
Get Popular TV Shows By Year.description: Retrieve popular TV shows with title, id, and year based on the specified year parameter. The 'Type' parameter is case-sensitive. Ensure the 'Type' parameter is handled correctly in the function.

Get Recently Added TV Series By Release.name: Get Recently Added TV Series By Release Date
Get Recently Added TV Series By Release.description: Retrieve recently added TV series by release date within a specified genre, providing title, id, year, and genre information.

Get TV Series Images by ID.name: Get TV Series Images by ID

Get TV Series by Title.name: Get TV Series by Title

Get by TV Series by ID.name: Get by TV Series by ID
Get by TV Series by ID.description: Retrieve details of a TV series by providing a valid TV Series ID. The API returns title, description, release date, ID, rating, vote count, meta, popularity, and YouTube trailer key. An error message may be returned for invalid parameters or IDs.

Get Movies by Year.name: Get Movies by Year
Get Movies by Year.description: Retrieve movie results based on the specified year and page number. Ensure parameter names are consistent to avoid errors.

Get Similar Movies.name: Get Similar Movies
Get Similar Movies.description: Retrieve similar movies based on a given movie ID, providing title, release date, and ID of the recommended movies. Ensure 'Type' is set to 'get-similar-movies' by default and 'movieid' is the ID of the reference movie. Handle unexpected keyword arguments effectively.

Get Box-Office Movies.name: Get Box-Office Movies
Get Box-Office Movies.description: Retrieve box-office movies based on specified parameters such as genre, providing details like titles, years, and IDs.

Get Similar TV Shows.name: Get Similar TV Shows

Get Recently Added Movies by Release Dat.name: Get Recently Added Movies by Release Date
Get Recently Added Movies by Release Dat.description: Retrieve recently added movies by release date, allowing filtering by genre. Returns movie titles, release years, and IDs.

example.User Query: I'm interested in discovering the most recent drama films that have been added. Could you please show me the latest drama movies in the collection?

106.tool_description: Bing Video Search is a tool that can search for videos, retrieve trending videos, and provide detailed insights about specific videos. This tool has three multiple built-in functions: 1. Trending is to retrieve currently trending videos categorized by different genres. 2. Video Details is to retrieve insights about a video, including engagement metrics and recommended videos. 3. Video Search is to get videos relevant for a given query.

Trending.name: Trending
Trending.description: Retrieve currently trending videos, categorized by different genres. The response may include error messages.

Video Details.name: Video Details

Video Search.name: Video Search

The count parameter determines the number of video results to return, and the offset parameter skips a specified number of results before returning. The API can return error messages if there are issues with the request or an empty response if no relevant videos are found.

optional_parameters.name: safeSearch

optional_parameters.name: mkt
optional_parameters.description:
The market where the results come from. Typically, this is the country where the user is making the request from; however, it could be a different country if the user is not located in a country where Bing delivers results. The market must be in the form -. For example, en-US.

Full list of supported markets:
es-AR, en-AU, de-AT, nl-BE, fr-BE, pt-BR, en-CA, fr-CA, es-CL, da-DK, fi-FI, fr-FR, de-DE, zh-HK, en-IN, en-ID, en-IE, it-IT, ja-JP, ko-KR, en-MY, es-MX, nl-NL, en-NZ, no-NO, zh-CN, pl-PL, pt-PT, en-PH, ru-RU, ar-SA, en-ZA, es-ES, sv-SE, fr-CH, de-CH, zh-TW, tr-TR, en-GB, en-US, es-US

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The number of video results to return in the response. The actual number delivered may be less than requested.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: The zero-based offset that indicates the number of video results to skip before returning results.

108.tool_description: UnitConversion is a tool that can convert various units. This tool has 12 multiple built-in functions: 1. /info is to retrieve detailed information about specific units, including conversions, definitions, and common uses. 2. /volume/:from/:to/:number is to convert volume units from one specified unit to another using a given numerical value. 3. /time/:from/:to/:number is to convert time units accurately and efficiently. 4. /temperature/:from/:to/:number is to convert temperature units between Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin. 5. /pressure/:from/:to/:number is to convert pressure values between different units. 6. /mass/:from/:to/:number is to convert mass units from one specified unit to another. 7. /force/:from/:to/:number is to convert force units between different force units. 8. /data/:from/:to/:number is to convert data units between different formats. 9. /area/:from/:to/:number is to convert area units from one specified unit to another. 10. /angle/:from/:to/:number is to convert between different angle units such as radians, degrees, and turns. 11. /length/:from/:to/:number is to convert length units between meters, feet, and inches.

hex to rgb.name: hex to  rgb
hex to rgb.description: Converts a given hex color code to its corresponding RGB color code. Handles conversion from hex to RGB.

example.User Query: Convert hex color code #abcdef123 to RGB and observe how the tool handles an invalid hex color code

hex to cmyk.name: hex to cmyk
hex to cmyk.description: Converts a given hex color code to its corresponding CMYK color code. This tool may encounter errors related to module imports, such as 'No module named 'data'.

example.User Query: Check the CMYK color code for the hex color #ff5733 and verify the error handling mechanism of the conversion tool.

hex to hsl.name: hex to hsl
hex to hsl.description: Converts a given hex color code to its corresponding HSL color code, with error handling for module import issues.

example.User Query: What happens if I try to convert an invalid hex color code like #123 to HSL?

126.tool_description: Create Container Tracking is a tool that can initiate container tracking. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. Get Tracking Data is to retrieve tracking data for a package by providing the unique tracking ID. 2. Create Tracking is to set up tracking for packages or shipments.

Get Tracking Data.name: Get Tracking Data
Get Tracking Data.description: Retrieve tracking data for a package by providing the unique tracking ID.

example.User Query: I'm interested in knowing the delivery progress of my recent package with tracking ID 7890ab12cd.

Create Tracking.name: Create Tracking
Create Tracking.description: This API function allows users to set up tracking for packages or shipments.

example.User Query: I want to keep tabs on the progress of a high-value item that is being shipped overseas. Can you assist me in setting up tracking for it?

127.tool_description: Pagepeeker is a tool that can automate website screenshots creation. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. Shoot thumbnail is to generate thumbnails of specified sizes from a given URL, with an optional 'refresh' parameter to force regeneration. 2. Thumbnail ready is to poll the API until it indicates that the image is available, with waiting times influenced by webpage complexity.

2. Thumbnail ready.name: 2. Thumbnail ready
2. Thumbnail ready.description: Poll this API until it indicates that the image is available. The response 'IsReady: 0' signifies the image is not yet ready for download. The waiting time for image availability can range from 20 to 60 seconds. The availability of the thumbnail is influenced by the complexity of webpage elements like multiple images and dynamic scripts.

required_parameters.name: size
required_parameters.description: t = Tiny, 90 x 68 pixels;  s= Small, 120 x 90 pixels;  m = Medium, 200 x 150 pixels; l = Large, 400 x 300 pixels;  x = Extra large, 480 x 360 pixels

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The URL to generate the thumbnail from

example.User Query: Please create a large thumbnail for the webpage https://www.examplepage.com that contains multiple images and dynamic scripts.

1. Shoot thumbnail.name: 1. Shoot thumbnail
1. Shoot thumbnail.description: Generates thumbnails of specified sizes from a given URL. Includes an optional 'refresh' parameter; setting it to 1 forces regeneration of the thumbnail. May issue a reset API call when 'refresh' is set to 1.

required_parameters.name: size
required_parameters.description: t = Tiny, 90 x 68 pixels;  s= Small, 120 x 90 pixels;  m = Medium, 200 x 150 pixels; l = Large, 400 x 300 pixels;  x = Extra large, 480 x 360 pixels

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The URL to generate the thumbnail from

optional_parameters.name: refresh
optional_parameters.description: This parameter forces the currently generate d thumbnail to be regenerated.  It is optional and will be ignored unless it contains the value 1

example.User Query: I want a tiny thumbnail without refreshing from the URL https://example.com/image5.jpg.

128.tool_description: Aspose.Imaging Cloud is a tool that can perform demanding imaging routines such as resizing, cropping, rotation, and conversion. This tool has 58 multiple built-in functions: 1. ModifyWmf is to modify WMF images by specifying parameters such as page height, page width, border height, background color, border width, and output format. 2. ConvertImage is to convert images to various formats. 3. ModifyEmf is to modify EMF images by specifying parameters such as filename, background color, border width, border height, page height, and page width. 4. ModifyBmp is to modify the resolution and color depth of a BMP image. 5. ModifyJpeg is to modify JPEG images, offering options for compression type, quality adjustment, and other settings. 6. ModifyPsd is to modify PSD files with customizable parameters like color channels and default values. 7. CropImage is to crop images with precision by defining the starting position, width, and height of the cropping rectangle. 8. GetImageProperties is to provide image properties. 9. GetImageFrameRange is to crop images by specifying coordinates and dimensions, with additional support for image manipulation like rotating and flipping. 10. GetAvailableLabels is to provide access to a list of available labels for object detection using various methods. 11. DeskewImage is to deskew images. 12. ModifyTiff is to modify TIFF images with the ability to adjust various parameters such as resolution unit, horizontal and vertical resolutions, and bit depth. 13. GetImageFeatures is to analyze key elements of an image. 14. GetVisualObjectBounds is to detect objects in images, draw their bounds and labels. 15. FindSimilarImages is to search for similar images based on a provided image. 16. ModifySvg is to process SVG images. 17. GetFilesList is to provide a list of files in a specified folder. 18. ModifyGif is to modify GIF images. 19. GrayscaleImage is to convert images to grayscale. 20. GetObjectBounds is to detect objects in images by selecting object detection methods. 21. ResizeImage is to resize images to specified dimensions. 22. UpdateImage is to update an image by cropping a specific area, scaling it to a new size, and applying rotation or flipping methods. 23. GetFileVersions is to retrieve the versions of a file. 24. ModifyWebP is to modify WebP images. 25. GetDiscUsage is to retrieve the current disk usage information. 26. GetSearchImage is to retrieve an image using the specified image identifier and search context ID. 27. StorageExists is to check the existence of a storage. 28. ConvertTiffToFax is to convert high-resolution TIFF images to fax format. 29. ExtractImageFeatures is to extract features from an image for analysis. 30. ModifyJpeg2000 is to modify JPEG2000 images by adding comments. 31. FindImageDuplicates is to identify duplicate images based on a specified similarity threshold. 32. RotateFlipImage is to rotate and flip images using various RotateFlip methods. 33. DownloadFile is to download files with specified path. 34. GetImageFrame is to crop a specific frame from an image with custom rectangle size and position. 35. ObjectExists is to check if a specified file exists in the given path. 36. GetImageSearchStatus is to verify the progress of an image search. 37. GetImageFrameProperties is to retrieve properties of a specific frame in an image. 38. CreateModifiedJpeg2000 is to create a modified JPEG2000 image with an attached comment. 39. CreateFaxTiff is to convert an image to a fax TIFF format. 40. CreateModifiedGif is to create a modified GIF image with customized color palette and pixel aspect ratio. 41. CreateModifiedEmf is to create a modified image with a specified border around it. 42. AppendTiff is to combine two TIFF images into one file. 43. CreateResizedImage is to resize an image to a specified new height and width. 44. CreateWebSiteImageFeatures is to extract image features from a specified web page. 45. CreateImageFrame is to create a new image frame with specified dimensions and adjustments. 46. CreateImageSearch is to enable image retrieval from a specified folder using the AKAZE detector and the randomBinaryTree matching algorithm. 47. CompareImages is to compare two images to determine their similarity. 48. CreateModifiedJpeg is to modify the quality and compression type of a JPEG image. 49. CreateModifiedWebP is to convert images to WebP format with options for lossless compression and quality settings. 50. CreateModifiedTiff is to modify the bit depth of an image, adjust resolution, and apply compression. 51. CreateModifiedPsd is to compress image files using specified compression methods. 52. AddSearchImage is to add images to a search context for discovering related images. 53. CreateGrayscaledImage is to convert a color image to a grayscale version. 54. CreateImageFrameRange is to generate an image frame range by specifying the start and end frame indices. 55. CreateImageTag is to tag images with specified labels. 56. CreateDeskewedImage is to deskew an image and resize it proportionally. 57. CreateCroppedImage is to crop a specific section of an image. 58. CreateImageFeatures is to extract features from images for analysis. 59. CreateConvertedImage is to convert images to a specified format. 60. CreateUpdatedImage is to crop, scale, and rotate images. 61. CreateVisualObjectBounds is to analyze images to detect objects and draw bounding boxes with labels and scores. 62. CreateObjectBounds is to detect objects in images and draw bounding boxes around them. 63. CreateRotateFlippedImage is to rotate and flip images using various methods. 64. ExtractImageFrameProperties is to extract properties of a specific frame from an image file. 65. FindImagesByTags is to search for images based on specified tags. 66. CreateModifiedWmf is to generate modified images with specific dimensions, background color, and optional border settings. 67. ExtractImageProperties is to analyze image properties like resolution, color depth, and format. 68. CreateModifiedBmp is to modify an image file by adjusting the color depth and resolution. 69. CreateModifiedSvg is to convert images to SVG format with customizable features.

ModifyWmf.name: ModifyWmf
ModifyWmf.description: An API that allows users to modify WMF images by specifying parameters such as page height, page width, border height, background color, border width, and output format. Optional parameters include 'fromScratch', 'storage', and 'folder'.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Export format (PNG is the default one). Please, refer to the export table from https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

example.User Query: I need to process a WMF image with a page height of 600, page width of 400, border height of 15, background color of red, border width of 8, and save it as a BMP format. Can you set the 'storage' parameter to 'myStorage' and process the image from the 'photos' folder?

ConvertImage.name: ConvertImage
ConvertImage.description: This API allows users to convert images to various formats. An active subscription is necessary to access the service and avoid encountering an 'Unsubscribed error'.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

example.User Query: Please convert my image to TIFF format. The image file is named 'tiff_image'.

ModifyEmf.name: ModifyEmf
ModifyEmf.description: A tool for modifying EMF images by specifying parameters such as filename, background color, border width, border height, page height, and page width. Users can set the background color and export the modified image in various formats.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Export format (PNG is the default one). Please, refer to the export table from https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

example.User Query: Please modify the image 'sunset.emf' with a green background, 4px border width, 6px border height, 1200px page height, and 800px page width, and save it in PDF format.

ModifyBmp.name: ModifyBmp
ModifyBmp.description: A tool that modifies the resolution and color depth of a BMP image. Supported parameters include 'name' (Filename of the image), 'bitsPerPixel' (Color depth), and 'verticalResolution' (New vertical resolution). Note that this tool does not support adjusting horizontal resolution.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

example.User Query: I have a BMP image file named 'forest.bmp' that I want to modify. Can you adjust the color depth to 8 bits per pixel and set the horizontal resolution to 800 and vertical resolution to 600?

ModifyJpeg.name: ModifyJpeg
ModifyJpeg.description: An API that allows users to modify JPEG images, offering options for compression type, quality adjustment, and other settings. Subscription to this API is required for access, and unsubscribed users will receive an error message.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: compressionType
optional_parameters.description: Compression type: baseline (default), progressive, lossless or jpegls.

optional_parameters.name: quality
optional_parameters.description: Quality of an image from 0 to 100. Default is 75.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

example.User Query: Please adjust the quality of the image 'mountain.jpg' to 60 and use the 'lossless' compression type.

ModifyPsd.name: ModifyPsd
ModifyPsd.description: ModifyPsd API allows for modifying PSD files with customizable parameters like color channels and default values.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: compressionMethod
optional_parameters.description: Compression method (for now, raw and RLE are supported).

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: channelsCount
optional_parameters.description: Count of color channels.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

example.User Query: I need to process an image file named 'landscape.jpg' in a specific folder 'photos' using raw compression method.

CropImage.name: CropImage
CropImage.description: An API that allows users to crop images with precision by defining the starting position, width, and height of the cropping rectangle. It provides advanced image cropping capabilities, requiring the filename of the image as a parameter.

required_parameters.name: x
required_parameters.description: X position of start point for cropping rectangle.

required_parameters.name: y
required_parameters.description: Y position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

example.User Query: I want to crop an image starting at position (200, 300) with a width of 400 and a height of 500. Please crop the image in TIFF format.

GetImageProperties.name: GetImageProperties
GetImageProperties.description: This API provides image properties, but access requires a subscription with specific limitations. Users may encounter an error message if not subscribed.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

example.User Query: Could you fetch the image properties for the file named 'mountain.jpg' from my Aspose Cloud Storage in the folder 'scenery'?

GetImageFrameRange.name: GetImageFrameRange
GetImageFrameRange.description: Crop images by specifying coordinates and dimensions, with additional support for image manipulation like rotating and flipping using various methods.

required_parameters.name: endFrameId
required_parameters.description: Index of the last frame in range.

required_parameters.name: startFrameId
required_parameters.description: Index of the first frame in range.

optional_parameters.name: x
optional_parameters.description: X position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: rectHeight
optional_parameters.description: Height of cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: newWidth
optional_parameters.description: New width.

optional_parameters.name: saveOtherFrames
optional_parameters.description: If result will include all other frames or just a specified frame.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: y
optional_parameters.description: Y position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: rotateFlipMethod
optional_parameters.description: RotateFlip method (Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate180FlipX, Rotate180FlipXY, Rotate180FlipY, Rotate270FlipNone, Rotate270FlipX, Rotate270FlipXY, Rotate270FlipY, Rotate90FlipNone, Rotate90FlipX, Rotate90FlipXY, Rotate90FlipY, RotateNoneFlipNone, RotateNoneFlipX, RotateNoneFlipXY, RotateNoneFlipY). Default is RotateNoneFlipNone.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: newHeight
optional_parameters.description: New height.

optional_parameters.name: rectWidth
optional_parameters.description: Width of cropping rectangle.

example.User Query: I want to rotate and flip an image named 'landscape.jpg' using the Rotate180FlipX method.

GetAvailableLabels.name: GetAvailableLabels
GetAvailableLabels.description: This API provides access to a list of available labels for object detection using various methods. Subscription is required to use this API. Users can subscribe to access the functionality. The tool may return an error message if the user is not subscribed, indicating that access is restricted without a subscription. The availability of labels may vary based on the object detection method specified in the query.

example.User Query: I want to know which object detection method provides labels specifically for outdoor scenes and landscapes. Can you help me with that?

DeskewImage.name: DeskewImage
DeskewImage.description: An API tool for deskewing images. It requires the 'name' parameter for the image file name.

optional_parameters.name: bkColor
optional_parameters.description: Background color

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Storage

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder

example.User Query: I have an image file named 'scan.tif' that needs deskewing and resizing proportionally.

ModifyTiff.name: ModifyTiff
ModifyTiff.description: A tool to modify TIFF images with the ability to adjust various parameters such as resolution unit, horizontal and vertical resolutions, and bit depth.

optional_parameters.name: resolutionUnit
optional_parameters.description: New resolution unit (none - the default one, inch or centimeter).

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: compression
optional_parameters.description: Compression (none is default). Please, refer to https://apireference.aspose.com/net/imaging/aspose.imaging.fileformats.tiff.enums/tiffcompressions for all possible values.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: horizontalResolution
optional_parameters.description: New horizontal resolution.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: verticalResolution
optional_parameters.description: New vertical resolution.

example.User Query: I would like to change the resolution unit of an image to centimeter and adjust the horizontal and vertical resolutions to 300. The image is named 'example_image.tiff' and is stored in the 'pictures' folder.

GetImageFeatures.name: GetImageFeatures
GetImageFeatures.description: Analyze key elements of an image using the 'imageId' and 'searchContextId' parameters. The 'storage' and 'folder' parameters can be used to specify the location of the image.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

example.User Query: What are the main components identified in the image without providing the storage location?

GetVisualObjectBounds.name: GetVisualObjectBounds
GetVisualObjectBounds.description: An API that detects objects in images, draws their bounds and labels, with customizable options for detection method, color, probability threshold, object scores, blocked labels, and allowed labels.

optional_parameters.name: includeScore
optional_parameters.description: Draw detected objects scores

optional_parameters.name: method
optional_parameters.description: Object detection method

optional_parameters.name: color
optional_parameters.description: Bounds, labels, and scores text color

optional_parameters.name: threshold
optional_parameters.description: Object detection probability threshold in percents

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

optional_parameters.name: includeLabel
optional_parameters.description: Draw detected objects labels

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

optional_parameters.name: blockedLabels
optional_parameters.description: Comma-separated list of blocked labels

optional_parameters.name: allowedLabels
optional_parameters.description: Comma-separated list of allowed labels

example.User Query: Could you analyze the image and detect objects, including their scores, with a probability threshold of 70% and block labels for 'person' and 'car'?

FindSimilarImages.name: FindSimilarImages
FindSimilarImages.description: The 'FindSimilarImages' API searches for similar images based on a provided image, allowing users to set a similarity threshold and maximum count of similar images to be returned.

optional_parameters.name: imageData
optional_parameters.description: Input image

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

optional_parameters.name: imageId
optional_parameters.description: The search image identifier.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

example.User Query: I want to find images that closely resemble a specific picture. The similarity threshold should be set at 0.85, and I need a maximum of 12 similar images returned.

ModifySvg.name: ModifySvg
ModifySvg.description: ModifySvg API allows for processing SVG images, supporting parameters such as name, folder, storage, bkColor, format, pageWidth, pageHeight, textAsShapes, scaleX, scaleY, borderX, borderY, and fromScratch. The colorType parameter is not currently supported. It is important to note that the background color should be specified using 'bkColor' and the export format should be defined using 'format'. The API also supports additional parameters for scaling the image (scaleX and scaleY) and converting text to shapes (textAsShapes).

optional_parameters.name: colorType
optional_parameters.description: Color type for SVG image. Only RGB is supported for now.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: borderY
optional_parameters.description: Border height. Only 0 is supported for now.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: bkColor
optional_parameters.description: Background color (Default is white).

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Export format (PNG is the default one). Please, refer to the export table from https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: borderX
optional_parameters.description: Border width. Only 0 is supported for now.

optional_parameters.name: pageWidth
optional_parameters.description: Width of the page.

optional_parameters.name: textAsShapes
optional_parameters.description: Whether text must be converted as shapes. true if all text is turned into SVG shapes in the convertion; otherwise, false

optional_parameters.name: scaleY
optional_parameters.description: Scale Y.

optional_parameters.name: pageHeight
optional_parameters.description: Height of the page.

optional_parameters.name: scaleX
optional_parameters.description: Scale X.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

example.User Query: Please modify the SVG image 'artwork.svg' by scaling it with a scaleX of 1.5 and a scaleY of 2.0, and convert all text in the image to shapes.

GetFilesList.name: GetFilesList
GetFilesList.description: This API provides a list of files in a specified folder. It requires the 'path' parameter to specify the folder path. The 'storageName' parameter can be used to specify the storage name if needed. Note that the 'storageName' parameter is optional and can be omitted if not needed. Access to this API requires a subscription. The error message for unsubscribed users should be clarified to provide more specific guidance on how to subscribe or access the API.

optional_parameters.name: storageName
optional_parameters.description: Storage name

example.User Query: I need a list of files from the folder '/videos' without specifying a storage name.

ModifyGif.name: ModifyGif
ModifyGif.description: API for modifying GIF images with parameters such as 'name', 'isPaletteSorted', and 'interlaced'. The 'interlaced' parameter specifies if the image is interlaced.

optional_parameters.name: backgroundColorIndex
optional_parameters.description: Index of the background color.

optional_parameters.name: hasTrailer
optional_parameters.description: Specifies if image has trailer.

optional_parameters.name: folder

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: colorResolution
optional_parameters.description: Color resolution.

optional_parameters.name: pixelAspectRatio
optional_parameters.description: Pixel aspect ratio.

optional_parameters.name: isPaletteSorted
optional_parameters.description: Specifies if palette is sorted.

optional_parameters.name: interlaced
optional_parameters.description: Specifies if image is interlaced.

example.User Query: I need to process a GIF image named 'landscape.gif' by modifying the color resolution and setting the image to be interlaced.

GrayscaleImage.name: GrayscaleImage
GrayscaleImage.description: This API allows users to convert images to grayscale. A subscription is required to access this service.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Storage

example.User Query: I want to transform the image 'beach.jpg' into grayscale. Could you provide assistance with this conversion?

GetObjectBounds.description: This API allows users to detect objects in images by selecting object detection methods, returning detected objects' scores and labels, setting object detection probability thresholds, and specifying allowed labels. Subscription is required for API access. An error message will be returned if the user is not subscribed.

optional_parameters.name: method
optional_parameters.description: Object detection method

optional_parameters.name: includeScore

optional_parameters.name: allowedLabels
optional_parameters.description: Comma-separated list of allowed labels

optional_parameters.name: threshold
optional_parameters.description: Object detection probability threshold in percents

optional_parameters.name: includeLabel
optional_parameters.description: Return detected objects labels

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder

example.User Query: I need to detect objects in the image 'mountain.jpg' using a different object detection method and setting the probability threshold to 70%.

ResizeImage.name: ResizeImage
ResizeImage.description: An API that resizes images to specified dimensions. It accurately recognizes the 'newWidth' and 'newHeight' parameters.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

example.User Query: Could you adjust the size of my photo to have a new width of 1500 and a new height of 900?

UpdateImage.name: UpdateImage
UpdateImage.description: An API that enables users to update an image by cropping a specific area, scaling it to a new size, and applying rotation or flipping methods. The API supports various RotateFlip methods for image manipulation. It requires parameters such as 'x', 'y', 'rectWidth', 'rectHeight', 'newHeight', 'newWidth', and 'rotateFlipMethod'.

required_parameters.name: x
required_parameters.description: X position of start point for cropping rectangle.

required_parameters.name: y
required_parameters.description: Y position of start point for cropping rectangle.

required_parameters.name: newHeight
required_parameters.description: New height of the scaled image.

required_parameters.name: newWidth
required_parameters.description: New width of the scaled image.

required_parameters.name: rotateFlipMethod
required_parameters.description: RotateFlip method (Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate180FlipX, Rotate180FlipXY, Rotate180FlipY, Rotate270FlipNone, Rotate270FlipX, Rotate270FlipXY, Rotate270FlipY, Rotate90FlipNone, Rotate90FlipX, Rotate90FlipXY, Rotate90FlipY, RotateNoneFlipNone, RotateNoneFlipX, RotateNoneFlipXY, RotateNoneFlipY). Default is RotateNoneFlipNone.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

example.User Query: I need to crop an image to a custom size, rotate it by 90 degrees, and apply a specific flip method. Can you assist me with this task?

GetFileVersions.name: GetFileVersions
GetFileVersions.description: This API retrieves the versions of a file based on the provided file path. Users need to be subscribed to access this API. If you encounter an 'Unsubscribed error', please follow the subscription instructions. The 'storageName' parameter is not supported.

optional_parameters.name: storageName
optional_parameters.description: Storage name

example.User Query: I need to check the versions of the file stored at '/documents/invoice.docx'

ModifyWebP.name: ModifyWebP
ModifyWebP.description: A tool for modifying WebP images, enabling users to convert images to lossless WEBP format with specified quality, animation loop count, and animation background color.

required_parameters.name: lossLess
required_parameters.description: If WEBP should be in lossless format.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

example.User Query: Convert the image 'mountain_view.webp' to lossless WEBP format with a quality of 75, a black animation background, and an animation loop count of 2.

GetDiscUsage.name: GetDiscUsage
GetDiscUsage.description: The 'GetDiscUsage' API retrieves the current disk usage information.

optional_parameters.name: storageName
optional_parameters.description: Storage name

example.User Query: What is the current disk space usage for the backup storage?

GetSearchImage.name: GetSearchImage
GetSearchImage.description: Retrieve an image using the specified image identifier and search context ID, with optional parameters for folder and storage.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Storage

example.User Query: Retrieve an image with the search context ID 'jkl987' and image ID 'opq654' without specifying a folder but using a different storage option.

StorageExists.name: StorageExists
StorageExists.description: Check the existence of a storage by providing the storage name.

example.User Query: I need to verify if the storage labeled 'ImportantDocs' is in the system.

ConvertTiffToFax.name: ConvertTiffToFax
ConvertTiffToFax.description: ConvertTiffToFax API converts high-resolution TIFF images to fax format. A valid subscription is necessary to utilize this API effectively. Users attempting to use the API without a subscription will encounter an 'Unsubscribed error'. It is crucial to subscribe to the API to avoid this issue.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

example.User Query: Convert a high-resolution TIFF image named 'architecture_plan.tiff' to fax format.

ExtractImageFeatures.name: ExtractImageFeatures
ExtractImageFeatures.description: This API allows users to extract features from an image for analysis. The required parameters include 'searchContextId' for the search context identifier. The 'imageData' parameter is optional for inputting image data.

optional_parameters.name: imageData
optional_parameters.description: Input image

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

example.User Query: I have an image in PNG format that I want to analyze for feature extraction with a specific search context. Can you assist me with this?

ModifyJpeg2000.name: ModifyJpeg2000
ModifyJpeg2000.description: An API that allows users to modify JPEG2000 images by adding comments. Users can specify the filename of the image and the comment to be added. Additional parameters such as storage, folder, and codec can be optionally provided. It also provides error messages for subscription-related issues.

required_parameters.name: comment
required_parameters.description: The comment (can be either single or comma-separated).

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: codec
optional_parameters.description: The codec (j2k or jp2).

example.User Query: Please add two comments 'morning sunlight' and 'serene atmosphere' to the image file 'sunrise' using the j2k codec.

FindImageDuplicates.name: FindImageDuplicates
FindImageDuplicates.description: An API that identifies duplicate images based on a specified similarity threshold. Required parameters include 'similarityThreshold' (NUMBER) and 'folder' (STRING). The 'searchContextId' parameter is not valid for this function. Optional parameter is 'storage' (STRING).

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

example.User Query: Could you help me locate duplicate images in the 'events' folder with a similarity threshold of 0.75?

RotateFlipImage.name: RotateFlipImage
RotateFlipImage.description: An API that enables users to rotate and flip images using various RotateFlip methods. Subscription is required for API access. Supported methods include Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate180FlipX, Rotate180FlipXY, and more. Error messages related to subscription status are provided if access is attempted without a subscription.

required_parameters.name: method
required_parameters.description: RotateFlip method (Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate180FlipX, Rotate180FlipXY, Rotate180FlipY, Rotate270FlipNone, Rotate270FlipX, Rotate270FlipXY, Rotate270FlipY, Rotate90FlipNone, Rotate90FlipX, Rotate90FlipXY, Rotate90FlipY, RotateNoneFlipNone, RotateNoneFlipX, RotateNoneFlipXY, RotateNoneFlipY).

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

example.User Query: I'm looking to rotate and flip an image named 'photo.jpeg' using the RotateNoneFlipX method.

DownloadFile.name: DownloadFile
DownloadFile.description: API for downloading files with specified path. Subscription required. May not support downloading specific versions of files.

optional_parameters.name: storageName
optional_parameters.description: Storage name

optional_parameters.name: versionId
optional_parameters.description: File version ID to download

example.User Query: I want to download the latest version of the file 'presentation.pptx' from the folder '/documents/presentations'. Can you help me with that?

GetImageFrame.name: GetImageFrame
GetImageFrame.description: Crop a specific frame from an image with custom rectangle size and position. The tool supports rotation and flipping options.

optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: x
optional_parameters.description: X position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: rotateFlipMethod
optional_parameters.description: RotateFlip method (Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate180FlipX, Rotate180FlipXY, Rotate180FlipY, Rotate270FlipNone, Rotate270FlipX, Rotate270FlipXY, Rotate270FlipY, Rotate90FlipNone, Rotate90FlipX, Rotate90FlipXY, Rotate90FlipY, RotateNoneFlipNone, RotateNoneFlipX, RotateNoneFlipXY, RotateNoneFlipY). Default is RotateNoneFlipNone.

optional_parameters.name: newHeight
optional_parameters.description: New height.

optional_parameters.name: saveOtherFrames
optional_parameters.description: If result will include all other frames or just a specified frame.

optional_parameters.name: newWidth
