optional_parameters.name: rectWidth
optional_parameters.description: Width of cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: rectHeight
optional_parameters.description: Height of cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: y
optional_parameters.description: Y position of start point for cropping rectangle.

example.User Query: I need to crop a specific frame from the image 'family_photo.png' with a custom rectangle size and position while rotating it 270 degrees and flipping it vertically.

ObjectExists.name: ObjectExists
ObjectExists.description: This API checks if a specified file exists in the given path. Subscription is required for access. It supports checking the existence of files only, not folders. Possible error messages include 'Unsubscribed error'.

required_parameters.name: path
required_parameters.description: File or folder path e.g. '/file.ext' or '/folder'

optional_parameters.name: versionId
optional_parameters.description: File version ID

optional_parameters.name: storageName
optional_parameters.description: Storage name

example.User Query: Could you please confirm if the file '/videos/funny_cat.mp4' exists in the storage?

GetImageSearchStatus.name: GetImageSearchStatus
GetImageSearchStatus.description: This API function enables users to verify the progress of an image search by providing the search context identifier. It requires the 'searchContextId' parameter for operation and may provide specific error messages for unexpected keyword arguments.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

example.User Query: I want to verify the progress of the image search associated with search context ID 'def456' and include the folder information.

GetImageFrameProperties.name: GetImageFrameProperties
GetImageFrameProperties.description: Retrieve properties of a specific frame in an image using the 'name' and 'frameId' parameters.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with image to process.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

example.User Query: What are the properties of frame number 5 in an image file named 'landscape.jpg'?

CreateModifiedJpeg2000.name: CreateModifiedJpeg2000
CreateModifiedJpeg2000.description: This API allows users to create a modified JPEG2000 image with an attached comment. Required parameters include 'imageData' (binary image data) and 'comment'. Optional parameters include 'codec', 'storage', 'outPath', and 'fromScratch'. The 'codec' parameter specifies the codec to be used (j2k or jp2). Setting 'fromScratch' to true uses default values for additional parameters.

required_parameters.name: comment
required_parameters.description: The comment (can be either single or comma-separated).

optional_parameters.name: codec
optional_parameters.description: The codec (j2k or jp2).

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

example.User Query: I want to create a modified JPEG2000 image with a comment using the 'jp2' codec and setting 'fromScratch' to false.

CreateFaxTiff.name: CreateFaxTiff
CreateFaxTiff.description: This API function enables users to convert an image to a fax TIFF format. The required parameter is the binary image data, with optional parameters for specifying Aspose Cloud Storage name and the path to the updated file.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

example.User Query: Is there an API available that can convert a multi-page PDF document to a series of TIFF images?

CreateModifiedGif.name: CreateModifiedGif
CreateModifiedGif.description: This API enables users to create a modified GIF image with customized color palette and pixel aspect ratio. Users can input binary image data along with desired color resolution, pixel aspect ratio, and palette sorting preference to generate the modified GIF image with a unique color palette. The tool also supports additional customization options such as background color index and interlacing.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: hasTrailer
optional_parameters.description: Specifies if image has trailer.

optional_parameters.name: interlaced
optional_parameters.description: Specifies if image is interlaced.

optional_parameters.name: backgroundColorIndex
optional_parameters.description: Index of the background color.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: pixelAspectRatio
optional_parameters.description: Pixel aspect ratio.

optional_parameters.name: colorResolution
optional_parameters.description: Color resolution.

optional_parameters.name: isPaletteSorted
optional_parameters.description: Specifies if palette is sorted.

example.User Query: I'm interested in creating a modified GIF image with a unique color palette and a specific pixel aspect ratio. Can you help me achieve this customization?

CreateModifiedEmf.name: CreateModifiedEmf
CreateModifiedEmf.description: This API allows users to create a modified image with a specified border around it. Users can input the image data, set the border height and width, choose the background color, and define the page dimensions. The output will be the modified image with the specified parameters, supporting export formats like TIFF.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Export format (PNG is the default one). Please, refer to the export table from https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

example.User Query: I have a photo that requires modification with a border. The border should be 20 units high and 10 units wide. I prefer the background color to be black. The image dimensions should be 2000x1500. Can you generate the modified image in TIFF format?

AppendTiff.name: AppendTiff
AppendTiff.description: The 'AppendTiff' API allows users to combine two TIFF images into one file by specifying the original image file name and the image file to be appended.

required_parameters.name: appendFile
required_parameters.description: Image file name to be appended to original one.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder with images to process.

example.User Query: I want to merge a JPEG image 'picture1.jpg' with a PNG image 'drawing1.png'.

CreateResizedImage.name: CreateResizedImage
CreateResizedImage.description: This API allows users to resize an image to a specified new height and width while specifying the resulting image format and storage location. Users provide the image data, new dimensions, format, and storage details to generate a resized image with flexibility in output options.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

example.User Query: I want to resize an image to a new height of 1000 and a new width of 700 while specifying the resulting image format as PNG.

CreateWebSiteImageFeatures.name: CreateWebSiteImageFeatures
CreateWebSiteImageFeatures.description: This API extracts image features from a specified web page by processing the images on the page. Users provide the search context identifier and the URL of the web page as input parameters. Import issues with 'createwebsiteimagefeatures' may require troubleshooting or alternative solutions.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

example.User Query: How can I troubleshoot the import error I encountered when trying to use the image feature extraction API?

CreateImageFrame.name: CreateImageFrame
CreateImageFrame.description: This API function enables users to create a new image frame with specified dimensions and adjustments. It focuses on cropping an image by defining the cropping rectangle's dimensions and starting point coordinates. Importing the 'createimageframe' function correctly is crucial to prevent execution errors.

optional_parameters.name: x
optional_parameters.description: X position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: saveOtherFrames
optional_parameters.description: If result will include all other frames or just a specified frame.

optional_parameters.name: newWidth
optional_parameters.description: New width.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: rectHeight
optional_parameters.description: Height of cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: rectWidth
optional_parameters.description: Width of cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: newHeight
optional_parameters.description: New height.

optional_parameters.name: y
optional_parameters.description: Y position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: rotateFlipMethod
optional_parameters.description: RotateFlip method (Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate180FlipX, Rotate180FlipXY, Rotate180FlipY, Rotate270FlipNone, Rotate270FlipX, Rotate270FlipXY, Rotate270FlipY, Rotate90FlipNone, Rotate90FlipX, Rotate90FlipXY, Rotate90FlipY, RotateNoneFlipNone, RotateNoneFlipX, RotateNoneFlipXY, RotateNoneFlipY). Default is RotateNoneFlipNone.

example.User Query: I would like to rotate an image by 90 degrees and flip it horizontally. Can you help me with that?

CreateImageSearch.name: CreateImageSearch
CreateImageSearch.description: An API that enables image retrieval from a specified folder using the AKAZE detector and the randomBinaryTree matching algorithm. It supports custom storage locations and specific image format requirements. Note: Users may encounter import errors that require resolution.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

optional_parameters.name: detector
optional_parameters.description: The image features detector.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

optional_parameters.name: matchingAlgorithm
optional_parameters.description: The matching algorithm.

example.User Query: How can I customize the storage location for image retrieval using a specific matching algorithm?

CompareImages.name: CompareImages
CompareImages.description: An API that compares two images to determine their similarity. Users need to provide a search context identifier, the IDs of the two images, and optional parameters like folder and storage. Import errors may occur and need to be handled.

required_parameters.name: imageId1
required_parameters.description: The first image Id in storage.

optional_parameters.name: imageData
optional_parameters.description: Input image

optional_parameters.name: imageId2
optional_parameters.description: The second image Id in storage or null (if image loading in request).

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

example.User Query: I want to evaluate the resemblance between two images. The first image is identified by 'img001' in the storage, and the second image is identified by 'img002'. Can you perform the comparison for me?

CreateModifiedJpeg.name: CreateModifiedJpeg
CreateModifiedJpeg.description: An API that modifies the quality and compression type of a JPEG image and saves it with the specified parameters.

optional_parameters.name: quality
optional_parameters.description: Quality of an image from 0 to 100. Default is 75.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: compressionType
optional_parameters.description: Compression type: baseline (default), progressive, lossless or jpegls.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

example.User Query: Can you help me reduce the file size of this image while maintaining good quality? I would like to set the quality to 60 and use the 'lossless' compression type for the modification.

CreateModifiedWebP.name: CreateModifiedWebP
CreateModifiedWebP.description: An API that converts images to WebP format with options for lossless compression and quality settings.

required_parameters.name: lossLess
required_parameters.description: If WEBP should be in lossless format.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

example.User Query: Please convert this image to WebP format with lossless compression, quality set to 90, and specify a custom animation background color of blue.

CreateModifiedTiff.name: CreateModifiedTiff
CreateModifiedTiff.description: This API enables users to modify the bit depth of an image, adjust resolution, and apply compression. Users can input image data in binary format, specify the desired bit depth, set the horizontal and vertical resolution, and choose compression options. The API processes the image based on the provided specifications, allowing for detailed customization of image properties.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: horizontalResolution
optional_parameters.description: New horizontal resolution.

optional_parameters.name: verticalResolution
optional_parameters.description: New vertical resolution.

optional_parameters.name: resolutionUnit
optional_parameters.description: New resolution unit (none - the default one, inch or centimeter).

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: compression
optional_parameters.description: Compression (none is default). Please, refer to https://apireference.aspose.com/net/imaging/aspose.imaging.fileformats.tiff.enums/tiffcompressions for all possible values.

example.User Query: Please adjust the bit depth of this image to 24, set the horizontal resolution to 600, and apply compression to the modified image.

CreateModifiedPsd.name: CreateModifiedPsd
CreateModifiedPsd.description: An API tool that allows users to compress image files using specified compression methods and save the modified image to a designated path in Aspose Cloud Storage. The tool supports specifying the number of color channels for compression and saving the modified image without specifying an output path.

optional_parameters.name: compressionMethod
optional_parameters.description: Compression method (for now, raw and RLE are supported).

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: channelsCount
optional_parameters.description: Count of color channels.

example.User Query: I want to compress an image file with a specified number of color channels and save the modified image without specifying an output path.

AddSearchImage.name: AddSearchImage
AddSearchImage.description: The AddSearchImage API allows users to add images to a search context for discovering related images. It requires the imageId and searchContextId parameters for successful execution.

optional_parameters.name: imageData
optional_parameters.description: Input image

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Storage

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: Folder.

example.User Query: I want to see pictures of snowy mountain peaks.

CreateGrayscaledImage.name: CreateGrayscaledImage
CreateGrayscaledImage.description: This API function converts a color image to a grayscale version using binary input image data. It supports optional parameters for storage and output path. The description should also include guidance on handling potential import errors or execution issues.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image)

example.User Query: I have a collection of TIFF images that I want to convert to grayscale. Could you help me with this conversion process?

CreateImageFrameRange.name: CreateImageFrameRange
CreateImageFrameRange.description: The 'CreateImageFrameRange' API allows users to generate an image frame range by specifying the start and end frame indices. It requires binary image data input along with the indices of the first and last frames. Users can also define a cropping rectangle with width and height parameters. The API handles errors and import issues gracefully.

required_parameters.name: startFrameId
required_parameters.description: Index of the first frame in range.

required_parameters.name: endFrameId
required_parameters.description: Index of the last frame in range.

optional_parameters.name: rectHeight
optional_parameters.description: Height of cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: newHeight
optional_parameters.description: New height.

optional_parameters.name: newWidth
optional_parameters.description: New width.

optional_parameters.name: rotateFlipMethod
optional_parameters.description: RotateFlip method (Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate180FlipX, Rotate180FlipXY, Rotate180FlipY, Rotate270FlipNone, Rotate270FlipX, Rotate270FlipXY, Rotate270FlipY, Rotate90FlipNone, Rotate90FlipX, Rotate90FlipXY, Rotate90FlipY, RotateNoneFlipNone, RotateNoneFlipX, RotateNoneFlipXY, RotateNoneFlipY). Default is RotateNoneFlipNone.

optional_parameters.name: y
optional_parameters.description: Y position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: saveOtherFrames
optional_parameters.description: If result will include all other frames or just a specified frame.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: x
optional_parameters.description: X position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: rectWidth
optional_parameters.description: Width of cropping rectangle.

example.User Query: I would like to create an image frame range from frame 15 to frame 25, with a cropping rectangle of width 120 and height 180. Can you help me with this task?

CreateImageTag.name: CreateImageTag
CreateImageTag.description: This API allows users to tag images with specified labels using the input image data, tag name, and a unique search context identifier. It also supports error handling functionalities and optional parameters like storage and folder.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

optional_parameters.name: folder
optional_parameters.description: The folder.

example.User Query: Please tag this image with the label 'sunset' and store it in the 'nature' folder.

CreateDeskewedImage.name: CreateDeskewedImage
CreateDeskewedImage.description: An API that deskews an image and resizes it proportionally. It takes binary image data as input and provides the option to specify background color for the output image. Additionally, users can define the output path for the updated file.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: bkColor
optional_parameters.description: Background color

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image)

example.User Query: I need to enhance an image by deskewing and resizing it proportionally. Can you demonstrate how the API allows for setting a transparent background color for the output image? I also want to explore the option to specify a custom output path for the updated file.

CreateCroppedImage.name: CreateCroppedImage
CreateCroppedImage.description: The 'CreateCroppedImage' API allows users to crop a specific section of an image based on provided coordinates and dimensions. Required parameters include 'imageData', 'x', 'y', 'width', and 'height'. Optional parameters like 'storage', 'format', and 'outPath' can be used for further customization.

required_parameters.name: y
required_parameters.description: Y position of start point for cropping rectangle.

required_parameters.name: x
required_parameters.description: X position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

example.User Query: I have an image that requires cropping. The area to crop begins at position (200, 300) with a width of 400 and a height of 500. Can you assist me in cropping this image and saving it in JPEG format?

CreateImageFeatures.description: An API that extracts features from images for analysis, requiring a search context identifier and images source folder as input parameters.

optional_parameters.description: Input image

optional_parameters.description: The folder.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

optional_parameters.name: imageId
optional_parameters.description: The image identifier.

optional_parameters.name: imagesFolder
optional_parameters.description: Images source - a folder

CreateConvertedImage.name: CreateConvertedImage
CreateConvertedImage.description: This API provides the functionality to convert images to a specified format, supporting various image formats and types of image data.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

example.User Query: How can I convert a transparent image to WebP format?

CreateUpdatedImage.name: CreateUpdatedImage
CreateUpdatedImage.description: An API that allows users to crop, scale, and rotate images. Users can specify the cropping rectangle's dimensions and starting coordinates, as well as the new dimensions for scaling. Various RotateFlip methods are available for adjusting image orientation.

required_parameters.name: y
required_parameters.description: Y position of start point for cropping rectangle.

required_parameters.name: newHeight
required_parameters.description: New height of the scaled image.

required_parameters.name: rotateFlipMethod
required_parameters.description: RotateFlip method (Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate180FlipX, Rotate180FlipXY, Rotate180FlipY, Rotate270FlipNone, Rotate270FlipX, Rotate270FlipXY, Rotate270FlipY, Rotate90FlipNone, Rotate90FlipX, Rotate90FlipXY, Rotate90FlipY, RotateNoneFlipNone, RotateNoneFlipX, RotateNoneFlipXY, RotateNoneFlipY). Default is RotateNoneFlipNone.

required_parameters.name: newWidth
required_parameters.description: New width of the scaled image.

required_parameters.name: x
required_parameters.description: X position of start point for cropping rectangle.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

example.User Query: I need to apply a sepia filter to an image and save it in JPEG format.

CreateVisualObjectBounds.name: CreateVisualObjectBounds
CreateVisualObjectBounds.description: Analyze images to detect objects and draw bounding boxes with labels and scores. Required parameter 'imageData'. Optional parameters include 'includeLabel', 'includeScore', 'color', 'threshold', 'method', 'allowedLabels', and 'blockedLabels'. Adjust object detection probability threshold and specify detection method. Support for specifying allowed and blocked labels for detection.

optional_parameters.name: includeLabel
optional_parameters.description: Draw detected objects classes

optional_parameters.name: includeScore
optional_parameters.description: Draw detected objects scores

optional_parameters.name: storage

optional_parameters.name: color
optional_parameters.description: Bounds, labels, and scores text color

optional_parameters.name: allowedLabels
optional_parameters.description: Comma-separated list of allowed labels

optional_parameters.name: blockedLabels
optional_parameters.description: Comma-separated list of blocked labels

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image)

optional_parameters.name: threshold
optional_parameters.description: Object detection probability threshold in percents

optional_parameters.name: method
optional_parameters.description: Object detection method

CreateObjectBounds.description: An API that detects objects in images and draws bounding boxes around them. Supports parameters such as allowedLabels, blockedLabels, method, includeScore, threshold, includeLabel, and outPath.

CreateRotateFlippedImage.name: CreateRotateFlippedImage
CreateRotateFlippedImage.description: The 'CreateRotateFlippedImage' API enables users to rotate and flip images using various methods such as Rotate90, Rotate180, and FlipX. Users can specify the input image data and select the desired rotation and flipping method. Additional customization options are available through optional parameters like 'format', 'storage', and 'outPath'.

required_parameters.description: RotateFlip method (Rotate180FlipNone, Rotate180FlipX, Rotate180FlipXY, Rotate180FlipY, Rotate270FlipNone, Rotate270FlipX, Rotate270FlipXY, Rotate270FlipY, Rotate90FlipNone, Rotate90FlipX, Rotate90FlipXY, Rotate90FlipY, RotateNoneFlipNone, RotateNoneFlipX, RotateNoneFlipXY, RotateNoneFlipY).

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Resulting image format. Please, refer to https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

ExtractImageFrameProperties.name: ExtractImageFrameProperties
ExtractImageFrameProperties.description: This API function is designed to extract properties of a specific frame from an image file. Users can retrieve detailed information about a particular frame within the image.

FindImagesByTags.name: FindImagesByTags
FindImagesByTags.description: An API that enables users to search for images based on specified tags with a given similarity threshold and maximum count. Users can refine image searches by specific criteria such as beaches and sunsets.

optional_parameters.description: The folder.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: The storage.

CreateModifiedWmf.name: CreateModifiedWmf
CreateModifiedWmf.description: CreateModifiedWmf API allows users to generate modified images with specific dimensions, background color, and optional border settings. Mandatory parameters include 'imageData', 'pageWidth', 'pageHeight', 'borderY', 'bkColor', 'borderX', and 'format' (defaulting to 'png'). The 'bkColor' parameter accepts color names or codes.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Export format (PNG is the default one). Please, refer to the export table from https://docs.aspose.cloud/display/imagingcloud/Supported+File+Formats#SupportedFileFormats-CommonOperationsFormatSupportMap for possible use-cases.

example.User Query: I'm looking to create a modified image with custom dimensions, a red background color, and a border width of 25.

ExtractImageProperties.name: ExtractImageProperties
ExtractImageProperties.description: This API analyzes image properties like resolution, color depth, and format based on binary image data provided by users.

Parameters.imageData: Binary image data of the park image

CreateModifiedBmp.name: CreateModifiedBmp
CreateModifiedBmp.description: This API allows users to modify an image file by adjusting the color depth and resolution. Users can set the bits per pixel and vertical resolution to desired values. The tool should be updated to ensure the 'createmodifiedbmp' function is correctly imported and accessible for users. It should also support streaming the modified image without saving to a file.

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

example.User Query: I'm working on a project that requires specific image optimization. Could you help me adjust the color depth to 12 bits per pixel and the vertical resolution to 720 pixels? I also need the modified image to be streamed without saving to a file.

CreateModifiedSvg.name: CreateModifiedSvg
CreateModifiedSvg.description: An API that converts images to SVG format with customizable features such as background color and scaling. Supported parameters include 'format', 'bkColor', 'scaleX', 'scaleY'. Refer to the supported file formats table for export format options.

optional_parameters.name: format

optional_parameters.name: scaleX
optional_parameters.description: Scale X.

optional_parameters.name: borderY
optional_parameters.description: Border height. Only 0 is supported for now.

optional_parameters.name: bkColor
optional_parameters.description: Background color (Default is white).

optional_parameters.name: outPath
optional_parameters.description: Path to updated file (if this is empty, response contains streamed image).

optional_parameters.name: fromScratch
optional_parameters.description: Specifies where additional parameters we do not support should be taken from. If this is true – they will be taken from default values for standard image, if it is false – they will be saved from current image. Default is false.

optional_parameters.name: scaleY
optional_parameters.description: Scale Y.

optional_parameters.name: pageWidth
optional_parameters.description: Width of the page.

optional_parameters.name: pageHeight
optional_parameters.description: Height of the page.

optional_parameters.name: textAsShapes
optional_parameters.description: Whether text must be converted as shapes. true if all text is turned into SVG shapes in the convertion; otherwise, false

optional_parameters.name: storage
optional_parameters.description: Your Aspose Cloud Storage name.

optional_parameters.name: colorType
optional_parameters.description: Color type for SVG image. Only RGB is supported for now.

optional_parameters.name: borderX
optional_parameters.description: Border width. Only 0 is supported for now.

example.User Query: Convert a high-resolution TIFF image to SVG format with a custom background color and text conversion settings turned off.

129.tool_name: Air Cargo CO2 Track And Trace
129.tool_description: Air Cargo CO2 Track And Trace is a tool that can track your Air Cargo shipments and measure CO2 with more than 190 airlines. This tool has three multiple built-in functions: 1. PULL (track) is to get tracking information for the shipment by providing a valid AWB. 2. PUSH (unsubscribe) is to facilitate unsubscribing from tracking updates by providing a valid callback URL and AWB. 3. PUSH (subscribe) is to subscribe to receive automatic tracking event updates by providing a valid callback URL and AWB code.

PULL (track).name: PULL (track)
PULL (track).description: By providing a valid AWB, you can get tracking information for the shipment. Users may encounter timeouts, necessitating retry logic implementation. It is crucial to handle potential timeouts by retrying after a delay for successful tracking.

example.User Query: I need to check the current status of my package using the tracking number 555-12345678.

PUSH (unsubscribe).name: PUSH (unsubscribe)
PUSH (unsubscribe).description: This tool facilitates unsubscribing from tracking updates by providing a valid callback URL and AWB. However, there is a known issue with the 'push_unsubscribe' function import that impacts its functionality.

example.User Query: I'm experiencing issues with unsubscribing from tracking updates. Can you help me troubleshoot the problem related to the 'push_unsubscribe' function import?

PUSH (subscribe).name: PUSH (subscribe)
PUSH (subscribe).description: Subscribe to receive automatic tracking event updates by providing a valid callback URL and AWB code.

example.User Query: Can you assist me in subscribing to automatic tracking event updates for my package by providing a callback URL and specifying the AWB code?

130.tool_description: IP ECHO is a tool that can retrieve IP address information. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. text is to retrieve the user's real IP address in plain format. 2. json is to retrieve detailed JSON information for a specific IP address location.

text.name: text
text.description: Retrieve the user's real IP address in plain format. This tool may encounter errors or unexpected responses, including error messages or HTML content like 404 errors.

example.User Query: I need assistance in troubleshooting unexpected responses when trying to retrieve my real IP address. Can you guide me on common causes of errors and how to resolve them?

json.name: json
json.description: Retrieve detailed JSON information for a specific IP address location.

example.User Query: I want to get detailed JSON information for an IP address.

openHAB.name: openHAB
openHAB.description: Smart home integration tool focusing on secure authentication and providing common troubleshooting methods for resolving unauthorized errors during device integration.

example.User Query: What are the common troubleshooting methods available to resolve unauthorized errors when integrating smart home devices?

C++ 17 Versions is to provide a list of compiler version names for C++ 17. 2. C++ 17 Code Compiler is to compile C++ programs with C++17 standard support.

C++ 17 Versions.name: C++ 17 Versions
C++ 17 Versions.description: Provides a list of compiler version names for C++ 17, such as 'g++ 17 GCC 9.1.0' and 'g++ 17 GCC 11.1.0'. Does not offer details on specific optimization options or features of each compiler version.

example.User Query: I'm interested in learning about any specific optimization options available in the 'g++ 17 GCC 9.1.0' compiler version. Can you provide details on this?

C++ 17 Code Compiler.name: C++ 17 Code Compiler
C++ 17 Code Compiler.description: C++ 17 Code Compiler tool for compiling C++ programs with C++17 standard support.

example.User Query: Compile a C++ project with C++17 features on Windows, ensuring compatibility with Visual Studio environment

133.tool_description: giflayer is a tool that can convert video URLs into GIFs. This tool has one built-in function: 1. /capture is to generate GIFs from video URLs, allowing specification of start and end times, setting FPS for quality control, resizing, and cropping.

/capture.name: /capture
/capture.description: Main API endpoint used to generate GIFs from video URLs. Requires an API Access Key for usage. Supports specifying the start and end times for the GIF, setting the Frames per Second (FPS) for quality control, resizing the GIF, and cropping to custom dimensions. Ensure to provide the API Access Key in the required format: access_key=YOUR_ACCESS_KEY.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The video URL you would like to generate a GIF from

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: The starting time (in seconds) of your GIF

required_parameters.name: end
required_parameters.description: The ending time (in seconds) of your GIF

optional_parameters.name: duration
optional_parameters.description: The duration (in seconds) of your GIF

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: resize the GIF to the dimensions of your choice (accepts width and height in pixels) (Default: 300x200)

optional_parameters.name: crop
optional_parameters.description: Crop the GIF to the size of your choice (accepts width and height in pixels)

optional_parameters.name: fps
optional_parameters.description: specify a GIF quality (Frames per Second) of your choice (Default: 15)

optional_parameters.name: trailer
optional_parameters.description: Set to "1" to create default trailer, or specify custom trailer parameters

example.User Query: Create a GIF from a music video starting at 50 seconds and ending at 60 seconds, with a duration of 10 seconds, resize to 500x400 pixels, and set the FPS to 30

/status/200.description: API for checking the subscription status of movies, providing detailed error messages for subscription-related issues.

135.tool_description: MyPEAK Calculator API is a tool that can calculate loan payments and schedules. This tool has two multiple built-in functions: 1. POST - Payment Calculator is to calculate loan payments and schedule based on specific loan details provided by the user. 2. GET - Payment Calculator is to calculate monthly payments for loans with fixed interest rates, term lengths, and loan amounts based on user-defined parameters.

POST - Payment Calculator.name: POST - Payment Calculator
POST - Payment Calculator.description: Calculate loan payments and schedule based on specific loan details provided by the user.

GET - Payment Calculator.name: GET - Payment Calculator
GET - Payment Calculator.description: Calculate monthly payments for loans with fixed interest rates, term lengths, and loan amounts based on user-defined parameters.

example.User Query: Could you assist me in determining the monthly payment for a loan with a 15-year term, an interest rate of 7%, and a loan amount of $180,000?

number.name: number
number.description: Verify if a phone number has been reported for spam activity.

example.User Query: I need to verify the spam report status for the phone number +385333444555.

137.tool_description: Objective-C Code Compiler is a tool that can compile Objective-C code and provide information on different versions of Objective-C. This tool has two multiple built-in functions: 1. Objective-C Versions is to provide information on different versions of Objective-C along with the specific versions of the GCC compiler associated with each Objective-C version. 2. Objective-C Code Compiler is to compile Objective-C code to check for syntax errors and generate executable output.

Objective-C Versions.name: Objective-C Versions
Objective-C Versions.description: Provides information on different versions of Objective-C along with the specific versions of the GCC compiler associated with each Objective-C version. Users can query specific Objective-C versions to retrieve the corresponding GCC compiler versions.

Objective-C Code Compiler.name: Objective-C Code Compiler
Objective-C Code Compiler.description: Objective-C Code Compiler: Compile Objective-C code to check for syntax errors and generate executable output.

138.tool_description: Any Anime is a tool that can provide random anime profile pictures and gifs. This tool has three multiple built-in functions: 1. anime gif is to provide access to anime-related images and videos. 2. anime img is to retrieve images of anime characters with unique hairstyles and magical powers. 3. anime is to provide JSON data and image URLs of anime profile pictures based on specified anime series and characters.

anime gif.name: anime gif
anime gif.description: This tool provides access to anime-related images and videos. The 'anime gif' endpoint is not available. For high-quality images of anime characters with specific attributes like hairstyles and outfits, please refer to the available image search endpoints.

example.User Query: I'm interested in discovering a collection of anime character images with unique hairstyles and futuristic outfits.

anime img.name: anime img
anime img.description: Retrieve images of anime characters with unique hairstyles and magical powers using the API.

example.User Query: I'm curious to see images of anime characters with magical powers. Can you show me a picture of a character with mystical hair accessories?

anime.name: anime
anime.description: Provides JSON data and image URLs of anime profile pictures based on specified anime series and characters. Users can request anime profile pictures of characters from a specific anime series.

example.User Query: Show me anime profile pictures of characters from the anime series 'One Piece'.

139.tool_description: Transitaires is a tool that can manage freight forwarders in New Caledonia. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. Transitaire is to retrieve details of a specific freight forwarder based on the provided ID. 2. Transitaires is to provide a list of freight forwarders specializing in international shipping, including those experienced in handling oversized cargo and perishable goods.

Transitaire.name: Transitaire
Transitaire.description: Retrieve details of a specific freight forwarder based on the provided ID. Note: The API function does not accept the 'id' parameter as expected.

example.User Query: Retrieve specific details of a freight forwarder identified by the code: FFWD321

Transitaires.name: Transitaires
Transitaires.description: Provides a list of freight forwarders specializing in international shipping, including those experienced in handling oversized cargo and perishable goods.

example.User Query: I need a list of freight forwarders who are experts in handling oversized cargo for international shipping.

140.tool_description: Github Repos is a tool that can retrieve GitHub information about repositories of a user. This tool has 1 built-in function: 1. Search is to search for public repositories of a specified user, retrieve repository details such as name, URL, description, and programming language.

Search.name: Search
Search.description: Search for public repositories of a specified user, retrieve repository details such as name, URL, description, and programming language. The tool returns a list of repositories including their names, URLs, descriptions, and programming languages. If no repositories are found for the specified user, an empty list is returned.

example.User Query: Search for public repositories of a user named CodeMaster123 written in Python

141.tool_description: SEO Checker is a tool that can analyze website performance for accessibility, best practices, SEO, and PWA on both desktop and mobile devices. This tool has three multiple built-in functions: 1. Analyze V2 is to analyze website performance for accessibility, best practices, SEO, and PWA on both desktop and mobile devices, providing insights and recommendations for improvement. 2. Analyze is to analyze page speed of a website with options for desktop or mobile strategy and various performance categories including accessibility, best practices, performance, SEO, and PWA. 3. Summary is to provide a summary of the SEO performance for a specified website, including top performing keywords.

Analyze V2.name: Analyze V2
Analyze V2.description: Analyze website performance for accessibility, best practices, SEO, and PWA on both desktop and mobile devices, providing insights and recommendations for improvement. Note: Results may be empty for specific combinations of parameters.

optional_parameters.name: category
optional_parameters.description: the options: **accessibility, best-practices, performance, seo, pwa**. default: performance

optional_parameters.name: strategy
optional_parameters.description: the options: **desktop, mobile** default: empty

example.User Query: I would like to analyze the SEO performance of a website on desktop devices.

Analyze.name: Analyze
Analyze.description: Analyze page speed of a website with options for desktop or mobile strategy and various performance categories including accessibility, best practices, performance, SEO, and PWA. The tool handles rate limit errors and provides guidance on error resolution, especially in cases of rate limit errors.

optional_parameters.name: strategy
optional_parameters.description: the options: **desktop, mobile** default: empty

optional_parameters.name: category
optional_parameters.description: the options: **accessibility, best-practices, performance, seo, pwa**. default: performance

example.User Query: Could you analyze the page speed of a website with a focus on Progressive Web App (PWA) performance for desktop strategy?

Summary.name: Summary
Summary.description: This tool provides a summary of the SEO performance for a specified website, including top performing keywords. It may return an error message if rate limits are exceeded. The tool also offers insights into the website's keyword performance and overall SEO health.

example.User Query: I would like to know the SEO performance summary and top performing keywords for a travel booking website.

142.tool_description: Free URL Un-Shortener is a tool that can reveal the original long URLs from shortened URLs. This tool has one built-in function: 1. Unshorten URL is to unshorten URLs to reveal the original long URL.

url.name: url
url.description: This tool unshortens URLs to reveal the original long URL. It should provide clear and accurate results, but users may need to retry if errors occur.

example.User Query: I'm curious to see the true destination of this shortened URL: https://tiny.cc/1a2b3c

143.tool_description: Ubidots is a tool that can build sensor applications for data capturing, real-time remote monitoring, and getting insights from sensor data. This tool has 10 multiple built-in functions: 1. GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables is to retrieve detailed descriptions and units of measurement for the variables associated with a specified data source. 2. GET /variables/{variable_id} is to retrieve details of a specific variable, including the last value written to it. 3. GET /variables is to retrieve the list of variables associated with a user account. 4. GET /datasources is to retrieve a list of active data sources associated with a user's account. 5. GET /datasources/{datasource_id} is to retrieve an existing data source and its details based on the provided data source ID. 6. GET /variables/{variable_id}/values is to retrieve the values of a specified variable along with their timestamps. 7. POST /variables/{variable_id}/values is to create a new value for a specified variable along with a timestamp. 8. POST /datasources is to create a new data source with variables and attributes. 9. POST /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables is to create a new variable within a specified data source. 10. POST /collections/values is to create values for multiple variables, each associated with a timestamp.

GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variabl.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables
GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variabl.description: This API retrieves detailed descriptions and units of measurement for the variables associated with a specified data source identified by the provided data source ID.

example.User Query: I need to know the detailed descriptions and units of measurement for the variables linked to the data source identified by the code 'pqr321'.

GET /variables/{variable_id}.name: GET /variables/{variable_id}
GET /variables/{variable_id}.description: This API function retrieves details of a specific variable, including the last value written to it, based on the provided 'variable_id' parameter.

example.User Query: I need to analyze the trends of variable DEF over the past month, can you provide me with the historical data?

GET /variables.name: GET /variables
GET /variables.description: Retrieves the list of variables associated with a user account. The X-Auth-Token header is required for permissions to access this endpoint. The API response should be validated for accuracy and consistency with expected behavior.

example.User Query: I'm interested in learning about the security measures in place for accessing my account variables. Can you explain how the X-Auth-Token header enhances authentication and safeguards my data?

GET /datasources.name: GET /datasources
GET /datasources.description: This API function retrieves a list of active data sources associated with a user's account.

example.User Query: Show me all active data sources related to temperature sensors.

GET /datasources/{datasource_id}.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}
GET /datasources/{datasource_id}.description: This resource is intended to retrieve an existing data source and its details based on the provided data source ID. POST_live-streams-liveStreamId-thumbnail sets a custom thumbnail for a live stream. 18. POST_videos-videoId-captions-language uploads captions in a specific language to a video. 19. POST_upload uploads a file to a specified URI. 20. POST_upload-tokens generates upload tokens for video files. 21. POST_videos-videoId-thumbnail sets a new thumbnail for a video. 22. POST_videos-videoId-chapters-language adds chapters in a specified language to a video. 23. POST_players retrieves a list of players associated with a sports team. 24. POST_video creates videos by defining metadata and uploading contents. 25. POST_live-streams sets up and manages live streams. 26. POST_auth-api-key authenticates and receives an access token. 27. POST_players-playerId-logo uploads a logo for a specific player. 28. POST_videos-videoId-source uploads a video file to a specified video ID.

- For a week: 2018-W01, 
- For a month: 2018-01
- For a year: 2018

For a range period:

LIST-videos.description: The 'LIST-videos' API retrieves videos based on specified parameters. 'currentPage' is a required parameter for pagination. 'sortBy' accepts values 'publishedAt' or 'title' for sorting. Filter videos by live stream, tags, and other optional parameters.

POST-video.name: POST-video
POST-video.description: This API allows users to create videos by defining metadata and uploading video contents. Videos are public by default. Users can create a video container for future upload or directly create a video from a third-party server by providing the video's URI. The service supports asynchronous video downloading and provides tutorials on various video-related topics.

POST_auth-api-key.name: POST_auth-api-key
POST_auth-api-key.description: The 'POST_auth-api-key' action is the initial step for authentication on api.video. By submitting your API key, you can authenticate and receive an access token that is valid for one hour (3600 seconds). This action abstracts the authentication process in various SDKs. For a detailed tutorial on authentication, you can refer to [this link](https://api.video/blog/tutorials/authentication-tutorial). An example request and response are provided below for reference.

example.User Query: How can I retrieve information about the videos I have uploaded to the platform using my access token?

172.tool_description: QR Code - Dynamic and Static is a tool that can generate dynamic (content can be changed later) and static QR Codes, fully customized and with constant updates. This tool has 5 multiple built-in functions: 1. List Specific QR Code is to retrieve details of a specific QR code by providing the associated reference number. 2. List All QR Code's is to list all registered QR codes associated with the user's API key. 3. Generate API Key is to generate a single API key to link and modify QR codes. 4. Create Dynamic QR Code is to create dynamic QR codes that can be customized with updated information and varied redirect links. 5. Create Static QR Code is to create static QR codes, allowing updates to the title and description.

List Specific QR Code.name: List Specific QR Code
List Specific QR Code.description: This API endpoint enables users to retrieve details of a specific QR code by providing the associated reference number. A subscription is required for access. If the required 'ref' parameter is missing, an error will occur.

List All QR Code's.name: List All QR Code's

Generate API Key.name: Generate API Key
Generate API Key.description: Generate a single API key to link and modify QR codes. Once generated, securely store the key as it is irreversible and essential for modifying QR codes. Handle errors like 'Unsubscribed error' appropriately.

Create Dynamic QR Code.name: Create Dynamic QR Code
Create Dynamic QR Code.description: This API function allows users to create dynamic QR codes that can be customized with updated information and varied redirect links. Users should be aware of potential errors related to importing functions and be prepared to troubleshoot such issues.

example.User Query: What are the recommended best practices for customizing dynamic QR codes to ensure optimal performance and user engagement?

Create Static QR Code.name: Create Static QR Code
Create Static QR Code.description: This tool enables users to create static QR codes, allowing them to update the title and description. Users should be aware that static QR codes have limitations in terms of content modification once generated.

example.User Query: I am organizing a charity fundraiser event and need to create a static QR code to promote it. The title should be 'Supporting Hope' and the description should highlight the cause and event details.

ScanImageFile is to scan image files to retrieve QR text or Barcode numbers.

174.tool_description: PurgoMalum is a tool that can filter and remove content of profanity, obscenity, and other unwanted text. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. Remove profanity is to filter out profanity from input text, allowing users to personalize the profanity list and substitute profane words with specified text. 2. Check if text contains profanity is to check if the provided text contains profanity or offensive language, returning 'True' if profanity is found and 'False' if no profanity is detected.

Remove profanity.name: Remove profanity
Remove profanity.description: A tool that filters out profanity from input text. Users can personalize the profanity list by adding specific words. It offers the 'fill_text' parameter to substitute profane words with specified text and provides detailed error messages for effective troubleshooting.

optional_parameters.name: add
optional_parameters.description: A comma separated list of words to be added to the profanity list. Accepts letters, numbers, underscores (_) and commas (,). Accepts up to 10 words (or 200 maximum characters in length). The PurgoMalum filter is case-insensitive, so the case of you entry is not important.

optional_parameters.name: fill_text
optional_parameters.description: Text used to replace any words matching the profanity list. Accepts letters, numbers, underscores (_) tildes (~), exclamation points (!), dashes/hyphens (-), equal signs (=), pipes (|), single quotes ('), double quotes ("), asterisks (*), open and closed curly brackets ({ }), square brackets ([ ]) and parentheses (). Maximum length of 20 characters. When not used, the default is an asterisk (*) fill.

optional_parameters.name: fill_char
optional_parameters.description: Single character used to replace any words matching the profanity list. Fills designated character to length of word replaced. Accepts underscore (_) tilde (~), dash/hyphen (-), equal sign (=), pipe (|) and asterisk (*). When not used, the default is an asterisk (*) fill.

example.User Query: I'm looking to clean up a document from any vulgar language. Can you help me add words like 'word1' and 'term2' to the profanity list and replace any inappropriate words with '****'?

Parameters.text: I found some bad word in the text.

Check if text contains profanity.name: Check if text contains profanity
Check if text contains profanity.description: A tool that checks if the provided text contains profanity or offensive language. Returns 'True' if profanity is found, and 'False' if no profanity is detected.

example.User Query: Could you please check if this text contains any vulgar language or offensive words: 'I had a terrible experience at the restaurant last night'?

Parameters.text: I had a terrible experience at the restaurant last night

176.tool_description: tes is a tool that can manage user accounts, pets, and orders for a video and image sharing platform. This tool has 14 multiple built-in functions: 1. logoutUser is to securely log out a user from their account. 2. loginUser is to securely log in users with their credentials. 3. getUserByName is to retrieve user details based on the provided username. 4. getPetById is to return detailed information and images of a pet identified by the specified petId. 5. getInventory is to return a map of status codes ('sold', 'pending', 'available') along with their respective quantities for video and image products. 6. getOrderById is to retrieve information about a specific order by providing the order ID. 7. createUsersWithArrayInput is to enable the creation of multiple user accounts at once by utilizing an array input for user data. 8. createUser is to enable the logged-in user to create a new user account with default settings. 9. createUsersWithListInput is to generate a list of new users with varying access permissions for a video and image sharing platform. 10. addPet is to enable users to add images of their pets to their profiles. 11. updatePetWithForm is to update a pet's details by providing the pet's ID, along with the new name and status. 12. uploadFile is to upload an image for a specific pet ID. 13. placeOrder is to submit orders for video cameras. 14. createUsersWithListInput is to generate a list of new users with varying access permissions for a video and image sharing platform.

logoutUser.name: logoutUser
logoutUser.description: The 'logoutUser' API is used to securely log out a user from their account with additional security measures. It provides functionality to end the user's session. The API response includes a code, type, and message to indicate the outcome of the logout operation. The 'type' field in the response may be labeled as 'unknown' in some cases.

loginUser.name: loginUser
