178.tool_description: YouTube Video Tags is a tool that can retrieve the tags used for YouTube video SEO without any YouTube Data API key. This tool has one built-in function: 1. Get All The Video Tags is to retrieve all the tags used for the SEO of a video along with the video title by providing the 'url' parameter.

Get All The Video Tags.name: Get All The Video Tags
Get All The Video Tags.description: This endpoint retrieves all the tags used for the SEO of a video along with the video title by providing the 'url' parameter. Currently, it only supports YouTube URLs.

example.User Query: I'm curious about the tags used for the SEO of a video. Can you provide me with all the tags and the video title for this Dailymotion URL: https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x7s8z1w?

179.tool_description: pdflayer is a tool that can convert URLs and HTML to high-quality PDFs. This tool has one built-in function: 1. /convert is to convert webpages to PDF with customizable headers, footers, watermarks, and alignment settings.

/convert.name: /convert
/convert.description: Main API endpoint for converting webpages to PDF with customizable headers, footers, watermarks, and alignment settings. Requires an API Access Key for successful calls. Includes options for setting page size, orientation, and other formatting parameters.

required_parameters.name: document_url
required_parameters.description: The URL of the HTML source you would like to convert to PDF. Looking to use pass raw HTML code to the API? Learn more at https://pdflayer.com/documentation#quickstart

optional_parameters.name: document_name
optional_parameters.description: specify a PDF name of up to 180 characters.

optional_parameters.name: custom_unit
optional_parameters.description: set to px (Pixels), pt (Points), in (Inches) or mm (Millimeters)

optional_parameters.name: user_agent
optional_parameters.description: set to your preferred User-Agent header string

optional_parameters.name: accept_lang
optional_parameters.description: set to your preferred Accept-Language header string

optional_parameters.name: text_encoding
optional_parameters.description: set to your preferred text encoding string

optional_parameters.name: auth_user
optional_parameters.description: specify username used to access password-protected site

optional_parameters.name: auth_pass
optional_parameters.description: specify password used to access password-protected site

optional_parameters.name: owner_password
optional_parameters.description: specify owner password to password protect PDF

optional_parameters.name: user_password
optional_parameters.description: specify user password to password protect PDF

optional_parameters.name: page_size
optional_parameters.description: set to preferred page size, e.g. A4, A5, etc.

optional_parameters.name: orientation
optional_parameters.description: set to portrait or landscape

optional_parameters.name: footer_spacing
optional_parameters.description: set to preferred footer spacing value (numeric), e.g. 10

optional_parameters.name: footer_text
optional_parameters.description: set to preferred footer text, e.g. "This is my footer"

optional_parameters.name: footer_url
optional_parameters.description: set to (urlencoded) URL containing your preferred footer HTML elements. Want to use raw HTML code? Learn more at https://pdflayer.com/documentation#pdf_footer

optional_parameters.name: viewport
optional_parameters.description: Set to preferred viewport "width x height", e.g. 320x480

optional_parameters.name: css_url
optional_parameters.description: inject a custom CSS stylesheet using a (urlencoded) URL

optional_parameters.name: delay
optional_parameters.description: specify a delay (in seconds) before PDF is captured

optional_parameters.name: zoom
optional_parameters.description: specify page zoom factor between 0 and 50

optional_parameters.name: watermark_url
optional_parameters.description: specify a watermark URL (urlencoded) containing a PNG or JPG image

optional_parameters.name: watermark_offset_x
optional_parameters.description: specify a horizontal watermark offset, e.g. 10

optional_parameters.name: watermark_offset_y
optional_parameters.description: specify a vertical watermark offset, e.g. 10

optional_parameters.name: watermark_opacity
optional_parameters.description: specify watermark opacity percentage (numeric) between 0 and 100

optional_parameters.name: watermark_in_background
optional_parameters.description: set to 1 to place watermark behind text

optional_parameters.name: title
optional_parameters.description: specify a PDF document title of max. 150 characters

optional_parameters.name: subject
optional_parameters.description: specify a PDF document subject of max. 150 characters

optional_parameters.name: creator
optional_parameters.description: specify a PDF document creator name of max. 150 characters

optional_parameters.name: author
optional_parameters.description: specify a PDF document author name of max. 150 characters

optional_parameters.name: no_javascript
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to disable JavaScript

optional_parameters.name: header_align
optional_parameters.description: set to left, center or right

optional_parameters.name: header_url
optional_parameters.description: set to (urlencoded) URL containing your preferred header HTML elements. Want to use raw HTML code? Learn more at https://pdflayer.com/documentation#pdf_header

optional_parameters.name: footer_align
optional_parameters.description: set to left, center or right

optional_parameters.name: ttl
optional_parameters.description: the time (in seconds) a generated PDF is cached

optional_parameters.name: force
optional_parameters.description: set to 1 to force new PDF

optional_parameters.name: inline
optional_parameters.description: set to 1 to display PDF document inline

optional_parameters.name: encryption
optional_parameters.description: set to 40 (40-bit) or 128 (128-bit)

optional_parameters.name: no_images
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to disable images

optional_parameters.name: no_hyperlinks
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to disable hyperlinks

optional_parameters.name: no_backgrounds
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to disable CSS backgrounds

optional_parameters.name: use_print_media
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to activate CSS @media print declarations

optional_parameters.name: grayscale
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to remove all colours

optional_parameters.name: low_quality
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to generate low quality PDF

optional_parameters.name: forms
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to enable forms on your PDF

optional_parameters.name: no_print
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to disable printing of the final PDF document. Requires encryption, owner_password or user_password to be specified

optional_parameters.name: no_modify
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to disable modification of the final PDF document. Requires encryption, owner_password or user_password to be specified

optional_parameters.name: no_copy
optional_parameters.description: Set to 1 in order to disable the possibility to copy any text of the final PDF document. Requires encryption, owner_password or user_password to be specified

optional_parameters.name: page_width
optional_parameters.description: specify page width (numeric), e.g. 200 (overrides page_size)

optional_parameters.name: page_height
optional_parameters.description: specify page height (numeric), e.g. 600 (overrides page_size)

optional_parameters.name: margin_top
optional_parameters.description: set to preferred top margin value (numeric), e.g. 5

optional_parameters.name: margin_bottom
optional_parameters.description: set to preferred bottom margin value (numeric), e.g. 5

optional_parameters.name: margin_left
optional_parameters.description: set to preferred left margin value (numeric), e.g. 5

optional_parameters.name: margin_right
optional_parameters.description: set to preferred right margin value (numeric), e.g. 5

optional_parameters.name: header_spacing
optional_parameters.description: set to preferred header spacing value (numeric), e.g. 10

optional_parameters.name: header_text
optional_parameters.description: set to preferred header text, e.g. "This is my heading"

optional_parameters.name: dpi
optional_parameters.description: specify the DPI resolution (numerical) between 10 and 10000

example.User Query: Convert a webpage to PDF with a custom header text 'Company Report' aligned to the center, using A3 page size in portrait orientation.

180.tool_description: Jibber Jabber is a tool that can generate random dummy text. This tool has 5 multiple built-in functions: 1. /sentence is to return a single random sentence with customizable word lengths. 2. /paragraph is to generate a paragraph with a specified range of words and customizable sentence structure. 3. /words is to return random words with customizable word lengths. 4. /sentences is to return a single random sentence with a specified number of words. 5. /word is to generate a random word with a specified length.

/sentence.name: /sentence
/sentence.description: Returns a single random sentence with the option to specify the minimum and maximum word lengths. Note: The tool may not support specifying the exact number of words directly.

example.User Query: Generate a random sentence with a total of 8 words, where each word should have a minimum length of 2 characters and a maximum length of 6 characters.

/paragraph.name: /paragraph
/paragraph.description: Generates a paragraph with a specified range of words and allows customization of sentence structure.

example.User Query: Generate a paragraph with 2 sentences, where each sentence contains a minimum of 7 words and a maximum of 10 words.

/words.name: /words
/words.description: Returns random words with the option to specify the minimum and maximum word length.

example.User Query: Could you generate four random words, where each word has a length between 6 and 9 characters?

/sentences.name: /sentences
/sentences.description: Returns a single random sentence with the specified number of words. The tool may not support the 'minimumNumberOfWords' and 'maximumNumberOfWords' parameters as described in the documentation.

example.User Query: Please provide me with a sentence containing at least 8 words and a maximum of 12 words.

/word.name: /word
/word.description: Generates a random word with a specified length. The output may vary based on the tool's internal logic.

example.User Query: Could you generate a random word for me?

181.tool_description: QR Code API_v67 is a tool that can generate QR code images from URLs or strings. This tool has one built-in function: 1. QR Code Image Copy is to generate a QR code image based on the provided URL.

QR Code Image Copy.name: QR Code Image Copy
QR Code Image Copy.description: This API generates a QR code image based on the provided URL. It only supports the 'url' parameter to specify the link.

example.User Query: Please create a QR code for the link www.github.com

182.tool_description: Scala Code Compiler is a tool that can compile and provide compatibility information for Scala code. This tool has two built-in functions: 1. Scala Versions is to provide a list of available Scala versions and retrieve compatibility notes for specific versions. 2. Scala Code Compiler is to compile Scala programs and support the compilation of Scala code snippets into executable programs.

Scala Versions.name: Scala Versions
Scala Versions.description: Scala Versions tool provides a list of available Scala versions, including specific version numbers. It also allows users to retrieve compatibility notes for specific Scala versions, aiding in understanding version changes and updates.

example.User Query: What are the compatibility notes for Scala version 2.12.14?

Scala Code Compiler.name: Scala Code Compiler
Scala Code Compiler.description: Scala Code Compiler tool compiles Scala programs and supports the compilation of Scala code snippets into executable programs.

example.User Query: Compile a Scala program that calculates the area of a circle given the radius

183.tool_description: QR Code_v18 is a tool that can generate a downloadable QR Code as a png from an input text parameter. This tool has one built-in function: 1. qrcode is to generate a QR Code from a given text input, handling special characters and potential connection timeout issues.

qrcode.name: qrcode
qrcode.description: Generate a QR Code from a given text input, handling special characters and potential connection timeout issues.

example.User Query: Generate a QR code for a product description with special characters

Parameters.text: Introducing the new & improved Product XYZ! Limited time offer - 20% off

184.tool_description: MlemAPI is a tool that provides pictures of animals with mlems/bleps. This tool has four built-in functions: 1. New mlem is to return the most recently published 'mlem' content. 2. Mlem ID is to retrieve a specific mlem image by ID in JSON format. 3. Tags is to return all tags related to videos and images. 4. Random mlem is to retrieve a random mlem image with optional parameters for brightness, maximum height, minimum width, tag, maximum width, minimum height, and orientation.

New mlem.name: New mlem
New mlem.description: Returns the most recently published 'mlem' content, but may return an error message like 'Unsubscribed error'. The response may not always include the requested content.

example.User Query: Could you fetch the most recent 'mlem' content for me?

Mlem ID.name: Mlem ID
Mlem ID.description: Retrieves a specific mlem image by ID in JSON format. Access to mlem images by ID is restricted and requires a subscription or specific permissions. Users may encounter an 'Unsubscribed error' if they lack the necessary access permissions.

example.User Query: I need to access an image identified by the unique code 98765, could you assist with that?

Tags.name: Tags
Tags.description: Returns all tags related to videos and images. Requires a subscription to access the API. Users may encounter an 'Unsubscribed error' if not subscribed. It is recommended to subscribe to access the available tags.

example.User Query: Can you provide details on the available subscription plans for accessing the video and image tags API?

Random mlem.name: Random mlem
Random mlem.description: Retrieve a random mlem image with optional parameters for brightness, maximum height, minimum width, tag, maximum width, minimum height, and orientation. Requires subscription for access. May return an 'Unsubscribed error' if not subscribed. Example: Get a random mlem image with a tag related to wildlife, maximum width of 800, minimum height of 400, and in square orientation.

optional_parameters.name: brightness
optional_parameters.description: Image brightness: dark or bright

optional_parameters.name: maxheight
optional_parameters.description: Maximum height

optional_parameters.name: minwidth
optional_parameters.description: Maximum width

optional_parameters.name: minheight
optional_parameters.description: Minimum height

optional_parameters.name: tag
optional_parameters.description: Tag of mlem

optional_parameters.name: maxwidth
optional_parameters.description: Minimum width

optional_parameters.name: orientation
optional_parameters.description: Image orientation: square, landscape, portrait

example.User Query: Show me a random mlem image with a tag related to wildlife, a maximum width of 800, a minimum height of 400, and in square orientation.

185.tool_description: CORS Proxy_v2 is a tool that can solve CORS errors effortlessly. This tool has one built-in function: 1. index__get is to offer a proxy service to bypass website restrictions.

index__get.name: index__get
index__get.description: Subscription-based CORS Proxy tool that offers a proxy service to bypass website restrictions. Unsubscribed users receive an error message prompting subscription.

example.User Query: Can the CORS proxy tool help me bypass restrictions on a specific streaming platform to access geo-blocked content?

186.tool_name: Check page or website loading speed
186.tool_description: Check page or website loading speed is a tool that can measure the loading speed of a webpage or website in seconds. This tool has one built-in function: 1. getPageSpeed is to measure the loading speed of a webpage or website and analyze multiple URLs simultaneously for comparison.

getPageSpeed.name: getPageSpeed
getPageSpeed.description: Measure the loading speed of a webpage or website in seconds. The response value represents the time taken for the specified page to load. The tool can analyze multiple URLs simultaneously for comparison.

example.User Query: Can you analyze the loading speed of three different travel websites to compare their performance?

187.tool_description: Random anime img is a tool that can generate anime images. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. random img anime is to generate a random anime image. 2. 5000img is to provide a selection of approximately 5000 random images for various purposes.

random img anime.name: random img anime
random img anime.description: Random anime image generator that may return a 'NotFoundError' status if no image is found, particularly for specific queries like 'cyberpunk aesthetic'. Varied queries enhance the likelihood of discovering a suitable anime image.

example.User Query: Can you display a random anime image with a cyberpunk aesthetic?

5000img.name: 5000img
5000img.description: This API provides a selection of approximately 5000 random images for various purposes such as browsing, projects, or collections. It does not cater to specific themed image requests.

example.User Query: I'm looking for a diverse set of 5000 images featuring landscapes from around the world. Can you provide me with a selection of such images?

188.tool_description: Temporary Email is a tool that can provide temporary email addresses to help manage spam and unsolicited emails. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. Get Email is to retrieve the email address associated with a given input. 2. Domains list is to retrieve a list of available domains.

Get Email.name: Get Email
Get Email.description: Retrieve the email address associated with a given input. Note the possibility of server errors and provide guidance on handling them effectively.

example.User Query: I'm looking to retrieve the email address of a business contact for a potential collaboration opportunity.

Domains list.name: Domains list
Domains list.description: Retrieve a list of available domains, including potential server errors. The response may include error messages for server issues.

example.User Query: Can you provide insights on the distribution of available domain extensions in the list?

189.tool_description: IMDb top 100 movies is a tool that can retrieve information about the top 100 movies according to IMDb ratings. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. Get Top 100 Movies according to IMDb is to retrieve the top 100 movies based on IMDb ratings, with the option to filter by specific genres. 2. Get a specific Movie by id is to retrieve specific movie details by providing the movie ID.

Get Top 100 Movies according to IMDb.name: Get Top 100 Movies according to IMDb
Get Top 100 Movies according to IMDb.description: Retrieve the top 100 movies based on IMDb ratings, with the option to filter by specific genres. The API response may include an error message for invalid queries or API issues, and the API functionality may not always be reliable.

example.User Query: Which are the top 100 highest-rated science fiction movies on IMDb?

Get a specific Movie by id.name: Get a specific  Movie  by id
Get a specific Movie by id.description: Retrieve specific movie details by providing the movie ID. Details include Cover image, Rank, Title, Thumbnail, Rating, Year, Images, Description, Genre, Director, Writer, and IMDb ID. Ensure correct usage of the 'id' parameter to avoid errors.

example.User Query: Retrieve details for the movie identified by the ID 'movie_7890'.

190.tool_description: Flaticon is a tool that provides access to over 5 million icons and vectors. This tool has multiple built-in functions: 1. Retrieve detailed information about a specific style using its ID. 2. Retrieve detailed information about a specific category using its ID. 3. Retrieve the total number of packs available, categorized into PREMIUM and SELECTION packs. 4. Retrieve a paged list of Flaticon categories. 5. Retrieve the total quantity of premium packs available. 6. Download icons with specified format, color, and size. 7. Get a paged list of information about Flaticon tags. 8. Retrieve detailed information about a specific tag using its ID. 9. Retrieve the total count of SELECTION packs available. 10. Retrieve the total quantity of SELECTION icons available. 11. Search for packs of icons based on specified criteria. 12. Search for icons and obtain a paginated list of results. 13. Retrieve detailed information about a pack using its ID. 14. Retrieve information about packs available at Flaticon. 15. Retrieve a paged list of icons from Flaticon. 16. Retrieve a paged list of information about different design styles available. 17. Retrieve the total number of icons available on the platform. 18. Retrieve the total number of premium icons available. 19. Retrieve detailed information about an icon using its ID. 20. Authenticate credentials via a 'post' request using a private API key to receive a temporary authentication token.

style.name: style
style.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific style based on its ID, handling unexpected keyword arguments and errors appropriately.

example.User Query: I'm curious about a specific style. Can you retrieve detailed information for the style ID 5678?

category.name: category
category.description: Method to retrieve detailed information about a specific category using its ID. Ensure the ID parameter is provided to fetch category details and handle errors gracefully.

example.User Query: What are the details of category ID 456?

totalPacks.name: totalPacks
totalPacks.description: API method to retrieve the total number of packs available at Flaticon, categorized into PREMIUM and SELECTION packs. Requires a valid token for authentication. The tool provides information on the total number of packs available at Flaticon, distinguishing between PREMIUM packs and SELECTION packs. An error message is returned if the token is not found.

example.User Query: What is the ratio of PREMIUM packs to SELECTION packs available at Flaticon?

categories.name: categories
categories.description: API method for retrieving a paged list of Flaticon categories. Requires an authentication token for access and may return error messages related to token authentication.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page about which the request is made. In case it doesn’t exist, it will return page 1.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Number of max. authors returned per request. In case it isn’t requested, it will return 100 categories by default.

example.User Query: How can I filter the categories to only show those related to technology?

totalPacksPremium.name: totalPacksPremium
totalPacksPremium.description: API method to retrieve the total quantity of premium packs available at Flaticon. The count is updated periodically based on the content on flaticon.com. Access to premium packs requires an authentication token. If the token is not found, an error message will be returned.

example.User Query: Can you provide details on how to obtain an authentication token to access premium packs at Flaticon?

download.name: download
download.description: Tool for downloading icons with specified format, color, and size. The format parameter (either 'svg' or 'png') and the icon ID are required. Optional parameters include color (hexadecimal) and size (16, 24, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512). Default color is black, default size is 32px.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: Item format to download. Is possible to choose between 'svg' and 'png' formats. If no format is sent, it will return the item in 'png' format.

optional_parameters.name: color
optional_parameters.description: Monocolor Icons can be downloaded in different colors. Color property has to be a valid hexadecimal color. If no color is sent, it will return the icon in black.

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: Size to download the selected Icon. the valid sizes are: 16, 24, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512. If no size is sent it will return the icon with a size of 32px

example.User Query: Can I download an icon in PNG format with a size of 128px and in red color?

tags.name: tags
tags.description: Method that allows you to get a paged list with information about Flaticon tags that icons or packs have. This method supports pagination and an optional filter based on the presence of stickers.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page about which the request is made. In case it doesn’t exist, it will return page 1.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Number of max. authors returned per request. In case it isn’t requested, it will return 100 styles by default.

optional_parameters.name: havingStickers
optional_parameters.description: Get tags that have stickers

example.User Query: Retrieve a list of tags commonly used with icon packs

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Method that retrieves detailed information about a specific tag using its ID, ensuring compatibility with the expected keyword arguments.

example.User Query: Can you fetch detailed data for tag with ID 789?

totalPacksSelection.name: totalPacksSelection
totalPacksSelection.description: API method that retrieves the total count of SELECTION packs available at Flaticon. Access requires an authentication token. The count is regularly updated to reflect the current availability of SELECTION packs, which contain only SELECTION icons.

example.User Query: What criteria are used to classify an icon as a SELECTION icon on Flaticon?

totalIconsSelection.name: totalIconsSelection
totalIconsSelection.description: API method that retrieves the total quantity of SELECTION icons available at Flaticon. The count is regularly updated to reflect the content on flaticon.com. Access requires a valid token; failure to provide one results in an error message.

example.User Query: Can I filter the selection icons on Flaticon by color?

searchPacks.name: searchPacks
searchPacks.description: Method that enables searching for packs of icons based on specified criteria. The results are presented in a paged list format. Packs may be SELECTION packs or PREMIUM packs, depending on the content. This method supports searching for packs by keywords and ordering the results by priority or date added.

required_parameters.name: orderBy
required_parameters.description:
Order by in results from Flaticon API. You can choose between order the results between 'priority' or 'added'. Priority order will return items ordered by an algorithm based on the downloads ratio. Added order will return items ordered by the date they were added to Flaticon.
For example: `https://api.flaticon.com/v2/search/packs/added?q=media&stroke=2&styleName=gradient&packId=1554346&limit=15`

optional_parameters.name: styleName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by the name of style.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page number

optional_parameters.name: categoryName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by category name.

optional_parameters.name: iconType
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by icon type, valid values are `standard` and  `stickers`

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Number of max. items returned per request. In case it isn’t requested, it will return 100 packs by default.

optional_parameters.name: familyId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by family id.

optional_parameters.name: color
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by color id. Color id `1` means monocolor. Color id `2` means multicolor.

optional_parameters.name: tagsId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by a list of tag ids separated by comma

optional_parameters.name: categoryId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by category id.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: pack url to search for

optional_parameters.name: stroke
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by stroke id. Stroke id `1` means filled. Stroke id `2` means linear.

optional_parameters.name: familyName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by family name.

optional_parameters.name: designerId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by designer id.

optional_parameters.name: styleId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by style id.

optional_parameters.name: designerName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by designer name.

optional_parameters.name: packId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by pack id.

example.User Query: Show me packs of icons related to nature ordered by date added

searchIcons.name: searchIcons
searchIcons.description: Method that enables searching for icons and obtaining a paginated list of results. Icons can be SELECTION or PREMIUM icons. The default order is by priority. The 'orderBy' parameter determines the result order based on 'priority' or 'added'. To prevent 403 errors, refrain from caching data for more than 15 minutes when using SVG icons in result lists. This method now supports filtering icons by designer name, style, color, and stroke.

required_parameters.name: orderBy
required_parameters.description:
Order by in results from Flaticon API. You can choose between order the results between 'priority' or 'added'. Priority order will return items ordered by an algorithm based on the downloads ratio. Added order will return items ordered by the date they were added to Flaticon.
For example: `https://api.flaticon.com/v2/search/icons/added?q=arrow&stroke=2&styleName=gradient&packId=1554346&limit=15`

optional_parameters.name: packId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by pack id.

optional_parameters.name: categoryName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by category name.

optional_parameters.name: designerId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by designer id.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page number

optional_parameters.name: categoryId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by category id.

optional_parameters.name: tagsId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by a list of tag ids separated by comma

optional_parameters.name: familyId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by family id.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: icon url to search for

optional_parameters.name: designerName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by designer name.

optional_parameters.name: color
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by color id. Color id `1` means monocolor. Color id `2` means multicolor.

optional_parameters.name: iconType
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by icon type, valid values are `standard` and `stickers`

optional_parameters.name: stroke
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by stroke id. Stroke id `1` means filled. Stroke id `2` means linear.

optional_parameters.name: familyName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by family name.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Number of max. items returned per request. In case it isn’t requested, it will return 100 packs by default.

optional_parameters.name: styleId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by style id.

optional_parameters.name: styleName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by the name of style.

example.User Query: Show me icons related to nature with a monocolor stroke and limit the results to 20 items

pack.name: pack
pack.description: Method that allows you to retrieve detailed information about a pack, which consists of themed icons. Note that direct querying by ID for available styles may not be supported. Ensure correct API call structure to prevent unexpected keyword argument errors.

example.User Query: Show me the detailed information for pack ID 789 and list any available filtering options for the themed icons.

packs.name: packs
packs.description: Method that allows you to retrieve information about packs available at Flaticon. A pack consists of icons sharing a common theme and may be associated with various styles. The API returns a paged list of packs ordered by priority by default. You can specify the order by using the 'orderBy' parameter with options 'priority' or 'added'. Ensure the 'orderBy' parameter is correctly implemented to allow users to order the results as intended.

required_parameters.name: orderBy
required_parameters.description:
Order by in results from Flaticon API. You can choose between order the results between 'priority' or 'added'. Priority order will return items ordered by an algorithm based on the downloads ratio. Added order will return items ordered by the date they were added to Flaticon.
For example: `https://api.flaticon.com/v2/search/icons/added?q=arrow&stroke=2&styleName=gradient&packId=1554346&limit=15`

optional_parameters.name: designerName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by designer name.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page number

Upon successful authentication, users receive a temporary authentication token for subsequent requests, which expires after an hour. Users must request a new token to maintain API access. For support or further details, contact Flaticon at info@flaticon.com.

191.tool_description: YouTube Video Summarizer is a tool that can generate concise summaries of YouTube videos, highlighting the most important points for easy note-taking and referencing. This tool has two multiple built-in functions: 1. /v1/youtube/summarizeVideoFromCache is to retrieve the summarized content of a specified YouTube video from the cache in markdown format. 2. /v1/youtube/summarizeVideoWithToken is to generate a markdown summary of a YouTube video by providing the video's URL.

/v1/youtube/summarizeVideoFromCache.name: /v1/youtube/summarizeVideoFromCache
/v1/youtube/summarizeVideoFromCache.description: Retrieve the summarized content of a specified YouTube video from the cache in markdown format. The summary is based on previously cached data.

required_parameters.name: videoURL
required_parameters.description: The URL of the YouTube video to get from the summary cache.

example.User Query: I'm looking for a concise summary of the YouTube video available at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pqr321xyz.

/v1/youtube/summarizeVideoWithToken.name: /v1/youtube/summarizeVideoWithToken

Validate email address.description: An API endpoint that validates email addresses, requiring an API Access Key for access. The response includes a boolean 'success' field indicating validation success or failure. It also provides an 'error' object with 'code', 'type', and 'info' fields for detailed error information, such as missing or incorrect API Access Keys.

193.tool_description: SQUAKE is a tool that can help businesses build sustainable products by calculating carbon emissions and purchasing certified climate contributions in real-time. This tool has 6 multiple built-in functions: 1. Purchase is to facilitate the process of making purchases within the logistics domain and handle errors effectively. 2. Checkhealth is to check the health status of a specific system and provide relevant information or error messages. 3. Projects is to provide project status updates, including progress, completion status, and relevant updates. 4. Calculation:AirFreight(simple) is to calculate the cost of air freight for a shipment based on weight, dimensions, origin, and destination. 5. RequestBearerToken is to facilitate the generation of a new bearer token for accessing the logistics system. 6. Refund is to facilitate the refund process for orders, allowing users to initiate refunds for canceled orders and handle various refund scenarios.

Purchase.name: Purchase
Purchase.description: The 'Purchase' tool facilitates the process of making purchases within the logistics domain and handles errors effectively.

example.User Query: I encountered an error while trying to make a purchase for office supplies. How does the system handle import errors and guide users through resolving them?

Checkhealth.name: Checkhealth
Checkhealth.description: A tool that checks the health status of a specific system and provides relevant information or error messages. It may occasionally return unexpected or humorous responses.

example.User Query: I want to assess the operational health of a cloud server and receive any unusual responses or status updates.

Projects.name: Projects
Projects.description: This API provides project status updates for specific projects. Users can request information on the current status of a project, including progress, completion status, and relevant updates. It is important to note that the API response may not always be accurate, and unexpected outcomes or error messages like 'I'm a teapot' may occur. Proper error handling and managing user expectations are crucial.

example.User Query: What is the progress update for project LMN?

Calculation:AirFreight(simple).name: Calculation:AirFreight(simple)
Calculation:AirFreight(simple).description: This API calculates the cost of air freight for a shipment based on weight, dimensions, origin, and destination, with the potential for encountering import issues.

RequestBearerToken.name: RequestBearerToken

example.User Query: I encountered an issue while trying to generate a new bearer token for the logistics system. Can you provide guidance on troubleshooting this problem?

Refund.name: Refund
Refund.description: This API facilitates the refund process for orders, allowing users to initiate refunds for canceled orders and handle various refund scenarios.

example.User Query: How can I process a refund for an order that was delayed beyond the estimated delivery date?

194.tool_description: Scrapey - Link Scraper is a tool that can extract and scrape links from web pages quickly and efficiently. This tool has one built-in function: 1. Scrape Links is to scrape links from a URL, with options to specify the maximum number of links and whether to include query parameters.

Scrape Links.name: Scrape Links
Scrape Links.description: Scrape links from a URL, with the possibility of encountering errors based on website structure or access restrictions. Returns a status of 'ok' even if no links are found. Note: The tool may return an empty list if no links are found. It is crucial to verify the website's structure and access permissions before using the tool.

example.User Query: I'm interested in scraping links from a technology blog 'techblog.com' that covers a wide range of topics, including reviews and tutorials. Can you help me extract up to 15 links from this blog?

195.tool_description: Vimeo is a tool that can manage and retrieve media-related data. This tool has 14 multiple built-in functions: 1. GetAllCategories is to retrieve a list of all available media categories. 2. GetCategoryInfo is to retrieve detailed information about a specified media category. 3. GetRelatedVideos is to provide a list of videos related to a specified category. 4. GetRelatedChannels is to retrieve related YouTube channels based on a specified category. 5. GetVideoFromUser is to retrieve all videos credited to a user. 6. GetVideosByTag is to get a list of videos based on a specified tag. 7. GetAllChannels is to get a list of all public channels sorted by various criteria. 8. GetChannelVideos is to retrieve a list of videos from a specified channel. 9. GetRelatedTags is to get related tags based on the provided category. 10. SearchVideos is to search for videos based on the provided search terms. 11. GetChannelInfo is to retrieve detailed information about a single channel. 12. GetRelatedPeople is to retrieve a list of related individuals within the entertainment industry for a specified category. 13. GetVideosComment is to retrieve comments for a video. 14. GetRelatedTags is to get related tags based on the provided category.

GetAllCategories.name: GetAllCategories
GetAllCategories.description: The 'GetAllCategories' API in the 'Media' category retrieves a list of all available media categories. It requires a 'format' parameter, which can be 'json', 'xml', or 'php', with 'json' as the default. A valid consumer key is necessary for successful API calls. If the consumer key is invalid, the API returns an error message in the specified format, including an error code and message to help diagnose the issue. The error message typically includes a 'stat' field indicating failure and an 'err' object with 'code' and 'msg' fields. Ensure the consumer key is correct to avoid authentication errors.

example.User Query: I am trying to troubleshoot an issue with my API call. Can you simulate a scenario where the consumer key is invalid and show me the error message in JSON format?

GetCategoryInfo.name: GetCategoryInfo
GetCategoryInfo.description: The GetCategoryInfo API is designed to retrieve detailed information about a specified media category. To access this API, a valid consumer key is mandatory for authentication. The API requires two parameters: 'category', which is the name of the category to be queried, and 'format', which specifies the desired response format (options are 'json', 'xml', or 'php'). If the API call is successful, it returns detailed information about the specified category in the chosen format. In the event of an error, the API provides a structured error response with a code and message to assist in troubleshooting. For example, a 401 error code indicates an invalid consumer key. It is essential to ensure the consumer key is valid and the response format is correctly specified to avoid errors. The API response includes a 'generated_in' field indicating the time taken to generate the response, and a 'stat' field indicating the status of the request ('ok' for success, 'fail' for failure).

example.User Query: Can you provide detailed information about the 'Technology' category in PHP format?

GetRelatedVideos.name: GetRelatedVideos
GetRelatedVideos.description: The GetRelatedVideos API provides a list of videos related to a specified category. Authentication requires a valid consumer key or API key, and an error code 401 indicates an invalid key. The 'category' parameter must be a predefined category such as 'technology', 'sports', or 'entertainment'. The 'format' parameter specifies the response format, which can be 'json', 'xml', or 'php'. Optional parameters include 'page' and 'per_page' for pagination, and 'summary_response' or 'full_response' to control the level of detail in the response. The response includes a 'generated_in' field indicating the response time.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: The page number to show.

optional_parameters.name: per_page
optional_parameters.description: Number of items to show on each page. Max 50.

optional_parameters.name: summary_response
optional_parameters.description: Set this parameter to get back more information.

optional_parameters.name: full_response
optional_parameters.description: Set this parameter to get back the full video information.

example.User Query: I'm curious about the latest entertainment videos. Could you provide a detailed response in XML format?

GetRelatedChannels.name: GetRelatedChannels
GetRelatedChannels.description:
This API allows you to retrieve related YouTube channels based on a specified category. Authentication is required via a valid consumer key, which must be included in the API call. Required parameters include 'category' (the category name) and 'format' (response format: json, xml, or php). Optional parameters are 'page' (the page number to show) and 'per_page' (the number of items to show on each page, with a maximum of 50). The response will include details such as the time taken to generate the response, the status of the request, and any error messages if applicable. Possible error codes include:

- 401: Invalid consumer key. Ensure that you are using a valid and active consumer key for authentication.

Example API Call:

GET /getrelatedchannels?category=cooking&format=json&per_page=10

Note: The 'category' parameter should be a valid YouTube category. For a list of valid categories, refer to [YouTube Categories].

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: The page number to show.

optional_parameters.name: per_page
optional_parameters.description: Number of items to show on each page. Max 50.

example.User Query: I'm interested in learning about gardening. Can you find some YouTube channels related to gardening and show me the first 15 channels?

GetVideoFromUser.name: GetVideoFromUser
GetVideoFromUser.description: Retrieve all videos credited to a user (both uploaded and appeared in). A valid consumer key is required for all API requests. The 'format' parameter should be specified as 'json', 'xml', or 'php'. The 'user_id' parameter is mandatory and can be either the ID number or username of the user. Optional parameters include 'sort' (newest, oldest, most_played, most_commented, most_liked), 'page' (page number to display), 'per_page' (number of items per page, max 50), 'summary_response' (brief information), and 'full_response' (detailed information). Note that 'summary_response' and 'full_response' are mutually exclusive. Error handling includes codes such as '401: Invalid consumer key'. Ensure the consumer key is valid before making a request. Example of a successful API call: {'format': 'json', 'user_id': '12345', 'sort': 'newest', 'page': 1, 'per_page': 5, 'summary_response': True}. Expected response format: {'generated_in': '0.0024', 'stat': 'ok', 'response': {...}}.

required_parameters.name: user_id
required_parameters.description: The ID number or username of the user. A token may be used instead.

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Method to sort by: newest, oldest, most_played, most_commented, or most_liked.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: The page number to show.

optional_parameters.name: per_page
optional_parameters.description: Number of items to show on each page. Max 50.

optional_parameters.name: summary_response
optional_parameters.description: Set this parameter to get back more information.

optional_parameters.name: full_response
optional_parameters.description: Set this parameter to get back the full video information.

GetVideosByTag.description: Get a list of videos based on a specified tag, with sorting options by relevance, newest, oldest, most played, most commented, or most liked. Pagination available for displaying a set number of items per page.

This tool has one built-in function: 1. getQrcode is to generate QR codes in various formats such as URL, text, phone number, email, and SMS by specifying the type and corresponding value.

The API provides the URL of the generated QR code image for embedding on websites or downloading, and may return error messages for invalid endpoints.

197.tool_description: Deep Image is a tool that can perform deep image analysis and apply various image transformations. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. /rest_api/deep_image/result/{jobHash} is to retrieve deep image analysis results based on the provided job hash. 2. /rest_api/deep_image/transform is to apply various transformations to enhance an image, such as ganzoom2, ganzoom3, ganzoom4, ganzoomnoise1, ganenhance1, or enhance_light, and optionally receive email notifications upon job completion.

/rest_api/deep_image/result/{jobHash}.name: /rest_api/deep_image/result/{jobHash}
/rest_api/deep_image/result/{jobHash}.description: This API retrieves deep image analysis results based on the provided job hash.

example.User Query: I would like to access the in-depth analysis findings associated with the job hash 'lmn321'.

/rest_api/deep_image/transform.name: /rest_api/deep_image/transform
/rest_api/deep_image/transform.description: Apply various transformations to enhance an image, such as ganzoom2, ganzoom3, ganzoom4, ganzoomnoise1, ganenhance1, or enhance_light. Optionally receive email notifications upon job completion.

required_parameters.name: transformations
required_parameters.description: Transformation name can be: ganzoom2-jpg90, ganzoom3-jpg90, ganzoom4-jpg90, ganzoomnoise1-jpg90, ganenhance1-jpg90, enhance_light. You can also pass string e.g. ganzoom4-jpg90,ganzoomnoise1-jpg90.

required_parameters.name: fileName
required_parameters.description: Image data base-64 encoded. Currently supported file types - https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/handbook/image-file-formats.html#fully-supported-formats

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: Optional email address when you want to be notified about finished job.

198.tool_description: 👋 Demo Project_v12 is a tool that can retrieve posts, weather information, product details, and order details. This tool has 7 multiple built-in functions: 1. Get Posts_copy is to retrieve posts from a community including user information, post images, titles, likes, and verification status. 2. Me is to provide current weather information for a specified city and country. 3. Get Product is to retrieve product details based on the provided product ID. 4. Get Posts is to retrieve posts from the platform based on user information, post images, titles, likes, and verification status. 5. Get Products in Category is to retrieve products in a specified category with options to limit and skip results. 6. Get Order is to retrieve order details using the correct parameter. 7. Get User Orders is to retrieve user order details securely through proper authentication.

Get Posts_copy.name: Get Posts_copy
Get Posts_copy.description: Retrieve posts from a community including user information, post images, titles, likes, and verification status. The tool supports sorting and filtering posts based on various criteria such as likes, titles, and user-specific information. Posts can be filtered based on verification status.

example.User Query: Find posts with the keyword 'travel' that are verified.

Me.name: Me
Me.description: A tool that provides current weather information for a specified city and country. It may encounter errors related to unexpected keyword arguments.

example.User Query: What is the weather like in London, United Kingdom right now?

Get Product.name: Get Product
Get Product.description: This API retrieves product details based on the provided product ID.

example.User Query: I'm looking for information on the product with ID 24680, can you retrieve the details for me?

Get Posts.name: Get Posts
Get Posts.description: Retrieve posts from the platform based on user information, post images, titles, likes, and verification status. Filter posts by category and date range.

201.tool_description: ViewDNS is a tool that can perform various DNS-related tasks. This tool has 15 multiple built-in functions: 1. Whois is to display owner/contact information for a domain name. 2. Port Scanner is to check the status of common ports on a server. 3. Traceroute is to determine the series of servers that data traverses to a specified domain or IP address. 4. DNS Record Lookup is to retrieve DNS records for a specified domain name. 5. Ping is to check the reachability of a host by sending a ping request. 6. IP Location Finder is to provide geographic information for a given IP address. 7. Chinese Firewall Test is to check the accessibility of a website from behind the Great Firewall of China. 8. Spam Database Lookup is to verify if an IP address is blacklisted for spam. 9. Free Email Lookup is to check if a domain supports free email services. 10. MAC Address Lookup is to identify the manufacturer of a network device by its MAC Address. 11. Abuse Contact Lookup is to find the abuse contact address for a domain name. 12. DNS Propagation Checker is to check whether recent changes to DNS entries have propagated globally. 13. Iran Firewall Test is to check if a website is accessible in Iran in real-time. 14. Reverse DNS Lookup is to find the reverse DNS entry for a given IP address.

Whois.name: Whois
Whois.description: Displays owner/contact information for a domain name in XML or JSON format. Access to this WHOIS tool requires a paid API key for full functionality.

required_parameters.name: domain
required_parameters.description: the domain to perform a whois lookup on

example.User Query: I need the owner information for the domain techcompany.com in JSON format.

Port Scanner.name: Port Scanner
Port Scanner.description: This web-based port scanner checks the status of common ports on a server and requires a valid API key for access. Users may encounter error messages related to invalid or disabled API keys.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: the host to perform the port scanner on (domain or IP address)

example.User Query: Please perform a port scan on the server with the domain name 'example.com' and provide the results in XML format.

Traceroute.name: Traceroute
Traceroute.description: Determines the series of servers that data traverses from the ViewDNS server to the specified domain name or IP address. It also handles potential API key-related errors. The tool provides detailed information on the route taken by data packets, including any encountered errors or issues related to the API key. It assists in troubleshooting network connectivity problems and identifying potential bottlenecks. The tool supports output formats in XML and JSON for flexibility in data presentation. The description emphasizes the importance of a valid and enabled API key for successful traceroute operations.

required_parameters.name: domain
required_parameters.description: the domain or IP address to perform a traceroute on

example.User Query: Could you trace the route to testdomain123.com in XML format?

DNS Record Lookup.name: DNS Record Lookup
DNS Record Lookup.description: Retrieve DNS records (A, MX, CNAME, etc.) for a specified domain name. A valid API key is required for successful retrieval. Contact the webmaster if issues persist.

required_parameters.name: domain
required_parameters.description: the domain name to lookup DNS records for

optional_parameters.name: recordtype
optional_parameters.description: the type of DNS record you wish to retrieve (default 'ANY')

example.User Query: Could you please provide me with the DNS records of the domain 'newwebsite.com' in JSON format?

Ping.name: Ping
Ping.description: Check the reachability of a host by sending a ping request and receive HTTP status codes like 403 Forbidden for certain hosts. The tool provides information on the host's accessibility and may return status codes indicating access restrictions or errors. The tool also provides insights into potential access issues, such as 403 Forbidden errors, which can help diagnose connectivity problems.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: the domain or IP address to perform a ping on

example.User Query: Please ping the host www.example.com in XML format.

IP Location Finder.name: IP Location Finder
IP Location Finder.description: This tool provides geographic information for a given IP address, including city, country, latitude, and longitude. A valid API key is required for access, and error messages related to invalid or disabled keys are provided for troubleshooting.

required_parameters.name: ip
required_parameters.description: the ip address to find the location of

example.User Query: Could you fetch the geographic data for the IP address 185.63.76.10 in JSON format?

Chinese Firewall Test.name: Chinese Firewall Test
Chinese Firewall Test.description: Checks the accessibility of a website from behind the Great Firewall of China by testing for symptoms of DNS poisoning. The tool requires a valid API key for successful testing. Ensure your API key is valid and enabled to receive accurate results. Contact support if API key-related errors persist.

example.User Query: Could you test the accessibility of www.streamingplatform.com from behind the Great Firewall of China in JSON format?

Spam Database Lookup.name: Spam Database Lookup
Spam Database Lookup.description: Verify if an IP address is blacklisted for spam by checking multiple spam databases. Results can be obtained in XML or JSON format. Ensure a valid API key is provided for successful verification.

required_parameters.name: ip
required_parameters.description: the IP address to test for spam blacklisting

example.User Query: I want to verify if the IP address 8.8.8.8 is marked as spam. Please provide the results in JSON format.

Free Email Lookup.name: Free Email Lookup
Free Email Lookup.description: Check if a domain supports free email services and identify any issues with the API key provided. The tool will indicate whether the domain offers free email services and if there are any problems with the API key, such as being invalid or disabled. The output will specify if there was an error processing the API key and provide guidance on how to resolve the issue.

required_parameters.name: domain
required_parameters.description: the domain name to test for free email services

example.User Query: Could you check if the domain newcompany.net supports free email services and provide the results in XML format?

MAC Address Lookup.name: MAC Address Lookup
MAC Address Lookup.description: This tool identifies the manufacturer of a network device by its MAC Address. It supports XML and JSON output formats. Error messages related to API key validation may be returned.

example.User Query: Can you provide me with the manufacturer information for the MAC address 00-1A-2B-3C-4D-5E in XML format?

Abuse Contact Lookup.name: Abuse Contact Lookup
Abuse Contact Lookup.description: This tool is used to find the abuse contact address for a domain name. It helps identify the appropriate contact for reporting abusive behavior associated with a specific domain. A valid and enabled API key is required for access. The tool provides the abuse contact details in either XML or JSON format based on the user's preference. If there are issues with the API key, an error message will be returned indicating a potential problem with the key's validity or status.

required_parameters.name: domain
required_parameters.description: the domain name to find the abuse contact for

example.User Query: I need to report abusive behavior originating from a domain named cyberthreatsolutions.org. Can you assist me in locating the abuse contact details in XML format?

DNS Propagation Checker.name: DNS Propagation Checker
DNS Propagation Checker.description: Check whether recent changes to DNS entries have propagated globally for a specified domain. Provides a status report on DNS propagation in JSON or XML format. Ensure your API key is valid and enabled to access this service. The tool may return error messages related to API key validation or service availability.

example.User Query: Determine the DNS propagation status for the domain 'newwebsite.net' in JSON format.

Iran Firewall Test.name: Iran Firewall Test
Iran Firewall Test.description: Check if a website is accessible in Iran in real-time. Note that an invalid or disabled API key may lead to errors in processing. Contact the webmaster for assistance if needed.

example.User Query: Please check the current accessibility status of www.travelblog.com in Iran.

Reverse DNS Lookup.name: Reverse DNS Lookup
Reverse DNS Lookup.description: Find the reverse DNS entry (PTR) for a given IP address. Ensure your API key is valid and enabled before making requests. The tool may return an error message related to API key validation issues.

required_parameters.name: ip
required_parameters.description: the IP address to retrieve the reverse DNS record for

example.User Query: What is the reverse DNS record for the IP address 123.45.67.89 in JSON format?

SMS QR Code is to generate a Static QR Code for sending an SMS with a pre-loaded message to a specific phone number. 2. V-Card QR Code is to generate a Static QR Code for business contact cards. 8. Website URL QR Code is to generate a Static QR Code with a specified URL.

Email QR Code.name: Email QR Code

Customization options include background color, eye pattern, error correction level, and various design elements. Available data patterns for customization include RECT, ROUND, MINI_LEAF, CHIPS, FIREFLY, ROUNDED_CORNERS, VERTICAL_PIPES, HORIZONTAL_PIPES, VERTICAL_NIGHT_LIFE, HORIZONTAL_NIGHT_LIFE, PANCARDS, CURVED_RECTS, NAWABI_DARWAZA, ROTATED_SQUARES, ROTATED_RECTS, HAND_IN_HANDS, RANDOM_ROTATE, ALTERNATE_DIAGONAL, CIRCLE_ON_CORNERS, CONNECTED_HAMMERS, CONNECTED_CIRCLES, POINTED_BEAKS, MAZE, CURVED_MAZE, TRIANGLES, VERTICAL_TRIANGLES, HORIZONTAL_TRIANGLES, HUT, CIRCULAR_DIAGONAL, LIGHT_CIRCLE, LIGHT_SQUARE, LIGHT_ROUNDED_CORNERS, LIGHT_CIRCLE_SQUARE, NOOVERLAP_ROUND_CORNER.

Phone Call QR Code.name: Phone Call QR Code

Google Map QR Code.name: Google Map QR Code

The tool supports a variety of eye patterns and data gradient styles.

Wifi QR Code.name: Wifi QR Code

When scanned, the QR code prompts the device to join the network. iPhones will display network details as text instead of joining automatically. It is essential to use correct values for the 'authentication' parameter (WPA, WEP, unencrypted) to prevent errors. Customization options include QR code size and background color.

Text QR Code.name: Text QR Code
Text QR Code.description: This API generates a Static QR Code as a PNG image encoded with specified text. Users can customize the QR Code with unique data, size, data gradient colors, eye patterns, background colors, and error correction levels.

Customization options include heart-shaped eye pattern, circular data pattern, and pastel gradient style for a soft aesthetic.

example.User Query: Create a QR code for a business contact card with a heart-shaped eye pattern, circular data pattern, and a pastel gradient style for a soft aesthetic.
