required_parameters.description: The type of barcode can be one of qr_code, code_128a, code_128b, code_128c, code_25, code_25_interleaved, code_25_iata, code_39, code_93, gs1_128, ean_13, bookland, ean_8, upc_supplemental, codabar

example.User Query: Create a code_25 barcode for an inventory item with a unique identifier

260.tool_description: Watchmode is a tool that can provide information on universal OTT streaming service availability. This tool has 20 multiple built-in functions: 1. Title Episodes is to retrieve all episodes of a TV series or mini-series along with the streaming sources available for each episode. 2. Autocomplete Search is to search for titles and people by name or partial name. 3. Streaming Release Dates is to get a listing of recently released or coming soon titles on major streaming services with US release dates. 4. Search is to search for titles or people using external IDs (IMDB, TheMovieDB.org) or by name. 5. Person is to retrieve specific details on a person in the entertainment industry by providing their unique identifier. 6. List Titles is to retrieve a list of titles based on specified parameters for detailed and specific searches. 7. Regions is to return a listing of all regions (countries) supported by Watchmode along with their 2-letter country codes, country names, flag image URLs, data tier, and premium plan availability status. 8. Sources is to return a listing of streaming sources supported by Watchmode, with optional filtering by type of source (subscription, free, etc) and regions. 9. Genres is to return a comprehensive list of entertainment genres along with their corresponding IDs and tmdb_ids where available. 10. New Titles is to get a listing of the title IDs of new titles added to Watchmode within a specified date range. 11. Networks is to retrieve a list of TV networks associated with a specific title, such as a movie or TV show. 12. Title Details is to get detailed information about a specific title using the Watchmode ID, IMDB ID, or TMDB type and ID combination. 13. Title Seasons is to retrieve all seasons of a TV show or mini-series by providing the title's unique identifier. 14. Title Streaming Sources is to retrieve streaming sources and direct links for a title based on its Watchmode ID, IMDB ID, or TMDB type and ID combination. 15. Title Cast & Crew is to retrieve all individuals associated with a title, including the cast (actors) and crew (directors, writers, cinematographers, etc). 16. Titles with Changed Sources is to get a listing of titles that have recently changed their streaming sources within a specified date range. 17. New People is to retrieve a listing of the ids of new people added to Watchmode within a specified date range. 18. Titles with Changed Episodes is to retrieve a list of entertainment titles that have had updates to their episodes within a specified date range. 19. Titles with Changed Details is to get a listing of movie and TV special titles that have had changes to their basic details (overview, cast, genres, ratings, etc) within a specified date range.

Title Episodes.name: Title Episodes
Title Episodes.description: Retrieve all episodes of a TV series or mini-series along with the streaming sources available for each episode. The API also provides error handling for unexpected keyword arguments.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
This ID can be the Watchmode ID of the title (returned by other endpoints such as the list-titles endpoint), or found in the mapping file: https://api.watchmode.com/datasets/title_id_map.csv.

You can also pass an IMDB ID here instead, or a TMDB type and TMDB ID combination. For example, the TMDB combination for The Shawshank Redemption is movie-278 and for Breaking Bad is tv-1396.

example.User Query: I want to explore the episodes and streaming platforms available for the TV show with the Watchmode ID 987654.

Autocomplete Search.name: Autocomplete Search
Autocomplete Search.description: Search for titles and people by name or partial name. Retrieve results with fields like 'name', 'type', 'year', 'result_type', 'tmdb_id', and 'image_url'. Filter results by titles, movies, TV shows, or people using the 'search_type' parameter.

required_parameters.name: search_value
required_parameters.description: The phrase to search for, can be a full title or person name, or a partial phrase. For example searching for \"The sha\" will find the movie \"The Shawshank Redemption\".

optional_parameters.name: search_type
optional_parameters.description: Set this to 1 to include titles and people in results. Set this to 2 to include titles only. Set this to 3 to include movies only. Set this to 4 to include TV only. Set this to 5 to include people only. By default this is set to 1.

example.User Query: Find movies and people related to the title 'Inception'

Streaming Release Dates.name: Streaming Release Dates
Streaming Release Dates.description: Get a listing of recently released or coming soon titles on major streaming services with US release dates. Users can set a start date, end date, and limit the number of results. The API may experience occasional connection issues.

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, this endpoint will return release dates from the current date through the next 30 days. Populate this parameter to manually set a start date to include releases from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many release dates to return, default is 500.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, this endpoint will return release dates from the current date through the next 30 days. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include releases from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

example.User Query: What are the latest streaming releases on Netflix from March 15th, 2023 to March 31st, 2023?

Search.name: Search
Search.description: Search for titles or people using external IDs (IMDB, TheMovieDB.org) or by name. Retrieve an array of result objects representing titles or people. Ideal for obtaining information about titles and people. Example: Search for a person by their IMDB ID and receive relevant results.

required_parameters.name: search_field
required_parameters.description:
The field for us to search in, either a 3rd party ID or \\\"name\\\" which will search for a movie/show title or a person's name depending on the type(s) set. Must be one of the following options:
imdb_id, tmdb_person_id, tmdb_movie_id, tmdb_tv_id, name.

required_parameters.name: search_value
required_parameters.description: The value we should search for. For example, if you set search_field to imdb_id, this would be the IMDB title/person ID, eg. tt0944947.

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description:
Pass one of the following values, or multiple comma separated values to only return certain types:
tv, movie, person.

example.User Query: Retrieve information about a person by searching with their IMDB ID nm0000194.

Person.name: Person
Person.description: Retrieve specific details on a person in the entertainment industry by providing their unique identifier. The API function requires a specific format for the identifier parameter.

example.User Query: Can you provide information on a renowned actress with the unique identifier 9876543?

List Titles.name: List Titles
List Titles.description: Retrieve a list of titles based on specified parameters for detailed and specific searches. Utilize genres, types, source IDs, and regions to find titles that match specific criteria. Results are paginated with a default of 250 pages per query. Streaming sources are restricted to the USA for free plans.

optional_parameters.name: genres
optional_parameters.description: Filter results to only include certain genre(s). Pass in a single genre id (which you would get from the /v1/genres/ endpoint, or multiple comma separated.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many titles to return per page, default and maximum is 250.

optional_parameters.name: source_ids
optional_parameters.description:
Pass an individual ID for a source (returned from the /sources/ endpoint) to filter the results to titles available on that source. Pass multiple values comma separated to return titles available on one of the sources you pass in.
Note: If you populate this you can only set a single region, and if you set no region US will be set by default.

optional_parameters.name: source_types
optional_parameters.description:
Filter results to only include titles that are available on a specific type(s) of source (such a subscription, or TV Everywhere channel apps, etc). By default all are selected, pass one or multiple (comma delimited) of these values: sub, rent, buy, free, tve
Note: If you populate this you can only set a single region, and if you set no region US will be set by default.

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description: Filter result to only include certain types of titles. Pass a single type or pass multiple types comma delimited. Possible values: movie, tv_series, tv_special, tv_miniseries, short_film

optional_parameters.name: regions
optional_parameters.description:
Pass one of the region values (eg. US), or multiple regions comma delimited to only return sources active in those regions. Currently supported regions: US, GB, CA, AU
Note: If you populate the source_ids or source_types you can only set a single region, and if you set no region US will be set by default.

optional_parameters.name: sort_by
optional_parameters.description: Sort order of results, possible values: relevance_desc, relevance_asc, popularity_desc, popularity_asc, release_date_desc, release_date_asc, title_desc, title_asc. Default value is: relevance_desc.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Set the page of results you want to return, if this isn't set you will always get page 1 returned.

optional_parameters.name: network_ids
optional_parameters.description: Pass an individual ID for a TV network (returned from the /networks/ endpoint) to filter the results to titles the originally aired on that TV network. Pass multiple values comma separated to return titles that aired on one of the networks you passed in.

optional_parameters.name: release_date_start
optional_parameters.description: Set the start of a range for when the title was released (the initial release of the movie or show, not necessarily when it was released on a streaming service). For example, to only include releases on or after January 1, 2001 set this to 20010101

optional_parameters.name: release_date_end
optional_parameters.description: Set the end of a range for when the title was released (the initial release of the movie or show, not necessarily when it was released on a streaming service). For example, to only include releases on or before December 11, 2020 set this to 20201211

example.User Query: Could you provide a list of action movies and TV series available for streaming in Australia released after 2015?

Regions.name: Regions
Regions.description: Return a listing of all regions (countries) supported by Watchmode along with their 2-letter country codes, country names, flag image URLs, data tier, and premium plan availability status.

example.User Query: Can you provide a list of regions supported by Watchmode with the highest data tier available?

Sources.name: Sources
Sources.description: Return a listing of streaming sources supported by Watchmode, with optional filtering by type of source (subscription, free, etc) and regions. The tool allows users to discover available streaming sources based on specific regions and types like subscription, free, purchase, and TV channel apps.

optional_parameters.name: regions
optional_parameters.description: Pass one of the region values (eg. US), or multiple regions comma delimited to only return sources active in those regions. Currently supported regions: US, GB, CA, AU

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description:
Pass one of the following values, or multiple comma separated values to only return certain types of streaming sources:
sub, free, purchase, tve. \\\"sub\\\" means the service is a subscription service, \\\"tve\\\" means the service is a TV channel app.

example.User Query: What are the TV channel app streaming sources available for free in Australia?

Genres.name: Genres
Genres.description: Return a comprehensive list of entertainment genres along with their corresponding IDs and tmdb_ids where available, providing users with a detailed overview of available genres for various entertainment options.

example.User Query: Can you recommend some lesser-known entertainment genres that are trending recently?

New Titles.name: New Titles
New Titles.description: Get a listing of the title IDs of new titles added to Watchmode within a specified date range. Access to this feature requires a paid plan. Filter results by types such as movies, TV series, TV specials, TV miniseries, and short films. Set start and end dates to specify the date range for the new titles you want to find. Note: The changes endpoint is only available with paid plans.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Set the page of results you want to return, if this isn't set you will always get page 1 returned.

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description: Filter result to only include certain types of titles. Pass a single type or pass multiple types comma delimited. Possible values: movie, tv_series, tv_special, tv_miniseries, short_film

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many titles to return per page, default and maximum is 250.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021).

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a start date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021).

example.User Query: Discover new TV series and short films added to Watchmode in the last month

Networks.name: Networks
Networks.description: Retrieve a list of TV networks associated with a specific title, such as a movie or TV show, based on the provided title. The response includes network names, origin countries, and TMDB IDs.

example.User Query: Which TV networks aired the series 'The Crown' in the United Kingdom?

Title Details.name: Title Details
Title Details.description: Get detailed information about a specific title using the Watchmode ID, IMDB ID, or TMDB type and ID combination. Customize the language of the details returned.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
This ID can be the Watchmode ID of the title (returned by other endpoints such as the list-titles endpoint), or found in the mapping file: https://api.watchmode.com/datasets/title_id_map.csv.

You can also pass an IMDB ID here instead, or a TMDB type and TMDB ID combination. For example, the TMDB combination for The Shawshank Redemption is movie-278 and for Breaking Bad is tv-1396.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: Two letter iso_639_1 language code. Return the title and plot overview in the language of your choosing (default is EN). If this is set, and not to EN, then an additional field called english_title will be returned with the title in English if available.

example.User Query: Can you provide detailed information for the title with the TMDB ID movie-550 in German?

Title Seasons.name: Title Seasons
Title Seasons.description: Retrieve all seasons of a TV show or mini-series by providing the title's unique identifier in Watchmode ID, IMDB ID, or TMDB type and ID format. Ensure correct usage of the 'id' parameter to prevent errors.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
This ID can be the Watchmode ID of the title (returned by other endpoints such as the list-titles endpoint), or found in the mapping file: https://api.watchmode.com/datasets/title_id_map.csv.

You can also pass an IMDB ID here instead, or a TMDB type and TMDB ID combination. For example, the TMDB combination for The Shawshank Redemption is movie-278 and for Breaking Bad is tv-1396.

example.User Query: I'm interested in knowing the seasons available for the TV show with the IMDB ID 'tt0903747'. Could you please fetch that information for me?

Title Streaming Sources.name: Title Streaming Sources
Title Streaming Sources.description: Retrieve streaming sources and direct links for a title based on its Watchmode ID, IMDB ID, or TMDB type and ID combination. Optional filtering by country using the 'regions' parameter. Note potential errors and unexpected keyword arguments that users may encounter.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
This ID can be the Watchmode ID of the title (returned by other endpoints such as the list-titles endpoint), or found in the mapping file: https://api.watchmode.com/datasets/title_id_map.csv.

You can also pass an IMDB ID here instead, or a TMDB type and TMDB ID combination. For example, the TMDB combination for The Shawshank Redemption is movie-278 and for Breaking Bad is tv-1396.

optional_parameters.name: regions
optional_parameters.description: Pass one of the 2 character country codes from the /regions/ endpoint to filter the streaming source results to certain countries. By default the API will return all regions. Pass multiple countries by submitting them comma separated.

example.User Query: Could you please list all the streaming sources available for the title with the TMDB ID movie-550 in Canada?

Title Cast & Crew.name: Title Cast & Crew
Title Cast & Crew.description: Retrieve all individuals associated with a title, including the cast (actors) and crew (directors, writers, cinematographers, etc). The 'id' parameter should be in the correct format, such as Watchmode ID, IMDB ID, or TMDB type and ID combination, to avoid unexpected keyword argument errors.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
This ID can be the Watchmode ID of the title (returned by other endpoints such as the list-titles endpoint), or found in the mapping file: https://api.watchmode.com/datasets/title_id_map.csv.

You can also pass an IMDB ID here instead, or a TMDB type and TMDB ID combination. For example, the TMDB combination for The Shawshank Redemption is movie-278 and for Breaking Bad is tv-1396.

example.User Query: Please provide me with the cast and crew information for the title with the Watchmode ID 123456.

Titles with Changed Sources.name: Titles with Changed Sources
Titles with Changed Sources.description: Get a listing of titles that have recently changed their streaming sources within a specified date range. Note: This endpoint is only available with paid plans. The tool provides information on titles, including the title name, previous source, and new source. Users can filter results by region and title type. Maximum of 250 titles can be returned per page.

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a start date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many titles to return per page, default and maximum is 250.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: regions
optional_parameters.description: Pass in the 2 character region code (eg US) for the country you want to get titles with changed sources from. There is a limit to 1 region on this endpoint, if you leave this field blank US changes will be returned only.

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description: Filter result to only include certain types of titles. Pass a single type or pass multiple types comma delimited. Possible values: movie, tv_series, tv_special, tv_miniseries, short_film

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Set the page of results you want to return, if this isn't set you will always get page 1 returned.

example.User Query: What movies have changed their streaming sources in Canada for the month of August 2021?

New People.name: New People
New People.description: Retrieve a listing of the ids of new people added to Watchmode within a specified date range. Access to this endpoint is restricted to paid plans.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Set the page of results you want to return, if this isn't set you will always get page 1 returned.

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a start date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many titles to return per page, default and maximum is 250.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

example.User Query: Who are the most recent users that have joined the platform? Please show me the new additions starting from October 10th, 2021 until October 20th, 2021. I'd like to receive 150 entries.

Titles with Changed Episodes.name: Titles with Changed Episodes
Titles with Changed Episodes.description: Retrieve a list of entertainment titles that have had updates to their episodes within a specified date range. Access to this API endpoint is restricted to paid plans.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a start date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021).

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set the page of results you want to return, if this isn't set you will always get page 1 returned.

example.User Query: What entertainment shows have had updates to their episodes between June 5th, 2022 and June 15th, 2022?

Titles with Changed Details.name: Titles with Changed Details
Titles with Changed Details.description: Get a listing of movie and TV special titles that have had changes to their basic details (overview, cast, genres, ratings, etc) within a specified date range. Note: The changes endpoint is only available with paid plans.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Set the page of results you want to return, if this isn't set you will always get page 1 returned.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many titles to return per page, default and maximum is 250.

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description: Filter result to only include certain types of titles. Pass a single type or pass multiple types comma delimited. Possible values: movie, tv_series, tv_special, tv_miniseries, short_film

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a start date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

example.User Query: I want to see the changes in ratings and cast for movies and TV specials between May 10th, 2022 and May 20th, 2022.

261.tool_description: URL Shortener is a tool that can generate short URLs, provide information about short link codes, and offer click data and referring sources for specified short URLs. This tool has three multiple built-in functions: 1. short-urls is to generate a short URL for a given long URL. 2. short-urls/{code} is to provide information about a short link code, including potential error responses. 3. short-urls/{code}/visits is to provide click data and referring sources for a specified short URL.

short-urls/{code}/visits.name: short-urls/{code}/visits
short-urls/{code}/visits.description: Provides click data and referring sources for a specified short URL. Access may be restricted based on subscription levels.

example.User Query: Could you please give me insights into the click details and referring sources for the short URL linked to the code 'mP47s'?

short-urls/{code}.name: short-urls/{code}
short-urls/{code}.description: Provides information about a short link code, including potential error responses like '404 page not found'. The response format includes error messages for different scenarios encountered with the short link code.

example.User Query: I encountered an issue with the short link code Z9kPL, can you provide details about the error message?

short-urls.name: short-urls
short-urls.description: Generate a short URL for a given long URL. This tool simplifies the process of creating shareable shortened links. Note: Custom alias setup may involve additional steps or permissions and could encounter import errors.

example.User Query: I'm organizing a virtual event and need to distribute the registration link widely. Can you assist me in creating a short URL for the registration page?

262.tool_description: Calendar Converter is a tool that can convert dates between different civil, religious, and historical calendars. This tool has one built-in function: 1. Convert Date is to convert a date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format to various calendar formats including Gregorian, Julian, French Republican, Maya, Islamic, and Hebrew.

Convert Date.name: Convert Date
Convert Date.description: Converts a date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format to various calendar formats including Gregorian, Julian, French Republican, Maya, Islamic, and Hebrew. The 'from' parameter is not utilized and can be omitted. Users should validate the date format before making a request and be aware that application errors may occur, leading to unexpected responses.

required_parameters.name: to
required_parameters.description:
The calendar to convert the specified date.

Possible values are:

- Gregorian
- Julian
- FrenchRepublican
- Maya
- Islamic
- Hebrew

example.User Query: What is the date February 29, 2000 in the Julian calendar?

263.tool_description: Referral Domain checker API is a tool that can get referral domains of a website, backlink counts, ranks, etc. This tool has 1 built-in function: 1. Get Referral Domains is to discover top referral domains for a specified domain based on metrics like backlinks, dofollow backlinks, and domain inlink rank.

Get Referral Domains.name: Get Referral Domains
Get Referral Domains.description: Discover top referral domains for a specified domain based on metrics like backlinks, dofollow backlinks, and domain inlink rank.

example.User Query: I want to discover the top referral domains for the website getexample.com with a significant number of dofollow backlinks.

264.tool_description: Exerra phishing check is a tool that can identify and analyze phishing attempts. This tool has three multiple built-in functions: 1. Get stats is to retrieve statistics on phishing attempts, including the number of domains and links involved in attacks across different industries. 2. Check a URL is to check if a URL is a known phishing attempt and provide phishing status along with domain information. 3. Get all is to retrieve domains involved in phishing activities based on the specified type, such as healthcare organizations.

Get stats.name: Get stats
Get stats.description: Retrieve statistics on phishing attempts, including the number of domains and links involved in attacks across different industries, to provide insights into the distribution of phishing activities based on Exerra Phishing API data.

example.User Query: I'm interested in understanding the distribution of phishing attempts across various industries. Can you provide insights on the number of phishing domains and links involved in attacks on healthcare organizations?

Check a URL.name: Check a URL
Check a URL.description: Check if a URL is a known phishing attempt and provide phishing status along with domain information.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description:
This is the URL that the API will check.
Must be a valid HTTP(s) URL or it will throw a 400

example.User Query: Is the link https://suspiciouslink.net safe to open?

Get all.name: Get all
Get all.description: Retrieve domains involved in phishing activities based on the specified type, such as healthcare organizations. The response may be empty if no phishing attempts are found for the specified type. This is a paid endpoint with JSON response format. Provide details on the expected response format and reasons for an empty response.

example.User Query: Retrieve domains involved in phishing activities related to healthcare organizations.

265.tool_description: Background removal_v2 is a tool that can remove image backgrounds through API. This tool has 1 built-in function: 1. Check Status is to check the server's status to determine if it is up and running.

Check Status.name: Check Status
Check Status.description: Check the server's status to determine if it is up and running. Provides a message if the server is not running or if the requested API does not exist.

example.User Query: What information does the server status API provide when the server is down?

266.tool_description: Endpoint Monitor Tool is a tool that can test endpoints at custom intervals with email notifications and previous result comparison. This tool has six multiple built-in functions: 1. GetUser is to retrieve and return the current user data based on the specified userId parameter. 2. RemoveEndpointData is to remove an endpoint from a user account by ID. 3. GetEndpointData is to retrieve endpoint data based on the specified UserId and EndpointId. 4. UpdateEndpoint is to update an existing API endpoint with new authentication parameters, including custom headers. 5. SubmitUserData is to facilitate the creation of new user profiles. 6. CreateEndpoint is to create a new API endpoint for a user.

GetUser.name: GetUser
GetUser.description: Retrieves and returns the current user data based on the specified userId parameter. Ensure compatibility to prevent unexpected keyword argument issues.

example.User Query: I'm interested in obtaining the user data associated with the userId '24680'. Could you please retrieve that information for me?

RemoveEndpointData.name: RemoveEndpointData
RemoveEndpointData.description: Remove an endpoint from a user account by ID. This API requires a subscription for access. Unsubscribed users will receive an error message indicating they are not subscribed. The 'src property must be a valid json object' error is a known issue with RAPIDAPI. Provide guidance on resolving subscription-related errors.

example.User Query: I would like to remove a specific endpoint for a user with the user ID '24680'. Can you help me with this action?

GetEndpointData.name: GetEndpointData
GetEndpointData.description: This API retrieves endpoint data based on the specified UserId and EndpointId.

required_parameters.name: EndpointId
required_parameters.description: The Id of the endpoint requested

example.User Query: Get information for user '24680' linked to endpoint 'vwxyz'

UpdateEndpoint.name: UpdateEndpoint
UpdateEndpoint.description: Updates an existing API endpoint with new authentication parameters, including custom headers. Ensure accurate reflection of functionality and potential errors.

example.User Query: I want to enhance the security of my API endpoint by updating it with a new client secret for authentication.

SubmitUserData.name: SubmitUserData
SubmitUserData.description: SubmitUserData API facilitates the creation of new user profiles, essential for accessing additional system functionalities.

example.User Query: I need to set up a new user profile with advanced security preferences and specific access controls for a high-level client who just joined our premium service.

CreateEndpoint.name: CreateEndpoint
CreateEndpoint.description: Creates a new API endpoint for a user. The tool may encounter import errors with the 'createendpoint' function.

example.User Query: How can I securely integrate a new API endpoint into my existing system?

267.tool_description: ykapi is a tool that can search for videos and images based on a specified query term. This tool has one built-in function: 1. search is to find videos and images using a search query.

search.name: search
search.description: The search API allows users to search for videos and images based on a specified query term. Users should ensure the query term matches the expected parameter name to avoid errors.

example.User Query: Find videos of cute animals for children

268.tool_description: utile-space is a tool that can provide various useful functionalities for software engineers and others. This tool has 3 multiple built-in functions: 1. /health is to retrieve system health information with potential 404 error responses and the option to access specific subsystem health details. 2. /dns/{domain} is to provide the IP address associated with the given domain name. 3. /d{die} is to roll a die with a specified number of faces to generate a random outcome.

/health.name: /health
/health.description: API for retrieving system health information with potential 404 error responses and the option to access specific subsystem health details.

example.User Query: Get the health status of the network subsystem.

/dns/{domain}.name: /dns/{domain}
/dns/{domain}.description: This tool provides the IP address associated with the given domain name. It may return an error message if the domain is not found or if there are issues with DNS resolution. Ensure the domain name is correctly formatted and active to receive accurate results.

example.User Query: What is the IP address associated with abc123xyz.com?

/d{die}.name: /d{die}
/d{die}.description: Roll a die with a specified number of faces to generate a random outcome. Suitable for various scenarios such as games, decision-making, and role-playing. The die can have between 2 and 100 faces.

example.User Query: Simulate a coin flip to decide which team starts the game in a sports competition.

269.tool_description: ArabicCountryList is a tool that can retrieve a list of countries available in both Arabic and English. This tool has one built-in function: 1. countryList is to retrieve a list of countries available in both Arabic and English.

countryList.name: countryList
countryList.description: Retrieve a list of countries available in both Arabic and English. The API does not require any parameters and may return an error message for certain headers or query parameters.

example.User Query: I'm researching countries with diverse cultural backgrounds. Can you provide me with a list of countries available in both Arabic and English that are located in different continents?

270.tool_description: Temp Email is a tool that can generate temporary, disposable email addresses swiftly and securely. This tool has 7 multiple built-in functions: 1. Create Email is to generate a unique email address for general purposes, including testing and temporary use. 2. Fetch ALL Emails is to retrieve email messages associated with a specific email token. 3. Delete Email is to delete the email associated with the provided token. 4. List Domains is to retrieve a list of domains associated with a specified email address. 5. Delete Message is to delete a specific email message by providing the message ID. 6. Fetch Message is to retrieve the message content for a given message ID. 7. Change Email is to update an email address by specifying the current email, new email, and domain.

Create Email.name: Create Email
Create Email.description: Generate a unique email address for general purposes, including testing and temporary use.

example.User Query: Can I generate a unique email address with a specific domain extension for testing purposes?

Fetch ALL Emails.name: Fetch ALL Emails
Fetch ALL Emails.description: Retrieve email messages associated with a specific email token. Ensure proper setup to avoid module import issues.

required_parameters.name: email_token
required_parameters.default: Get email messages of the provided Email Token

example.User Query: Retrieve all email messages linked to the email token 'def456'.

Delete Email.name: Delete Email
Delete Email.description: Delete the email associated with the provided token. Handle errors related to module import and execution with clear error messages for module import issues.

required_parameters.name: email_token
required_parameters.default: The email token you want to delete

example.User Query: I encountered an error while trying to delete an email using the provided token 'error456'. Can you help me understand the specific issues related to module imports and execution that might have caused this error?

List Domains.name: List Domains
List Domains.description: Retrieve a list of domains associated with a specified email address.

example.User Query: I'm interested in uncovering the domains linked to the email address max.williams@testdomain.com.

Delete Message.name: Delete Message
Delete Message.description: Delete a specific email message by providing the message ID. Includes error handling for potential issues like 'No module named 'data'. Additionally, provides detailed error messages for troubleshooting.

required_parameters.name: message_id
required_parameters.default: The ID of the message you want to Detele

example.User Query: I encountered an error related to a missing module named 'data' while trying to delete an email message. Can you assist me in resolving this issue?

Fetch Message.name: Fetch Message
Fetch Message.description: Retrieve the message content for a given message ID while handling errors related to module imports.

required_parameters.name: message_id
required_parameters.default: The ID of the message you want to fetch

example.User Query: I need to access the message content for ID #!$%567.

Change Email.name: Change Email
Change Email.description: Change Email tool allows users to update their email address by specifying the current email, new email, and domain. The tool may face module import errors affecting its functionality.

required_parameters.name: email_token
required_parameters.default: OLD Email you want to Change

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.default: Your custom username or email ID

example.User Query: I need to switch my email account from currentuser@oldmail.com to newuser@newmailservice.com

271.tool_description: Proxy Checker is a tool that can test whether a proxy is online, anonymous, and determine if it supports HTTP, HTTPS, or both. This tool has two built-in functions: 1. Retrieve Proxy Information is to fetch the test result of a proxy using its ID. 2. Queue Proxy For Checking is to submit proxies for validation and verification.

Retrieve Proxy Information.name: Retrieve Proxy Information
Retrieve Proxy Information.description: To retrieve a proxy test result, make a request to this endpoint using the 'proxy_id' parameter. Ensure the 'proxy_id' is correctly formatted for identification. Handle errors or unexpected keyword arguments appropriately.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: **User Request ID** - received from the response of sending a proxy for checking.

example.User Query: Could you fetch the test result for the proxy identified by the code x7p4z9q?

Queue Proxy For Checking.name: Queue Proxy For Checking
Queue Proxy For Checking.description: This tool allows users to submit proxies for validation and verification.

example.User Query: How can I check the validity of a list of proxies I have gathered for different locations?

272.tool_description: C Code Compiler is a tool that can provide insights into the latest versions and key features of popular C compilers like GCC and Zapcc. This tool has 2 multiple built-in functions: 1. C Versions is to provide insights into the latest versions and key features of popular C compilers. 2. C Code Compiler is to compile C code files, although it is currently not functional due to import errors.

C Versions.name: C Versions
C Versions.description: Provides insights into the latest versions and key features of popular C compilers like GCC and Zapcc, aiding users in staying informed about advancements in C compiler technology.

example.User Query: What are the key features introduced in the latest version of the Zapcc C compiler?

C Code Compiler.name: C Code Compiler
C Code Compiler.description: The C Code Compiler tool is currently not functional due to import errors. Users may experience difficulties when compiling C code files.

example.User Query: Examine the impact of missing header files on C code compilation and suggest strategies to handle such issues effectively.

273.tool_description: Geolocate is a tool that can convert addresses and places into their corresponding latitude and longitude coordinates. This tool has one built-in function: 1. GET coordinates is to retrieve latitude and longitude coordinates based on a provided address.

GET coordinates.name: GET coordinates
GET coordinates.description: GET request to the "/geocode" endpoint with an "address" parameter to retrieve latitude and longitude coordinates based on the provided address. The response includes latitude and longitude keys. Note: Potential for internal server errors.

example.User Query: Could you please retrieve the coordinates for 456 Rue de la Paix, Paris, France?

Parameters.address: 456 Rue de la Paix, Paris, France

274.tool_description: UUID Generator_v2 is a tool that can generate universally unique identifiers (UUIDs). This tool has one built-in function: 1. Generate UUID is to generate UUIDs and return them to the client, with a specified quantity of UUIDs per request, up to a maximum of 50 UUIDs.

Generate UUID.name: Generate UUID
Generate UUID.description: Generates UUIDs and returns them to the client, with a specified quantity of UUIDs per request, up to a maximum of 50 UUIDs. Error responses are provided for invalid requests.

optional_parameters.name: quantity
optional_parameters.description: Used to determine how many UUIDs you want in the response. Maximum of 50 uuids per request.

example.User Query: I need 1 UUID, please.

275.tool_description: Token API is a tool that can generate a new token for Unlimited Language API. This tool has one built-in function: 1. generate is to generate a new token for accessing the Language API with customizable claims such as region, subscription ID, environment, audience, scopes, and expiration time.

generate.name: generate
generate.description: Generate a new token for accessing the Language API. The token output format is a JSON Web Token (JWT) which includes customizable claims such as region, subscription ID, environment, audience, scopes, and expiration time. Tokens can be tailored for enhanced security and access control.

example.User Query: How can I specify the expiration time for the token when generating it for accessing the Language API?

276.tool_description: CellPhones is a tool that can access detailed information about any phone or tablet. This tool has 3 multiple built-in functions: 1. GetPhonesByBrandId is to retrieve a list of phone IDs for a specified brand known for its camera quality. 2. GetBrands is to retrieve a list of all cell phone brands. 3. GetPhoneDetails is to retrieve detailed technical information and images for a specific phone ID.

GetPhonesByBrandId.name: GetPhonesByBrandId
GetPhonesByBrandId.description: Retrieve a list of phone IDs for a specified brand known for its camera quality. If no phones are available for the brand, an empty list will be returned. The default brand ID is 237.

example.User Query: Which phone models are available for a brand known for its camera quality?

GetBrands.name: GetBrands
GetBrands.description: Retrieve a list of all cell phone brands with potential rate limit errors.

example.User Query: Which cell phone brands have the best overall durability performance and are rated highly for water resistance?

GetPhoneDetails.name: GetPhoneDetails
GetPhoneDetails.description: Retrieve detailed technical information and images for a specific phone ID. The API response may include error messages, such as missing required positional argument errors, with guidance on handling such errors.

example.User Query: How does the API handle potential errors when retrieving technical details and images for a specific phone ID?

277.tool_description: oDesk APIs is a tool that can access and build custom oDesk applications for authorized users. This tool has multiple built-in functions: 1. Get a specific task record is to retrieve specific task records for a user within a company and team based on task codes and format (JSON or XML). 2. List all oTask records is to retrieve all task records for a specific company, team, and user in the requested format. 3. Get My Jobs is to retrieve jobs based on specified criteria such as status, creation time, and user ID. 4. Generating Agency Specific Reports is to generate time reports in various formats for a specific agency by specifying the company and agency IDs. 5. Generating Company Wide Reports is to generate company-wide time reports, excluding earnings-related fields, for users with hiring or finance permissions. 6. Get Specific Job is to return the complete job object for the referenced job. 7. List all Tasks is to pull all tasks assigned within a company, team, or to a specific user. 8. Generating Provider Specific Reports is to access assignment details for providers in various formats. 9. Generate Time Reports for a Specific Team is to generate time reports for a specific team in various formats based on worked hours within a specified date range. 10. Create an oTask record is to create a new oTask record by specifying a task tracking code, description, company ID, team ID, and an optional URL for additional information. 11. Invite to interview is to send job interview invitations to contractors with customizable cover letters. 12. Post a Job is to post a job with required parameters, including job type, start date, and visibility.

Get a specific task record.name: Get a specific task record
Get a specific task record.description: Retrieve specific task records for a user within a company and team based on task codes and format (JSON or XML).

required_parameters.name: code1;code2;...;codeN
required_parameters.description: The specific task codes, the list of codes should be separated with ";"

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username of the target user account

example.User Query: Fetch task records for task codes 19;27;35 in JSON format for user 'specificuser' within company ID 13579 and team ID 24680

List all oTask records.name: List all oTask records
List all oTask records.description: Retrieve all task records for a specific company, team, and user in the requested format.

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username of the target user account

example.User Query: Retrieve task records for company 24680 in JSON format for team PQR with username newuser.

Get My Jobs.name: Get My Jobs
Get My Jobs.description: Retrieves jobs based on specified criteria such as status, creation time, and user ID. The API allows filtering by status, creation time range, user ID, and includes optional parameters for sub-teams, specific user creation, pagination, and sorting.

optional_parameters.name: include_sub_teams
optional_parameters.description: wether to include info about sub teams

optional_parameters.name: created_by
optional_parameters.description: The user ID

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description: Status of Job

optional_parameters.name: created_time_from
optional_parameters.description: Filter from time

optional_parameters.name: created_time_to
optional_parameters.description: Filter to time

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Pagination, formed as $offset;$count

optional_parameters.name: order_by
optional_parameters.description: Sorting

example.User Query: Retrieve jobs created by user with ID 5678, including sub-teams information, sorted by creation time, and paginated to show 10 results starting from the 20th.

Generating Agency Specific Reports.name: Generating Agency Specific Reports
Generating Agency Specific Reports.description: This API allows authorized users with staffing manager permissions to generate time reports in various formats for a specific agency by specifying the company and agency IDs. It is essential to provide accurate parameter values for successful report generation.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: note: format must be specified in tqx parameter, see example

required_parameters.name: tq
required_parameters.default: SELECT week_worked_on, assignment_team_id, provider_id, assignment_name, sum(hours), sum(earnings) WHERE worked_on > '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31

example.User Query: Could you provide a report for team ID 98765 within agency 67890 for the month of February 2022 in XML format?

Parameters.tq: SELECT week_worked_on, assignment_team_id, provider_id, assignment_name, sum(hours), sum(earnings) WHERE worked_on > '2022-02-01' AND worked_on <= '2022-02-28'

Generating Company Wide Reports.name: Generating Company Wide Reports
Generating Company Wide Reports.description: This API function allows users with hiring or finance permissions for all teams within the company to generate company-wide time reports, excluding earnings-related fields. The API supports multiple output formats for reports and has specific date range limitations for report generation.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: note: format must be specified in tqx parameter, see example

required_parameters.name: tq
required_parameters.default: SELECT week_worked_on, assignment_team_id, sum(hours), sum(charges) WHERE worked_on > '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

example.User Query: Generate a report summarizing the total hours worked and charges per week for company ID 67890 in JSON format for the first quarter of 2023.

Parameters.tq: SELECT week_worked_on, assignment_team_id, sum(hours), sum(charges) WHERE worked_on > '2023-01-01' AND worked_on <= '2023-03-31'

Get Specific Job.name: Get Specific Job
Get Specific Job.description: Returns the complete job object for the referenced job, accessible to users with specific permissions. Requires the job reference ID as a number. The response can be in either XML or JSON format.

example.User Query: I need the detailed information for job reference number 98765 in XML format.

List all Tasks.name: List all Tasks
List all Tasks.description: Pull all tasks assigned within a company, team, or to a specific user, emphasizing the requirement of both 'team' and 'username' parameters for user-specific queries.

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username of the target user account.

example.User Query: Show me all tasks assigned to a specific user in team 45678 in XML format

Generating Provider Specific Reports.name: Generating Provider Specific Reports
Generating Provider Specific Reports.description: This API enables providers to access assignment details for themselves in various formats. It does not include monetary fields. Users must specify the provider ID, desired format, date range, and task filters. Note: The tool does not currently support specific provider data retrieval endpoints.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: note: format must be specified in tqx parameter, see example

required_parameters.name: tq
required_parameters.default: SELECT worked_on, assignment_team_id, hours, task, memo WHERE worked_on > '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

example.User Query: Retrieve assignment details for provider ID 24680 in JSON format for the period from April 1, 2023, to April 30, 2023 with a filter for tasks related to 'Project A'.

Parameters.tq: SELECT worked_on, assignment_team_id, hours, task, memo WHERE worked_on > '2023-04-01' AND worked_on <= '2023-04-30' AND task = 'Project A'

Generate Time Reports for a Specific Tea.name: Generate Time Reports for a Specific Team
Generate Time Reports for a Specific Tea.description: Generate time reports for a specific team in various formats (JSON, XML, CSV) based on worked hours within a specified date range. The tool should provide a summary of worked hours by date for a particular provider in the team for the specified date range. The API response structure includes error handling for non-existent endpoints.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: note: format must be specified in tqx parameter, see example.

required_parameters.name: tq
required_parameters.default: SELECT worked_on, provider_id, provider_name, sum(hours) WHERE worked_on >= '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

example.User Query: I would like to receive a time report in JSON format for our team for the month of October 2022.

Parameters.tq: SELECT worked_on, provider_id, provider_name, sum(hours) WHERE worked_on >= '2022-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2022-10-31'

Create an oTask record.name: Create an oTask record
Create an oTask record.description: This API function allows users to create a new oTask record by specifying a task tracking code, description, company ID, team ID, and an optional URL for additional information. The response can be in XML or JSON format, with a required username parameter.

required_parameters.name: code
required_parameters.description: A task tracking code (This defines the task tracking code)

required_parameters.name: description
required_parameters.description: The code's description (This should be a description about the code being added)

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username of the target user account

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: The location where more info on the code can be found (The URL can be used to direct the user to more info about the code being entered)

example.User Query: Create a task with code 555, description 'Implement new feature', for company ID 77777 and team ID 44444 with a URL link to 'https://example.com/feature'

Invite to interview.name: Invite to interview
Invite to interview.description: Sends job interview invitations to contractors with customizable cover letters. Ensure the tool functions correctly and resolves any import issues for accurate responses.

required_parameters.name: provider__reference
required_parameters.description: Developer's unique reference ID. Use it if no profile_key available

example.User Query: I would like to send an interview invitation to a developer with reference ID 67890 for job reference 54321. Can you include a personalized cover letter in the invitation?

Parameters.cover: Dear Developer, We are excited to invite you for an interview for the position at our company. Looking forward to discussing your qualifications further.

Post a Job.name: Post a Job
Post a Job.description: Posts a job with required parameters, including job type, start date, and visibility. Handles errors related to function execution and import issues.

required_parameters.name: buyer_team__reference
required_parameters.description: Reference ID of the buyer team that is posting the job

required_parameters.name: description
required_parameters.default: A new interesting start-up requires an API ecosystem, ...

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: The start date of the Job. If start_date is not included the job will default to starting immediately.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: The end date of the Job. Only needed if job type is 'fixed-price'

optional_parameters.name: budget
optional_parameters.description: The budget of the Job. Used for 'fixed-price' jobs only.

optional_parameters.name: duration
optional_parameters.description: The duration of job in hours. Used for 'hourly-jobs' only.

example.User Query: I want to post a job for a content writing position with an hourly rate and a specific start date

Parameters.title: Content Writing Position
Parameters.description: Looking for a skilled content writer to join our team...

278.tool_description: Mobile Phone Specs Database is a tool that can provide detailed specifications and features of over 10,000 mobile phone models. This tool has six multiple built-in functions: 1. Get {Phone Image ids} by {Custom id} is to retrieve up to 10 phone image IDs associated with a specific custom ID. 2. Get {Specifications} by {Brand Name} and {Model Name} is to retrieve phone specifications based on brand name and model name. 3. Get {Image} by {Phone Image id} is to retrieve an image by providing the image ID associated with a phone model. 4. Get {Specifications} by {Custom id} is to retrieve phone specifications by a specific custom ID. 5. List all {Models} by {Phone Brand} is to retrieve a list of phone models by specifying the phone brand name. 6. List all {Phone Brands} is to retrieve a comprehensive list of all phone brands available in the market.

Get {Phone Image ids} by {Custom id}.name: Get {Phone Image ids} by {Custom id}
Get {Phone Image ids} by {Custom id}.description: Retrieve up to 10 phone image IDs associated with a specific custom ID for image retrieval within 30 minutes. Use these IDs to fetch corresponding images using the 'Get {Image} by {Phone Image id}' endpoint. The image IDs expire after 30 minutes.

example.User Query: I'm looking to retrieve the phone image IDs for custom ID 701234, could you assist me with that?

Get {Specifications} by {Brand Name} and.name: Get {Specifications} by {Brand Name} and {Model Name}
Get {Specifications} by {Brand Name} and.description: Retrieve phone specifications based on brand name and model name. Handle potential errors or exceptions.

example.User Query: I'm interested in the specifications of the new OnePlus 10R 5G model, could you provide me with the details?

Get {Image} by {Phone Image id}.name: Get {Image} by {Phone Image id}
Get {Image} by {Phone Image id}.description: Retrieve an image by providing the image ID associated with a phone model. Ensure that the function accepts the 'imageId' parameter as specified in the required parameters. Note: Addressed unexpected keyword argument issue.

example.User Query: Can you display the image related to the flagship smartphone model from ABC brand?

Get {Specifications} by {Custom id}.name: Get {Specifications} by {Custom id}
Get {Specifications} by {Custom id}.description: Retrieve phone specifications by a specific custom id. This API function retrieves the technical details of a device based on the provided custom ID using the 'phoneCustomId' parameter.

example.User Query: What are the specifications for the device having custom ID 507936?

List all {Models} by {Phone Brand}.name: List  all {Models} by {Phone Brand}
List all {Models} by {Phone Brand}.description: Retrieve a list of phone models by specifying the phone brand name. Ensure the correct brand name is used as a required parameter.

example.User Query: List all available models for OnePlus phones

List all {Phone Brands}.name: List all {Phone Brands}
List all {Phone Brands}.description: Retrieve a comprehensive list of all phone brands available in the market, including those that offer smartphones with high-resolution cameras.

example.User Query: Which phone brands offer smartphones with high-resolution cameras?

279.tool_description: Measurement Unit Converter is a tool that can perform various unit conversions. This tool has 4 multiple built-in functions: 1. Convert from one unit to another is to perform unit conversion by specifying the measurement type, source unit, target unit, and value to convert. 2. Measurements is to retrieve an array of all available types of measurements supported by the API. 3. Measurements detailed is to retrieve a detailed list of available measurements categorized by type, providing information on units. 4. Measure units is to fetch an array of units specific to a given measurement type for conversions.

Convert from one unit to another.name: Convert from one unit to another
Convert from one unit to another.description: This API call performs unit conversion by specifying the measurement type, source unit, target unit, and value to convert. Users can specify units using abbreviations, singular, or plural forms. The response includes the converted value and details. The description now includes potential error messages and troubleshooting tips for common issues.

example.User Query: Convert 3 liters to milliliters

Measurements.name: Measurements
Measurements.description: Retrieve an array of all available types of measurements supported by the API, including examples or brief explanations for each type.

example.User Query: What are some examples of measurements within the category of 'temperature'?

Measurements detailed.name: Measurements detailed
Measurements detailed.description: Retrieve a detailed list of available measurements categorized by type, providing information on units including abbreviations, systems, singular, and plural forms.

example.User Query: I'm interested in learning about measurements related to weight and the various units used for weight.

Measure units.name: Measure units
Measure units.description: This API fetches an array of units specific to a given measurement type for conversions. The response will be in the form of an array containing the units associated with the specified measurement type. It is recommended to provide examples of how to use the API with different measurement types to enhance user understanding.

example.User Query: I'm curious about the units used for energy measurements. Can you provide me with a list of available units?

280.tool_description: All Purpose Complex Converter is a tool that can convert numbers to words, text to speech, numbers to speech, speech to text, and much more. This tool has four multiple built-in functions: 1. Convert Number To Speech is to convert any integer number to speech in various languages. 2. Convert Text To Speech is to convert any text to speech with language selection. 3. Convert Numbers To Words is to convert any integer number to words, including ordinal formats. 4. GET Languages is to retrieve a mapping of language codes to their respective languages.

Convert Number To Speech| Provide Any In.name: Convert Number To Speech| Provide Any Integer Number
Convert Number To Speech| Provide Any In.description: Convert any integer number to speech in various languages, with potential limitations in handling very large numbers and certain languages. Default language is en-us, and users can select different languages using the 'lang' parameter. Note that the tool may not support all languages equally well.

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description:
Select Language , By default  ( en-us ) is supported, 
Hit GET Languages Endpoint to get a list of all supported languages.

example.User Query: I need to convert the number 876543210987654321098765432109876543210 to speech in Japanese.

Convert Text To Speech || Provide Any Te.name: Convert Text To Speech || Provide Any Text
Convert Text To Speech || Provide Any Te.description: Convert any text to speech with language selection. Users can specify the text to be converted and choose the language.

required_parameters.name: text
required_parameters.description:
Support Both Text and Numbers. 
Can Pass Text Such as (\"any Thing to convert\")
or 
Can Pass Any Number such as 1029383833384474
required_parameters.default: I am using All Purpose Complex Converter API for My Daily Tasks.

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description:
Select Language , By default  ( en-us ) is supported, 
Hit GET Languages Endpoint to get a list of all supported languages.

example.User Query: Please convert the text 'I need help with my project' into speech in Spanish.

Parameters.text: I need help with my project

Convert Numbers To Words | Provide Any I.name: Convert Numbers To Words | Provide Any Integer Number
Convert Numbers To Words | Provide Any I.description: Convert any integer number to words, including ordinal formats. The output includes the provided number and its corresponding words in the specified format. Default format is cardinal, with optional formats like ordinal, ordinal_num, year, and currency available. Ensure to pass only integer numbers as input.

optional_parameters.name: to_convert
optional_parameters.description: By Default the number will be converted to cardinal, if you wan to convert it into specific format such as ordinal, ordinal_num, year or currency than you can specify it here.

example.User Query: Convert the number 98765432109876543210 into year format.

GET Languages.name: GET Languages

281.tool_description: HackerRank is a tool that can run codes in many different languages. This tool has two multiple built-in functions: 1. Languages is to provide information on the language codes supported by the code checker. 2. Code checker is to enable users to submit source code for testing against specified test cases using the HackerRank code checker.

Languages.name: Languages
Languages.description: This API provides information on the language codes supported by the code checker, with a focus on potential service unavailability.

example.User Query: How does the code checker API assist in identifying and resolving language code errors?

Code checker.name: Code checker
Code checker.description: A tool that enables users to submit source code for testing against specified test cases using the HackerRank code checker. Users can define the programming language, input test cases, callback URL for response handling, and output format. Note: Users may encounter import errors or technical difficulties during tool usage.

required_parameters.name: source
required_parameters.description: The source code to be submitted

required_parameters.name: lang
required_parameters.description: An integer code of the language

required_parameters.name: testcases
required_parameters.description: A JSON encoded list of strings each being a test case

required_parameters.name: callback_url
required_parameters.description: A callback url, on which the submission response will be posted as a JSON string under `data` parameter

required_parameters.name: wait
required_parameters.description: Wait for the submission to be processed in the request. If set to `false`, the request returns immidiately and submission response will posted through the callback URL.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: Output format as JSON or XML

example.User Query: I have a C++ program that sorts an array using the quicksort algorithm. Can you help me test it with the following test cases: [5, 2, 9, 1, 5] and [10, 3, 7, 1]?

282.tool_description: Disposable Email Checker is a tool that can verify the validity of email addresses to avoid fake users in your database. This tool has one built-in function: 1. Email Validation is to verify the validity of email addresses by checking if the domain is whitelisted and not disposable, providing specific information such as the validity of the domain, whether it is disposable, and the reason for the validation result.

Email Validation.name: Email Validation
Email Validation.description: Email Validation API that verifies the validity of email addresses by checking if the domain is whitelisted and not disposable. It provides specific information such as the validity of the domain, whether it is disposable, and the reason for the validation result.

example.User Query: Please check if the email address test123@disposablemail.com is valid.
